text: Where do I begin!? let's start off by saying that I've heard nothing but great things about this place.. yet have had two crappy experiences.  Two weeks ago, after boating we decided to order some pizza, everyone raved about pequods, so I decided to call in an order. After being on hold for 20 min, I finally got through and placed an order for 2 large pizzas. The girl said 2 hours for delivery.. WTF? Fair enough.. we shall wait, over 2 hours pass and nothing.. I call, on hold for 10 min, finally to have he girl say .. "Sorry, we canceled your order, we don't deliver to the harbor anymore" WHAT!!????? We've been waiting for 2 hours!? Why didn't someone call me or say that!? She apologized and hung up, mind you. I fought with them and my bank for a week because they STILL CHARGED ME!  Fast forward to last night. Again, we want pizza after boating. We see our boat neighbors had pequods and they said it was delivered .. WTF! I call in an order and they said "we don't deliver to the harbor." I say, my neighbors just got delivery! She puts me on hold then processed to take my order... Like REALLY! They delivery when they want!? Anywho... I place an order and her quoted TWO HOURS! We wait, we wait and finally our BURNED PIZZAS ARRIVE! 2 hours and $80 later, our pizza arrived, everyone was super excited and starved and we open the boxes to three burned pizzas. LIKE WOW. Had to eat around the burned crust. Super disappointing .. and I ordered HOT wings and got BBQ.  What a JOKE. Will never order again and will make sure to tell all of my dock neighbors to not bother with this establishment.

I've been there a few times and their pizza is good. They did mess up the last time I was there, they forgot my order, I should have left, but decided to stay (the waitress should have been paying more attention). It feels like they rushed the pizza. About the only thing that is good is the pizza. Their appetizers are blah (mass produced food that gets deep fried), which is not good. Since you are waiting you want to probably enjoy some good appetizers in the meantime and they don't have that.

They have great service and great tasting pizza. The crust comes out burnt so if you don't like burnt crust you should tell them ahead of time. When you get there they tell you the wait is 1hr to 1.5hr, but don't be shocked they usually get a table for you sooner than they say.
The only "deep dish" pizza I like. That carmely cheese... oh man...
Pequod's is my favorite pizza place. I love their caramelized crust no other place can top it.

A co-worker of mine had been telling me to try this pizza for a while and I finally did. It looked more like a pub than pizza place at first glance, but when I received my hot pizza and took a bite, I knew what all that talk was about. This pizza is the real deal!

My fiance and went here last night. We are foodies and try a new place every weekend. The places we try range from 5 star to total dives.  The pizza is amazing. The pizza is totally cheesy and the crust is the best you can get. We also tried a Pequod salad. The toppings were plentiful and the house made Italian dressing is the best I've had. This place will not disappoint.  Ive read some of the other reviews- you dont go to Pequod's for a 5 star atmosphere. You go for the food. If you want a 5 star atmosphere you choose a steak house, etc. This place is perfection and we are thrilled we chose Pequod's for our date night. We went to Distilled for drinks beforehand and also enjoyed ourselves

Good pizza is hard to come by, but the pizza is only half the experience. Service is the other. We are a family of 6 and spent over $100- yeah I know, on pizza. Needless to say, I had a half of a piece I put in the pan to be wrapped with the rest of the pizza.  When the box returned, my half was not in there. The pizza slices are large so a half a piece is a good size. When I inquired about this from the waitress she explained "oh they probably threw it out." I asked "why would they do that" she said "I don't know let me get a manager" Now this is where "poor management" comes into play. I got up to go to the restroom and actually overheard the waitress  telling the manager- Alan- what happened. He shrugged his shoulders and never came to our table.  20 minutes later, after realizing he could care less, I went up to him, inquired about it, and he said "oh they are new." So because they are new they get to decide if they can throw my pizza away or not?!?  I paid for that pizza, it was mine, train your damn staff not to waste people's money (and food). Better yet, train Alan on how to be a manager instead of standing around flirting with all the waitresses.  We drove over an hour from our hotel to spend our money only to get treated as if our business didn't matter.  I wonder what the original owner would think of that!  The pizza is overpriced and the establishment does not appreciate your patronage.

Looking for deep dish pizza. This is your spot.  Divey but authentic Pequods pumps out delivery and in house pizzas. Service is accommodating and eager to please although their busy. Best luck at no wait is off hours or before 5PM.  Loved it but had to give it 3 stars based on the wait, dark/dive atmosphere and fact that they don't mix your salads because people complained about the amount of dressing used...? Like what?  Beware of Cubs games because overflow tends to find itself there after games.

Taste is great but our crust was so burnt we couldn't even chew it. Deep dish crust is what we were looking forward to. We were starving so waiting another 40 minutes for a better pizza wasn't an option. Disappointed!
Holy smokes... that crust was amazing.  If I hadn't burnt my mouth trying to scarf this thing down, I'm sure it would have been even more magical.  Until next time.
Holy wow the best deep dish Chicago pie I have ever had! The longest I have ever had to wait to be sat and fed but was totally worth it! Highly recommended

Never order delivery from these idiots.   They screwed up the order by putting jalapeño peppers on my pizza.  Then when I called the manager tried to give me a credit for a future  pizza and assume that I should just eat pizza with jalapeño peppers.  I explained these would make me sick.  He said they would send another pizza in an hour.  It has been 90 minutes and no second pizza.  They do not answer my calls.   Note that drivers have no change.  Another reason not to do business with this disreputable company.   I've eaten in the restaurant several times and the pizza is great.  When it's busy they fail at customer service.   To be fair, a manager contacted me Video yelp to try to straighten this message out. However his efforts were pathetic. He stated that he wanted to resolve the issue but stood with his manager who banned me.  Then invited me to return. When I pointed out that I did not want to go in there and then be asked to leave, he did not continue the conversation.   While I understand that yelling and using profanity is no way to resolve a situation, they seem to think nk that people should just quietly take being ignored and mistreated when they make mistakes.  I did not get angry until my second or third call three hours after the ordeal began.  Their system has no way of tracking mistakes and service recovery efforts. So I stand by my original advice to not order delivery from them.
Definitely not the best chicago style pizza but it is tasty!  There's not really a crust/rest of the pizza separation so note that.

I wanted to love this place! We ordered a pizza to go and had a beer at the bar while we waited. Service was friendly and accommodating. But the pizza desperately needed salt. The sauce is my favorite part of a pizza, and this one had no flavor. I loved the famed crust of course, but a good crust does not an entire pizza-eating experience make, so I won't be back.

Came here with some friends after the last day of Lollapalooza (Sunday night) a few weeks ago. We got in at 11:30 and Pequod's closes at midnight, so the owner requested us to order our deep dish to go. We were fine with that, given most of us (not me :D) had work the next morning, and so we ordered two pizzas among the six of us to take back home. We waited at least half an hour for the pizza, which is understandable (not sure if this is the average wait time) because it's deep dish and needs to bake for awhile. A few minutes after we ordered, another party of 6 came in, sat at a table (we were sitting at the bar to wait), and ordered. One of our pizzas came out around midnight, but not the other. We had to go up to the cashier and ask him if our other pizza was ready. He went back into the kitchen for another few minutes, to which we were terrified that they had forgotten to even start our pizza, but then came out with it. As we were leaving, we saw food being served to the group that came in after us. I guess the owner was fine with that group eating in the restaurant rather than taking it to-go. We were fine with that too because we had our real lives to get back to in the morning, but I just thought it was odd, perhaps a little unprofessional. Our deep dish pizza was cold by the time we got back to our apartment (a 30-minute drive from Pequod's), but it tasted fine warmed up in the microwave and we were HUNGRY so it was good. It's not the best deep dish pizza I've had -- Zachary's here in Berkeley (Oakland) is still better -- but from what I've heard, Pequod's is better than Giordano's in Chicago. I'll probably come back in the future with enough time to spare before closing time.

All time favorite pizza in the city and maybe even ever... it's amazing! The crust is doughy in the middle and crunchy on the bottom and the caramelized cheese on the edge is the best part. Also has a great cheese and sauce ratio. If you go before 5 you usually don't have to wait but go any later and it can be up to 2 hours BUT you can wait at the bar and get som pre pizza drinks.

Excellent Chicago style deep dish pizza, with their uniquely delicious sauce and 'burned' cheese crust! Make sure to ask for extra sauce either on your pizza, or even on the side. Vegetarian and meat options are both fantastic. There's a bit of a wait usually, even in the middle of the afternoon, so be prepared, or call ahead and get your table bumped to the top of the qu when you arrive! And you can put your order in while you wait, they just won't put the pizza in the oven until you're seated.
One of my favorite place for deep dish pizza. The crust is to die for. The line to dine in is usually long but worth the wait.

This is my favorite pizza in Chicago, hands-down.  It is light and fresh, without the greasy crust most chains have.  I also love the atmosphere; it is very casual and friendly.  It does have long wait times, but it's worth the wait!

Pequod's is the best of the best when it comes to Chicago style pizza! The toppings always taste super fresh. I only had to knock off a star because sometimes the hostesses and wait staff can seem really disinterested. But it's definitely nothing that would ever stop me from eating in or ordering delivery.

The atmosphere is very casual and local. You are welcomed with pretty friendly service. They are nice and patient. The pizza is less doughy and saucy compared to all the other deep dish pizzas. The sauce isn't as tangy. The sleeper here is the meatballs. They are some of the most tender meaty goodness that I have had. The sauce that they come with is rich in flavor and had a subtle smoky flavor to it.

The pizza here is absolutely horrible. I don't get the hype on this place. But I tried it once and never again! The service sucked. Food took FOREVER for us to get it. And when it came it was super burnt and probably the worst pizza I've ever had.

I have been to Chicago before but had never sampled the pizza from Pequod's, instead I usually opt for either Lou Malnati's or Giordano's which this place currently sits behind on Yelp. First impression I think it is fairly ranked depending on what you prefer.   PROS:  - The sauce is really good and nice an peppery. - That ring on the outside is not burnt crust it's actually burnt cheese and they do that on purpose and it's amazing. CONS:  - Not much cheese in the cheese layer below the sauce which surprised me All in all it wasn't my favorite, just because I prefer a cheesier pie - but still very good.  Probably rank it as a tie for second with Giordanos but for different reasons.
The pizza tasted good and didn't take long to come out. The restaurant didn't have enough room to accommodate a large group. The service was also good Overall had a great time and would recommend.

The first dinner of the bachelor party was Chicago deep dish at Pequod's. I've been to all the other places in Chicago, so I saved this one for the party. There were 14 guys, and we ordered two large pies. Order a few pitchers of beers, and that's enough for all. We ordered one pie with sausage and pepperoni and the other was a cheesy garlic pie. I'm getting hungry just writing this review, but they were both great. Caramelized crust, and delicious toppings. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm coming back here for more.

Ok i read so many great things about this place, was gonna go to Berts but didnt want to travel the extra distance, considering he started Pequads I figured it would be close. Well this one going down in institutional longevity, which means they been around so long they sucked the locals into thinking they were good. Tasted like a flavorless piece of Italian bread with spaghetti sauce on it, and some burnt cheese on edge of crust. Disappointing. Lous kills you by miles.

Not going to lie, my experience here was disappointing... the waitress was extremely rude and ruined the experience. The pizza was not very delicious, I don't know much about Chicago deep dish but the crust was dry and it wasn't very flavorful. If you want a good Chicago deep dish pizza do not go here
Great pizza!  Love the crust, sauce and everything in between!  Delicious!  Great vibe and fun place to hang out in a group or your significant other :-)

While the pizza is amazing, the customer service is less than stellar (at least for delivery).  I've frequented Pequods for many years, several times a month.  I finally decided to get it delivered.  I noticed that I was less than a block from the cusp of their delivery zone and almost didn't call until I saw that they would be willing to make "reasonable accommodations."   I was told that it was way too far north (even though they deliver for several more miles south) (about 2.5 miles).  In fact, they tried arguing with me as to where I actually lived, stating that it was far too many miles north of a particular street (that I actually live south of!) Am I bitter?  Sure.  But when they offer "reasonable accommodations," and then argue about the location of my address.... hmm.  no pizza is worth that treatment.

Pequod's is probably my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Their caramelized crust is absolutely incredible. Their lunch special is a secret gem. For $5 you can get a personal size pizza and a drink.

Did not meet expectations. Sauce was bland, not nearly enough sausage, crust was burnt, and minimal taste. I don't really get the hype, but the fried mushrooms were very good. Probably will not be coming back, there are better options out there for Chicago style pizza.

Disappointed in this place to say the least. I expected more based on the reviews and the pictures. Luckily, we found a better place for Deep Dish Pizza. It took a good 45 minutes to an hour to get our food which isn't a big deal because we had no where to be and we assumed it would take that long anyway. The service was the problem. No refills, no checking on us, messed up the pizza when she cut it and rude attitude. If you're a tourist coming through, you'll either love or hate it. Personally, I enjoy eating more than just dough.
This place is always packed... but for a reason! Delicious pizza and they serve alcohol. Just give extra time to wait for a seat especially on a weekend. But once you are seated food comes quick :)

First of all, this is not real Chicago-style deep dish pizza. Everyone needs to stop comparing it to Lou's or Giordano's. Given the hype surrounding this place, I decided to bring my friend from out of town to Pequod's to show her how amazing Chicago deep dish is. It was my first time at Pequod's as well and we were both equally underwhelmed. I wish I would have taken her to a Giordano's instead.  We came in midday on a Saturday and were seated quickly. We started with a small order of buffalo wings, which did not particularly stand out, and then ordered a pizza for us to share. I was impressed with the topping options (including an italian beef option) but we stuck with pepperoni and peppers. Once it arrived, the pizza was soupy and we were disappointed to see it was mostly breading. Perhaps it would have benefited from a few more minutes in the oven, but overall there was just too much sauce. Bottom line: definitely overrated and closer to being a Detroit style pizza.

I had the pan pepperoni. The pizza breaks down like this: 90% cardboard flavored crust, 4% mediocre sauce, 5% ashes of what was formerly cheese 1% razor thin pepperoni. This how a pizza would be made if the only consideration was maximizing the profit, as the cheapest ingredients dominate way beyond what is palatable; then handed off to an incompetent cook staff to burn any flavor right out of the pie. Will not be returning.

Forget Giordano's or Lou's, Pequod's definitely has the best deep dish in town. Whenever we have friends coming in from out of town wanting some deep dish we always take them here.  Main reason we don't come here more often for our pizza cravings is because the wait is usually 1-2 hours on any night of the weekend.   The staff is friendly and the food is great. Definitely order some appetizers since you'll have to wait about 30-45min for the pizza. I'd recommend the breaded mushrooms and bruschetta.

I've only had the deep dish here twice but, both times walked away very satisfied! Ingredients were plentiful (sausage, mushroom, spinach) and although the crust is quite thick, I did enjoy the "burnt" cheese edges.  This pie is probably not for everyone but, judging by the daily packed house and people waiting in line, they are doing something right. Kids got the thin pizza as well and that was very good too. Service was average but, overall no complaints. Seating was a challenge, especially if you have any large people in your group but, manageable. Overall, a good place to get a little different spin on Chicago deep dish pie!!

Two or so hours wait and our pizza was cold in the middle. Crust is just crumbly and soggy. Makes no sense at all that our less toppings pizza was cold and our every single topping on the menu pizza was warm. If you are okay with waiting for two hour for the pizza then go ahead but there could be better options out there.

I got mixed recommendations about Chicago's Deep dish pizza. Some of our friends recommended skipping it, others compared it to a heavy casserole. Our friend and host recommended that we try Pequod's Pizzeria. I'm glad that we did! This Chicago style pizza is deep dish is made with a caramelized cheese crust. So the crust is cheesy-burnt, the bread is light and fluffy and you get a massive amount of sauce and toppings! The small sausage deep-dish easily fed 3 of us (me, K and a friend).  Other than that, the service was great. The setting is bar/pizzeria. There is more seating upstairs. If you reserve with priority seating requests, you cut your wait time in half!  I definitely recommend this style of deep dish!
Would have gotten a 5 star if the cheese bread was better.  Great service. AMAZING CHEESY CRUST! Get extra sauce.  It has really fresh tasting tomatoes.

Heard many reviews and comments about this place and with chicago having many pizza places i figured i needed to compare lou's.... soo that being said i think this place was amazing, not a long wait at all and definitely go again. Galric cheest bread was amazing and the atmosphere was pretty cool but busy.

After see Pequod's featured on the Food Network as one of the best pizza places, we had to stop by on our visit to Chicago. We came here for lunch and enjoyed a deep-dish. I liked that they use a cast iron pan for the pizza.

It looks like a deep dish pizza in pictures, but if the crust is 90% of the thickness, is it a true deep dish? That is exactly what you get with the pan pizza - a thick bread with sauce and toppings on top.. pretty much the opposite of how Gio's and Lou's does it. The worst part was that the toppings were not even cooked (probably because they were sprinkled on top rather than being baked into the pizza). Our mushrooms and onion were basically raw and was pretty nasty to eat tbh. The crust was also badly blackened and had a bad rubbery texture.. we couldn't even eat it. The Pequods salad is also extremely basic. It's just simple lettuce and onion topped with pepperoni and cheese in the shape of a whale. Not worth the $10.

Delicious deep dish pizza that's worth the 45 minute bake time. The sauce is tangy, delicious, and not too salty, and the crust is perfectly thick but crispy. I make sure to go to Pequod's every time I visit Chicago because I always crave a half sausage, half spinach pizza.  Unfortunately, the second time we went, our pizza came out a little lukewarm, and the cheese wasn't hot enough to be oozing out and stretchy. Nonetheless, the flavors were as consistent as the first time we visited, and we left satisfied.

We came here at 11pm right after we landed at O'Hare. It was a great treat to have our first meal in Chicago be what it's most famous for, the deep dish pizza! And I have to say that Pequods didn't disappoint. We ordered a small deep dish to share, which was huge! It was enough for both of us to have again for breakfast one morning. The pizza came out very fresh and hot, and you definitely know it was made to order since it takes 45 min to wait for it! The wait was a little long but worth it. I would definitely recommend to come here!

Look, you either love it or you think its nothing special. The ingredients are great. Sure, sometimes I wish it had a little more sauce, though I've got enough to go around ;) But what sets it apart from the rest is the crust. The caramelized crust makes eating it a delight. It might be the best part. At the other well known Deep Dish Pizza chains in Chicago, more often then not, people don't eat the crust, and that's just sad and wasteful. Shame on them for making dry, thick, no-fun crust.  Stomach real-estate is scarce. Fill your core with good crust.  "Pequod's .. it's crust-have pizza." - me
Open opinion time, peqouds is my new favorite Chicago deep dish pizza place. This location is big and the servers are friendly though it seems a bit unorganized as we had a few people waiting on us.

Not for me. The toppings were good but put on top of thick stale bread. The worst crust I have ever had. I honestly don't understand the line outside this place. And the burning thing? That just tastes like burnt cheese taffy. Lol Well to each his own. This pizza or pizza bread (stale) is not for me.
Hands down one of my favorite pizza spots in Chicago!! The caramelized crust is life!!! Staff is friendly as well although it can get packed on busier days!

Pequods does not have gluten free pizza which I need since I'm a celiac, but my husband wanted to try their pizza so I went with him. He got a deep dish pizza, wine and a salad. There was a 45 minute wait, so I went to grab a gluten free pizza down the street. His pizza arrived at the bar, so I sat down and was eating my pizza as well. The manager came over and told me I couldn't eat my pizza. He also said he needed to ask us to leave. I totally understand there is rules about outside food, so I put the pizza box in my oversized purse, and stopped eating. I thought since the pizza wasn't out that it would be ok. We continued to sit at the bar while my husband (a paying customer) was enjoying his food. The bartender who was very nice came over and asked if my husband needed his food boxed implying we need to go. My husband said he was not finished, and asked if we had to leave. The manager came back over, and aggressively told us he had said we need to leave. I offered to the manager to wait outside with my purse (which had the pizza box in it) while my husband finished. The manager was not having it. I could understand if we were not complying or making a scene, but the manager was totally out of line. My husband barely drank his wine, and had not yet touched his salad. He said he wasn't going to pay for the food if he can't even eat it. The manager said we still had to pay, but couldn't finish. My husband said he wouldn't pay if he can't eat, so the manager took his glass, forks, etc. and threw it all on top of the pizza and told us to leave. This was a terrible example of customer service! I will never go back. This guy seriously had a personal problem, and very unhappy in his own life. I can't believe someone would treat customers like that! Not only did he lose our sale, but we would have came back because my husband actually liked the pizza.
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago if you get it hot from the oven. Carryout is not as good because the steam from the box causes the crust to get soggy.

This is a long overdue review. My friends were asking for food recommendations in Chicago and hands down, this restaurant is what the locals look for in deep dish pizza.  Yes, be prepared to wait long but the great part is that they let you put your order in while you wait for a table. So once you are seated, your pizza is already cooking and waiting to be devoured.  Don't be skeptical on how much a personal sized pizza can fill you up because my boyfriend and I underestimated and actually ended up ordering way too much. The deep dish pizza is so filling especially after ordering a generous amount of toppings.  The crust is cooked to perfection, fluffy as a marshmallow but so much flavor in each bite. Just thinking about the pizza makes my mouth watery. Oh how I wish I could have my hands on a Pequod's deep dish pizza again... It really was love at first sight as you lift up a slice and all the cheese just oozes out.

Called in for a deep dish pizza to go, told it would be an hour, which was expected. Got there and ended up waiting an additional hour for the pizza along with others who had called in. It was a Sunday night, so I could understand it being a little busy, but the fact that I had called in a to go order and had to wait 2 hours for a pizza was absolutely ridiculous. The pizza wasn't even that great when I finally got around to eating it.
Love it, so different than the typical deep dish which I love as well. Great taste you won't get anywhere else!

It was time to try a new pizza place.  Previously a Lou Malnati's and Jet's Pizza only fan, but the last two carry-out experiences at both left me ready to explore other options. Pequod's product performed perfectly.  Totally worth the 1+ hour carry out time.  Totally worth waiting in the pickup line in the restaurant which was packed like the Red Line at rush hour. The pan pizza (their deep dish) was cooked perfectly, with the cheese just crisped just the way I like it around the edges.  The dough was appropriately cooked-through and crispy on the bottom, and offset by the heavenly layer of softness where it met the balanced sauce and toppings.  Ohh, the sauce.  Not too pasty, not too watery, with just the level saltiness and seasoning.  As with most pizza experiences, the sauce made the pizza.  Got my money's worth of toppings.  Cheese layer was thankfully just the right thickness.  The only thing I'd change would be to add the fresh basil later in the cooking process so that it didn't get so crispy too. Totally their own pizza recipe, but I might compare a little to the bumpiness, crispiness, and interest of NYC's Prince Street Pizza, and the dough recipe of Detroit's Pizza Papalis. Absolutely will be returning.

The best deal in Chicago: come during lunch during the weekdays for a personal deep dish pizza and a drink for $5. Pequod's is consistently ranked as one of the best deep dish places in Chicago and I have to say it is my absolute favorite.
The food was great I ordered a veggie/ jalapeño deep dish with extra cheese and it exceeded my expectations. I would definitely come back!

This was my second time having pequods! The first was a super great experience and everything was delicious. The second time around I went with a group. The service and food was terrible. We ordered appetizers that never arrived. Drinks weren't refilled. The pizza arrived super late and burnt!! We ordered a thin crust veggie and one with sausage. I'm hoping the third time is as good as the first time.

Get deep dish pizza with pepperoni and hot giardinera. This pizza warrants 5+ stars, hands down. Skip the apps, salads, and thin crust altogether. Don't expect much from the service or decor. Just get this pizza in your mouth now!

Use to always buy from here, it was one of our favorite places for pizza. Thank God it's not our only place we like to order from. Ordered our normal double pepperoni pizza, extra pizza sauce, extra cooked. Gave my name, exact address including my apartment number and then proceeded to wait for our pizza to be delivered. We waited and waited but our pizza never came. We finally fell asleep a little after 1:00 a.m. Woke up the next morning and had two missed calls from Peqoud's, one at 1:23am and another at 1:30am. I called in my order at 11:48pm. So I called Peqoud's again tonight to explain that we paid for our pizza but never even got a knock on the door, despite me giving them my apartment number(we have a door man to let them into the lobby by the way so no excuse for not coming to our apartment.) The nice lady who answered the phone explained the situation to the manager on duty tonight(Friday night on August 4, 2017) and informed me that the manager said they tried to call twice but I never picked up the phone so they are not responsible for us not receiving the product that we already paid for. I am a professional in the hospitality industry and I am appalled at the response by the management at Pequod's. You expect your customers to not only pay you for a product, but then do the extra work of chasing you down to make sure they receive it? I apologize Pequod's, but I was never taught that this was the way a hospitality establishment was to conduct itself while I was majoring in Hospitality and Tourism Management at Purdue University. Maybe that's why we always rank in the top of the nation for our School of Hospitality and Tourism Management because we choose to educate our future industry leaders on proper etiquette in this industry. I don't want to insult another school by attempting to guess where you source your managers from, but they'd never make it past the first interview if it were my business. So, as happy as I would like to be to continue ordering from you, I will not be doing so for I have little tolerance for bad customer service. That includes not ordering from you for my employees when they work late as I have done the last two months.

After hearing so much about this place, I wouldn't really rank it that high on my list of favorite pizzas. We went around 11:15, and it wasn't too busy. The pizza was good, and the lunch special is an amazing deal, but it wasn't anything spectacular. The wait was around 45 minutes and pizza is super doughy and doesn't have much cheese, and I would have expected the "caramelized crust" that they are known for to be more than just the edges. The servers weren't the friendliest either, so it's not really somewhere I would choose to go back to. But it was an OK lunch.

Pizza is fantastic, and it's something I crave now. Best deep dish I've had so far. Like others say, the waits are something to consider, but we often do delivery anyway. The caramelized cheese is just so perfect - a bit crispy and a bit chewy and just fantastic flavor. Love the pizza. Delicious.
Have a go with the veggie pan pizza with pepperoni and you just will not be sorry. Definitely worth every penny!

I had been to the Morton Grove location many years ago, it was my favorite pizza!  I stopped in the clybourn location a few days ago, and it was "meh".  The pizza was definitely undercooked, and the crust was beyond soggy, and bland.  Usually I would keep the leftovers, even if it wasn't a great pizza, but this one went directly into the trash.  Who would have thought?

This is somewhat unique pizza. Many like it, some don't. Once you know what it is, when you're in the mood for it, it never disappoints. The carmelized cheese edges are great but for me the sauce is a bit too stringent for general consumption. Also, the pan pizza is very thick and bready which makes it no light meal. Other well known pan pizza's are quite different. The thin crust disappointed me . Fairly thick crust for a thin pizza and also, quite bready and not much personality in the crust. Interestingly, the left overs were much better than fresh, IF you heat it up properly. NEVER MICROWAVE PIZZA! It turns into a soggy mess. Try putting it on a frying pan on no more than medium heat. Heat it slowly. The crust will crisp up beautifully, it will heat evenly all the way up through the toppings, and the cheese will remelt and caramelize around the edges on the pan.

Went here on a recommendation. It's just burnt over-hyped pizza. Nothing tasty about it and honestly one of the worst pizzas ever. They boast they are Chicago's number 1 pizza place. If thats the case Chicago pizza has gone down hill since I moved away. This place is junk. I feel like people believe its hype. I am sure you could find better pizza elsewhere. In fact, we had to and threw away all of our gross burnt pizza. My cousins who are also from Chicago and moved to California came back for a visit and went here on a recommendation. They said the same thing. Hopefully people get better taste. Side note: I would rather eat a frozen home run inn pizza
Decent pizza but nothing special or outstanding . We always order the thin crust and it's pretty standard and good .

Personally, I don't love deep dish pizza, pizza in general is never my go to but Pequod's is a great compromise for me and my boyfriend who loves deep dish pizza! I've been here a few times and the pizza is great if you prefer more dough over cheese. They're usually pretty busy so i definitely recommend preparing to wait an hour or so on the weekends.  Also really appreciated them delivering to me when I lived on Adams St (which was one block south of their delivery area). I called on a Saturday night and asked, they had extra drivers that night, we had pizza delivered to us an hour later!

Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down. The wait is a little crazy (especially coupled with the fact that we didn't get to pre-order our pizza like we did at Lou Malnati's) and the space itself is a little too cozy for me (brushed elbows with more strangers than I cared to), but staff is friendly and the pizza is absolutely worth the wait. Everything about this pizza is life. From the crust to the sauce to the cheese to the toppings, everything balanced out perfectly. I found the sauce at Lou Malnati's to be a bit too acidic for my tastes, but that was not the case at Pequod's. Would 100% return for deep dish if I visit Chicago again.

So normally this place is on point when it comes to pizza (thin and deep dish) but I ordered a thin crust last night (7/28/17) and I think the cook was mad at life or something and took it out on my order. I ordered fried mushrooms, a 12 inch thin crust with meatball, mushroom, & onion, a can of Coke & a can of Sprite.  -1The Price: First of all that all came out to $40 prior to the tip (yikes) so I expected the normal magical unicorn dust flavors that Pequod's produces for the price. Nay kind Sir or Madam reader, here's how pizza night went downhill fast... -1The Appetizer: Well the mushrooms had breading that was too salty, and the mushrooms themselves had a weird after taste; like someone spit cinnamon Big Red gum in them before breading them! -1The Pizza: The pizza itself was a whole other hot mess: too much flavorless sauce and an ABUNDANCE of onions. I like onions...but I don't know anyone who likes them this much. I mean they were under the cheese, in the cheese & then for the piece de resistance, on top of the cheese. It looked like someone loaded a tee shirt cannon with onions and shot it on the pizza dead center. As for the meatballs (which should have been the star) it looked like someone took ah(uno/one) meatball chopped it into millionths and then placed the meatball dust on the pizza. The crust was thick and soooper dry. It sapped all the moisture out of my mouth like a 3ply industrial paper towel once it hit my tongue. The abundance of sauce should have helped the crust situation but again if you recall it was flavorless & tasted tinny. It tasted almost as though the sauce went from can to pizza.  This all made for a terrible Friday pizza night. I know you guys get busy but everything is still usually always at the top of the pizza game. I don't want to believe that Pequod's is slipping because it's normally fantastic, but the only thing that tasted right in this order were the cans of pop! So one of you guys need to pop back into the kitchen and give the dude (or dudette) that preps your pizza a hug & a raise or something before this type of quality becomes a Pequod's standard.
Pizza takes fucking forever, but my god it is delicious.

Overrated.  Took a Lyft way out of our way to get to this place based on the great reviews and then waited an hour for mediocre pizza at 9 PM. Gets three stars because the service and environment are good. But I'm from out of town in it for the pizza and frankly they're a lot better options where I'm from in San Francisco.  Won't be back.
I like it, it's unique, beats all the other deep dish in town but the flavor does get boring after awhile and it's really expensive to add toppings

I feel like I need to give Pequod's another chance because so many people have said good things. My first try though wasn't that great. I got a thin crust delivered, so that could be why the crust wasn't crisp. The tomato sauce didn't have flavor and I thought the crust was too thick for a think crust. The bread was a little dense too. I didn't eat much of that. I will give it another try and go for the deep dish next time.

So, I had an appetite for pizza and decided to visit Pequod's. Words can't convey how delectable my food tasted. The waitress was extremely professional, friendly, and energetic. She exuded a contagious energy that brightened my day. The drinks, on the other hand, were weak and nothing to brag about. Overall, i'd highly recommend. 5 stars for food and 3 stars for the drinks.

Amazing deep dish pizza! I have never been a huge fan of deep dish pizza so I was a bit hesitant to eat here! We came in around 7P.M on a Wednesday night and we were immediately seated on the second floor. We came as a group and ordered the full order of hot wings as an appetizer! They were loved at the table, spicy enough to satisfy you, but not enough to burn your mouth. I ordered a full order of a caesar salad and split it with my boyfriend. The salad was large enough for both of us and even had some extra to share with another person. However, the salad was very plain and only had 5 croutons on top of it! Another negative about the salad was that they give you the dressing on the side so you have to mix it! Do not get the salad, nothing special to it. We ordered two medium pan pizzas for the table. One was pepperoni and jalapeño, and the other pizza had meatball, Italian sausage and pepperoni (pictures attached). The pan pizzas were both big enough for a group of 5 people (2 children) and we even had to take some home! I highly recommend coming here!

My personal favorite deep dish pizza in the city! The pizza is delicious, and I normally don't love deep dish pizza. I love the crispy pepperoni as well. The only negative thing I will say is that we ordered a Caesar salad as an appetizer and it was literally a bed of lettuce with about 4-5 croutons and that was it, and it wasn't even the right kind of lettuce for a Caesar. The dressing wasn't mixed in either, so it was not at ALL worth it to get the salad. However, take it for what it's worth--their specialty is deep dish pizza and not salads. If you've ever heard of Pequod's before then you probably know this, but expect to wait a LONG time for your table--but it's definitely worth the wait!

Oh my goodness. This is my favorite deep dish pizza place of all time. You can't go wrong with any type of pizza here.  I always get extra sauce on my pizzas here which makes them ten times better. You HAVE to go here if you are in Chicago and love pizza.

For the people who give this place a bad review due to "burnt crust" are idiots. That is caramelized parmesan cheese baked into the dough as it cooks. Due a little homework if your visiting or ask about it at the time you get the pizza.  So if your looking for a great deep dish pizza then this place is top 3 in Chicago   Suggest getting the sausage. All the sausage is specially made with their recipe from a local meet place in Chicago. It will take some time to get the food so be patient. Staff is great and efficient. Keep in mind it's hard to just walk in during the dinner time or weekend evening and get a seat. It can take 2 hours if you don't have a reservation. The pizza is top notch. I cannot speak to the rest of the menu, but who goes here and orders anything else anyway.

I have eaten at Pequod's and have had it delivered.  Both are extremely delicious and the delivery enables one to not have to wait forever.  Their spinach/garlic pan is so delicious with the caramelized crust.  The last time it was delivered, the pizza seemed a bit doughy and I would have liked it to have more cheese/tomato sauce.  Perhaps it was a random occurrence since I don't remember Pequod's being super doughy like this before.  I have also tried their thin crust with basil and it is delicious.  I recommend Pequod's for both deep dish and thin crust.  All of their ingredients are well-done and they do not skimp on them.

Always delicious, whether it's the pan or thin. I like the somewhat crispy outer crust, and plenty of toppings. I prefer to get delivery (call ahead, with plenty of time to spare) but the atmosphere there is fun. oh, and the wings are awesome.
Not a bad place for pizza if you're really hungry, but being from Chicago I wasn't really impressed with the pizza. Definitely have had better, just doesn't taste how chicago pizza should.

I came to Pequod's because I was visiting Chicago and heard it was THE place to get Chicago deep dish pizza. After waiting over an hour to to be seated, we placed our order and got a salad, some garlic bread, and the deep dish pizza with various toppings. Our appetizers came out fast but the pizza took over an hour to come. The reason for the two stars was that they totally messed up our order. The toppings we wanted were all wrong. I was tempted to correct the order but thought the new pizza might take another hour to come and we were starving, having waited for two hours. I did not find the pizza we did get very good. This was my first deep dish experience so maybe I just don't like deep dish but I found the pizza to be bland- bread with a ton of bland sauce, a little cheese and a mountain of toppings I didn't want. I heard I should try Giordano's so will the next time I visit Chicago. I think this place might be a little overrated.

This deep dish pizza is amazing, from the toppings to the caramelized crust. I recently came to the Pequod's on Clybourn on a trip to Chicago and felt at home in the restaurant. It smells great, and there's a great atmosphere. If you like eating pizza and watching sports, this is the restaurant for you.

Baby Friendly: 5 stars Kid Friendly: 5 stars We had lunch here last week on a weekday, and it was good.  The lunch special is a great deal! Pequod's isn't my favorite pizza, but it is a solid Chicago pizza (and that is saying something).  I wasn't impressed with the salad or garlic bread, so don't order those.  Get the deep dish pizza.  We had a deep dish spinach lunch special, and a large deep dish spinach and onion.  Both were great. The staff was really friendly and helpful. This place is very kid friendly.  We brought our baby in his car seat.  They have wooden high chairs for kids, and they flip them upside down to hold the baby car seat.  This is super helpful.  They were friendly to the baby.  There were other tables with young children, and they all seemed happy and well treated.   The place that make's Pequod's super family friendly?  The family bathroom!  We were seated upstairs, and the women's bathroom was small so I asked if there was a place to change the baby.  The server pointed me to the family bathroom and I was so impressed.  The family bathroom is big, has a sink in it's outer part and a stall with a koala care changing table in it.  So either parent (or both parents) could bring all of the kids in together!  That is fantastic!  Way to go Pequod's! Also, what kid doesn't like pizza?

I've tried giordano's and pequod's now and I can see why people like both. However, I think I might choose pequod's over giordano's because of the way the crust is made. I liked that the crust was crunchy and the pizza was soft. I created my own toppings when I went and got mushroom, onions, and sausage. Choosing the toppings I think can also make or break the pizza flavors. It seems like this place is always busy so know that there will be a wait. I didn't know this because it was my first time there. But you can call ahead to have your name written down, and once you get there, they will move your name up to the top. So you do still have to wait, but it won't be like an hour. Once you place your order of pizza, know that it will take about an hour to make the pizza. So it's probably a good idea to order appetizer if your starving. I ordered the jalapeño poppers which were fantastic! Recommended to us by our server. It was just me and my bf that was there so we ordered an appetizer and a size small for pizza. Size small has 4 slices but keep in mind that it's a chunky slice. I was able to only eat 1 slice because It's so much going on in just 1 slice.

This pizza is absolutely to die for.  The only downfall is that there is only one Pequods.  The dining in experience is a must at least once although the wait can be very long.  I usually order for pick up anytime I am in the area (I live downtown).
The pan pizza had an excellent buttery crust that complemented the loads of toppings well!
I think I just had a religious experience at this place and now worship all things with Giardiniera. A literal flavortown in my mouth rn.

Hmmm delicious... the crunchy cheese on the edge of the crust is so good. It is a bit outside of the more common and touristy areas and I am glad we ventured out here. Had Lou Malnati's last time, which I very much enjoyed, but I think Pequod's is even better. Lunch special is a really good deal too!

Once again, the magic of yelp has led me to glory. This place is excellent. Unlike the super deep dish (Also delicious) at other local places, this pan style is equally tasty but less filling (therefore more pizza gets ingested).  Maybe the highlight, is that its more of a local gem and not massively crowded like the big deep dish venues. I would recommend!

My favorite pizza in the city, yep even better than Lou Malnati's which I never thought I would say about any deep dish ever. Love love LOVE this place. Gets CRAZYYYYY packed though so watch out for that and plan ahead of time during cubs games.

Had lunch there last week....servers and bartender, a lady, were very unfriendly and indifferent. First pizza came out Luke warm, sent it back to re heat. Place isn't horrible, but certainly, imho, not worth a return visit.

Hello, FOOD SNOB here. I would have given this place another star but they really need to have a better air conditioning system. Especially when it is 90 degrees outside. It is very uncomfortable when your sweating and eating hot pizza. The pizza was good but I wish I could have enjoyed it more. I especially loved the CARAMELIZED Crust. Great environment. Great service. There was a show on one of the cable stations rating this Pizza 2nd best in the country.I dont think its quite that good, but it is good.
Ordered deep dish, waited, waited. Received undercooked and burnt crust on edges and then to boot the waitress says "it's our special crust it's not burnt"

You may want to rethink fat shaming in your restaurant. I was visiting a friend in Chicago recently and she brought me to Pequod's. Great pizza! But when I went to the bathroom there was a Bally's Fitness poster that said, "Yeah, maybe it does make your butt look big." Really? And in a Pizzeria? Also, there was nothing of the sort in the Men's restroom. Nice one Bally's! Nice on Pequod's!
Awesome lunch special. One of the best in the  city. And the pizza is excellent. Does get packed. How can you beat that price though?

I've grown up eating deep dish, but this was my first time at Pequod's and it was great! I expected a very long wait, but we went on a Sunday around 4:30/5 and were told the wait would be about 45 minutes. They have some seating outside while you wait, or you could go next door and get a free soft drink with your buzzer. I had just gotten my drink when the buzzer went off- our wait was only 20 minutes, which was a pleasant surprise. Being deep dish, there was also a wait after you order but the server said ordering just cheese may make the wait shorter. We got some salad and waited less than a half hour for pizza. The sauce was really good, and the crust wasn't as filling as other deep dish spots I've had. Overall, worth it to check out!

When in... Chicago, you must try a deep dish pizza. It is my first go at a Chicago style pizza & my friend picked the best place that offers generous portions of toppings, cheese & red sauce. We kept our pie simple with 2 toppings: mushroom & sausage. A good decision because the pie with 1 inch of all it's goodness was rich in flavor & filling after one slice. I can also taste the fresh ingredients, which makes this pizza a standout as well.

We were excited to try a new deep dish pizza, but unfortunately were extremely disappointed. Our waitress seemed bothered by our request and was a bit rude. We ordered well done hot wings, were given regular BBQ wings, and when the waitress was informed, a different waiter bought out the same BBQ wings cooked a bit longer with the same BBQ sauce on it and some hot sauce on the side. A hair was found in one of our personal deep dish pizzas and the others weren't that great. Finally, splitting our bill was a big to do, we were charged more for the drinks when she split the check. We definitely won't be returning.

If you want Chicago style deep dish (not from a chain) GO TO PEQUOD'S!  We went to a Cubs game and wanted to grab some pizza after while we were in town. We happened to be with someone from Chicago who told us about Pequod's...as we were planning on going to a different place. So happy we changed our mind and went to Pequod's.  It was a Friday night so we knew we would have to wait...luckily our friend called ahead and put our names down for call ahead seating. We ended up only waiting about 10 minutes for our table of 4.  We got a large pan pizza...half pepperoni half italian beef and hot giardiniera. I don't normally like thick crusted pizza, but this pie was amazing. I also have never had giardiniera before - and that was life changing!

Yum! Long wait!  Went at 12:45pm on a Sunday. It was packed, but we got a table for two within about 20 minutes. Our pizzas came about 45 mins after ordering (which was quicker than the expected 50-60 minutes).  Got two deep dish personal pan pizzas, one pepperoni and one with pepperoni and veggies.  The crust wasn't too massive (which is why I don't like Giordano's), but I didn't think it had much flavor either. The toppings were nicely cooked and there was a good ratio of sauce and cheese. Nice atmosphere, the front windows open, good selection of drinks and apps to keep you satisfied while waiting on the pizza. There must have been group seating upstairs, but the downstairs has a bar and two and four tops.  Next time I'm going to pop over to the new nail place just across the street to get a quick mani while waiting!
Took a long time to come out and the refills were slow.  But the pizza was very good.  We ordered a deep dish with olives, onion and mushrooms.

DO NOT COME HERE. Yelp usually doesn't let me down, so I'm really sad that it has this time. These reviews are completely inaccurate. We waited 45 minutes just to be seated and another hour for our deep dish pizza to come out. I had Giordano's last time I came to Chicago and wanted to share this amazing experience with my boyfriend. Instead we were presented with a thin burnt crust on our deep dish and a ridiculously long wait. Was not worth it at all.
One of the top five Chicago pizza joints. Love this place!

It had been so many years since I was at this location and, wow, what a change in crowd! I mean, still a young crowd but we got older, but it was never nearly as packed back in the day as it was this week. What a crowd! We called ahead and got priority on the seating list and that made a big difference, but we were fortunate enough to immediately get two seats at the bar and get served quickly and place our order quickly with a great bartender. Our salad and appetizer came super quickly which made the wait for our ever delicious Pequod's Pizza a little easier. I didn't want an iceberg and romaine mix and the bartender was happy to have spinach swapped out for my side salad order. Very accommodating. Our classic, deep dish Pequod's pie came within about 30 to 45 minutes, piping hot. Delicious as always! Caramelized rim of the crust and top as always! I'm so used to going to the Morton Grove location, which I love, yet I was not disappointed in coming to the Clybourn location!
deep dish peperoni is as good as it gets!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Chicago has so many options for deep dish or pan pizza, but that caramelized cheese crust sets Pequod's apart from everywhere else. I usually like to save my crust for last to dip into whatever fallen toppings are on the plate, but that crust is just too good to wait. Eating at Pequod's means that you may wait for 45+ minutes for a table, but fresh in the restaurant is the best way to eat it. I've ordered it for pick and delivery and while it's good, it doesn't stand to the excellence of dining in.  Their sauce is so well seasoned, the crust is crispy and they have fun toppings to choose from (pineapple, variety of olives... what can I say, I'm easy to please) and it even tastes good reheated. Waiting to dine in or delivery can be a little tedious, but once you're eating that pizza it's easy to forgive and forget.    Pequod's is a vessel filled with crispy, cheesey, gooey, oily goodness and my mouth is Moby Dick and I'm gonna destroy and consume everyone and everything on board.
This is my LEAST favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. The burnt Carmel crust was disgusting. Def won't be returning.

Goodness gracious this place is magical.  My favorite Chicago pizza spot by far. I take everyone visiting the city here and have yet to find an unimpressed customer that I've brought in.  If you're planning on lunch, you should be able to get a table pretty quick. Towards the late afternoon/dinner time, I'd recommend making a reservation. LONG wait times, so be prepared otherwise!
The best pizza in the city! Every time my family comes in from out of town, this is a must try. No one does deep dish like Pequod's

Always have their amazing pizza when I can. Love the lunch deals and I love the burnt cheese crust. The wait is typically pretty long but it is definitely worth it for this pizza. I am the kind of person who does come here during the less crowded times. Make sure you go during lunch for the 4.95 lunch special. Also there is a bar next door where you can have a drink while you wait. The buzzer will work in there while you wait.  I do like sitting on the second floor better as it does feel cozier, especially for how long you have to wait, and they service I get up there is typically better. The past few times I have been here the servers have not been too warm and welcoming and it looked like they were just fed up by the huge crowds and lines. Us customers just can't help it when the cooks make this pizza so addictive so we keep coming.  This is definitely a local mostly location and the best place in my opinion for deep dish in Chicago. This is coming from someone who doesn't pizzadiscriminate.
Best deep dish pizza on the planet! Seriously. Takes a little while to cook, restaurant is usually packed, but it's worth it.
Service was great, but our pizza was burnt and dry - couldn't taste the caramelized crust at all.

Love the pizza and wings!!!  Service is okay. Wait for delivery is usually 1:45 minutes so I end up picking it up which isn't ideal because It's usually a mad house in there. If they could improve the delivery service I'd give five stars for sure.

One of the trademarks of Chicago cuisine is its deep dish pizza. While the origins are unclear, deep dish has been a critical defining element of Chicago food for decades, and every time I visit Chicago, I am compelled to go to at least one deep dish pizzeria. Having tried Giordano's and Lou Malnati's in the past, I decided to give Pequod's a try. Located in Lincoln Park, it was rather out of the way of everything else I wanted to do (namely sightseeing in the Loop, and shopping in Chinatown), but I wanted to try it at least once. At the time of writing this review, the base price for a large deep dish is around $18 with no toppings, and then about $2.50 for each additional topping. When it comes to pizza, I like to have many toppings, so I got pepperoni, sausage, Canadian bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms, onions, and green peppers. I shared the pizza with 3 other people. I felt that for my appetite, I should have shared the pizza with 4 others instead of 3. The pizza is very thick and filled with toppings. I only managed to eat a single slice - though I did have one piece of garlic cheese bread before that (fairly standard as far as that flavor went). The pizza was perfect deep dish - the crust was crunchy, the cheese was layered and thick, and the toppings all blended together nicely. One of the downsides of deep dish, I feel, is that it's not nearly as good when delivered, because of how thick the pizza is. The pizza gets soggy quickly, and towards the end of the meal I already started to feel the cheese start to be more solid and not as tasty. The trade off is that deep dish, when eaten fresh, is incredibly rich and full of flavors. There are different schools of thought as to whether or not deep dish is "real pizza" - some say that pizzas are meant to be more flat and meant to be a nice balance of 50% crust and 50% toppings, whereas others would say pizza is pizza as long as the ingredients are there. Regardless of the case, I do feel deep dish is an incredibly unique way to experience pizza, and it is honestly my preferred way of eating pizza. Pequod's ranks easily as the best deep dish I've had yet, and may be one of the best pizzas I've ever had.

Made a reservation for a busy Saturday night. I highly recommend doing so if you're not up for an hour and a half + wait time. Honestly, I understand the whole concept of deep dish pizza--but Pequod's pizza had too much bread and not enough sauce and cheese. Everyone in my group agreed. We also got the cheesy bread: very basic Italian bread with mozzarella cheese and no special seasonings. I give three stars for the fact that we were able to order our pizza along with our reservation and they were already cooking our pizza when we arrived. Definitely cut down on wait time!

Went to Pequod's for the first time and I must say the pizza was good. It has a crispy texture to it that I really enjoyed. The appetizer platters were run of the mill type but the sauces were rather tasty.  I must admit between the crowds and rude servers I won't be rushing back anytime soon. It was my son's 30th birthday and everything was sort of thrown at us. We had to serve ourselves, pour our own waters, get our own napkins, and the waitress didn't stop by to ask us how we were doing. We had to get the manager to get us another round of drinks. No birthday wishes or offers of a type of dessert. She was pretty much running on fumes and didn't want to bother doing anything else for us. So waiting for over an hour to be seated in a jammed packed place with servers giving us stink eye, difficult parking and spending $5.95 for a Miller Light, I think there are other places that have comparable pizza,professional/ cordial servers, with plenty of parking.

We stopped in for pizza having been told this is one of the best in Chicago for deep dish and they weren't wrong. However, in trying it for the first time, I don't think my husband and I are a fan of the pizza style itself. The service was wonderful, pizza arrived quicker than what we were told to expect, and the environment was great. I just wasn't a fan of the sauce and my husband didn't like the crunch of the bottom crust. Great pizza, just not our preferred way to eat it. We'd probably go back, just to try the thin crust version!

My brother raved about this place and took us here for some deep dish pizza while in town. And let me just say, it was amazing pizza!! The crust was thick and well done, but not overly done. And the toppings were a plenty. My SIL and I also shared the Pequod salad (a half order) and it was really good as well. Only downside is the service we had was terrible. The waitress never came back to check on us or refill our drinks throughout our entire meal. We got the deep dish pizza at least 15/20 mins before the thin crust, so our kids were starving...we had to even ask twice where the thin crust pizza was. We asked for a to-go box and the waitress brought us a completely flat (not put together) box and sort of tossed it on the table. Service aside, I would definitely go back if I am in town, because the pizza is really really good.

10 inch deep dish was the perfect size for two. Each bite was a chewy, doughy, dry mess! Not nearly enough cheese or sauce.  But, hell, at the end of the day, pizza is pizza and I ate it all.  Overhyped.

I usually love this place. This is my favorite deep dish in the city, mostly because they're made in those cast irons, which gives the crust a fantastic crispy caramelized exterior. One time I came, I got a pretty limp pizza though. Trying not to hold it against them.

Incredible pizza. The crust is a thing of beauty, like fresh baked bread but caramelized and seamlessly integrated into the rest of the pizza. The wait times and limited space in the restaurant are the only drawbacks.

Kind of disappointed by the pizza here. It was good, but there was too much dough for my taste. My friends loved the place though. If you like a cornmeal crust then this is definitely the place for you.

Wow 5 Stars without a doubt for Pequods delicious deep dish pizza! Known as the newest favorite pizza and deep dish in Chicago. Many locals and especially tourists are more familiar with the popular pizza Chicago brand names such as Lou Malnatis, Giordanos and Uno but there is a new favorite in town in Pequods. Loaded with toppings, surrounded by a crispy and cheesy yet light and airy crust, Pequods delivers a unique approach to the ever traditional deep dish in Chicago. Located in Lincoln Park, Pequods is a tiny restaurant pumping out a lot of ZA! With a tremendous following, Pequods is a favorite to a lot of people in Chicago. I have never tried the thin crust but a lot of people swear by it.. I enjoy a crispy thin crust but when I'm going here there is no doubt I am getting the loaded pepperoni deep dish. It is an incredible pizza and will leave you in a serious food coma.

Deep Dish! I literally came from New York to try this pizza! My girlfriend is a Pizza lover, so after asking around and doing some research we landed in Pequads! The cast-iron plate makes a big difference, and as my pallet continues to evolve you can taste the different seasoning! Worth the travel!  Check out my instagram for places to visit and eat @expensive_appetite

Fantastic pizza! We love how the cheese was well done on the edges and the crust was perfection. We got there around 1:30 in the afternoon and got into a booth right away. By the time we left there was a long line of people standing along with a few sitting outside. Our waitress was friendly and attentive and we really enjoyed the chill vibe there. Definitely a place to put on your list if you are visiting Chicago.

fast service pizza is ok a friend of mine recomend this place i order mediam peperoni 1/2 whit mushrooms and jalapenos when the pizza arrive omg was a lot of jalapenos like i order extra also order the apetizer was ok

Pequod's is AMAZING. They have such good pizza with a beautifully blackened crust. It does not taste burnt at all - it is crispy and savory. The line is out the door always and it does take some time for the pizza to be made but with all of that in mind you should definitely check this place out if you are ok with waiting/a patient person. I've had a lot of deep dish pizzas in my life but this one is especially spectacular. All of the toppings are delicious too! Good for vegetarians and meat lovers

I'm a huge NY style/thin crust pizza person. I feel like you get so much more of the flavor that way. But, obviously, coming to Chicago, I had to give the authentic deep dish a try. Many recommended Pequod's as one of the best deep dish pizzas. We planned it out right by going in the late afternoon. We were able to get seated right away, but it still takes 45 minutes once you are seated to get the pizza. Imagine if you had to wait in line for 2 hours and then 45 minutes after getting seated? That's the norm for a place like this. We went with the regular cheese and added some green peppers. Didn't want to compromise the authentic cheesy taste too much by adding too much. The pizza was delicious and one medium was perfect for 3 people. Boy is it cheesy and bready. But, not too much bread as I was expecting. I liked how the crust was crisp, giving it more flavor and helping it stay together well. I think the crust was pretty memorable - they flavor it very well, and it's the perfect amount of crisp.. The cheesiness was exceptional, as you could see it as you pulled apart each piece, which you want with pizza, am i rite? Glad we were recommended this spot when visiting. Hope to be back soon!
Top 2 pizza places in Chicago. They don't skimp on toppings unlike some of the other pizza places. Definitely worth the price and wait every time.

Came to Chi-town for vacation so naturally we needed to get some deep dish pizza! Pequod's Pizza was recommended to us by our Uber & it was INCREDIBLE. Noel had awesome recommendations & really took the experience to 11. James Dirt was also super accommodating & helpful. 10/10 overall! Next time I am in Chicago I will be back!!
I bring my family and friends visiting Chicago to this famous hot spot for some genuine deep dish. Sitting at the bar is my favorite spot, but be aware of the amount of take out people order.

Best pizza I've ever eaten in my entire life! Not even exaggerating... they also have a pretty decent beer selection which makes this place a 5 star review. This is a MUST if you are visiting Chicago!

The first time I was here, there was no wait (we came super late on a weekday). This was a few years ago while on vacation, but it was SO good that I remembered it. Fast forward to the present, I had to go back and again, it was soooo goood. Waited about 30min this time but still worth it. Definitely a must eat in Chicago. I've also had Giordano's and it was mediocre. If you're going to try deep dish then you gotta try Pequod's!

Worth the wait!! Get your spot in line, then go next door to Whale Tale while you wait (30-45min for us on a Saturday evening). The bar is owned by the same people, so even if you aren't finished with your beer before the table is ready, they'll radio over and hold your table.  This pizza is a MUST when you're in Chicago. Authentic deep-dish. Not too much cheese or too much sauce, and the perfect amount of crunch in the crust. Pequod's salad was a great choice as well. Very friendly waitstaff.  Four of us shared a pitcher, a salad, and a large pizza with more than enough food to go around. We creeped on a guy sitting at the next table over who had some pesto ravioli that looked pretty delicious as well!

We checked out this Chicago pizza place on our way home from road tripping to the west. We picked it because it had great reviews on none other then YELP.COM. my husband and I have been to Chicago a few other times ( mostly just flying into and out of O'HARE) so we have had other deep dish/ pan style pizza. Unfortunately this pizza was just ENNNN, nothing too special but it wasn't bad. The edges were crispy and blackened, melted cheese and slightly greasy pepperoni, the good kinda. Other pizzerias defiantly have better style pizza with lots of layers of cheese and mountains of toppings more like a pizza cake. Pequod's was 90% dough, layer of sauce and the traditional cheese and pep. Also it roughly took about 40 mins for the pizza to be fully completed, ( which was a really long time for to-go order placed on a Tuesday at roughly 2 pm --- I cant image how long you would have to wait if your going/ ordering at a busy time ) which is kinda of a long wait for 1 medium cheese and pep pie...  I don't think we would come here again because basically it was just okay, nothing special, just an average pizza & an atrocious wait time..
Unbelievable chicago pie! Asanty, I feel sorry for you. The fact that you would even consider Domino's as actual pizza. Your comments should be stricken from the records.

This was our final deep dish pizza experience before we left Chicago, and it did not disappoint, the crust was nice and crispy and the pizza had a nice velvety texture, plus the sauce was quite tasty. We didn't have to wait for a table which was nice

After a movie at Webster this place is awesome.  If you like deep dish pizza with that crispy edge of cheese... oh yeah!  Decent prices and a great lunch special for a slice and drink. There can be a wait sometimes which sucks, but the pizza.... YUMMY!

It all depends on my mood, I guess, but between this place and AoP (get it?) I have trouble deciding which is the best in this neck of my woods.  I like alot of sauce so I'll always order extra since I don't think they put enough on it for my taste.

Good place, really. Comfy room and great service. I can't find a single thing to complain about, but I have a hard time coming up with a big compliment either. The pizza was good, but not exciting. The charred edges of the crust were nice but the dough to toppings ratio here is a little bread heavy for my taste. I enjoyed it and have no complaints, but it's hard to come up with anything that impressed me overall. The people were nice, but not overwhelming. Bottom line, don't be afraid to visit this place. You'll enjoy it. It's a good spot with good people. You probably won't find yourself raving to your friends about it later though.
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago hands down. Be prepared for a long wait but it is worth it.

Ask 5 people in the city what their favorite pie is in Chicago and I would bet that 4 would say Pequod's. When people come to visit from out of town, this place is my go-to for the pizza portion on their trip.

Grew up in Morton Grove, a few minutes drive from the original. May be the best pizza in the US! This location has late hours, befitting it's location, and been here many times with my daughter. Always had good food and service.

Best pizza in Chicago by far! Im not a fan of crust on any of my food but when I'm eating this pizza its my favorite part. I dined at the one in Morton Grove for my boyfriends 21st birthday & tonight this one. I personally like the Chicago location better but both have just as great pizza & service.
Great pizza with a great environment too! It seems to always be busy but the wait is never as long as they say!
Not exactly the best deep dish pizza in town. However, the sauce was probably the best part of eating this extra doughy pie. Sorry but I would rather order some Domino's pizza.
Bomb pizza, great beer.  Staff was awesome, so was the dessert.  What more do you need?

Deep dish and thin crust are both still the best in Chicago! And everyone knows Chicago has the best pizza in the U.S.  I've been coming here for more than a decade and the quality has been consistent throughout.  Always made with plenty of fresh toppings and a perfectly baked snappy crust.  I wish I lived closer so I could go more often.

Ok, so after what must have been a year of planning, procrastinating and failing to get into this place for dinner, a group of us finally braved the wait, the 50-minute pizza prep time and went in. The good - the pan pizza (we got pepperoni with pepperoncini) was REALLY EXCELLENT. Long after my stomach was overfull with the pizza my taste buds were still craving for yet another slice. Seems like a sure way to pick up some serious weight... The less good - the service is somewhat rough. There seemed definitely to be a feeling of "we're so good and so popular that we'll do what we want, treat you how we want to and if you don't like it there are a 100 people waiting behind you". Yes, yes, you're good and popular and all, but service is still supposed to matter. This is the only reason for my not giving 5 stars. I hope they pay more attention to that. Still a great experience.

I have to agree with another reviewer that the reviews of this place have to be inflated or fake.  I finally ordered from Pequod's and I cannot believe how tasteless the pizza is.  I ordered 2 pizzas and a pan pizza to make a decent judgment call and my family and I could not get past one piece.  This is nothing but bland bread with thick ragu and some cheese.  The pan pizza was just thicker bread with more ragu and burnt cheese!  One of our pizza's had sausage, we honestly thought they were more like meatballs and again.....tasteless!!  There are hundreds of small pizza places in a 5 mile radius of this place that know how to make a knock out pizza that represents what pizza is supposed to be......go there and skip this.  I now understand why there is always a line....it's dirt cheap.....if it were expensive they would have closed years ago.

I hadn't eaten Chicago-style deep dish pizza for over eight months and was really forward to dining at Pequod's. The pizza was just average, nothing special, though I really like how Pequod's cooks the top of the crust. Will still go back but other Chicago-style pizzeria's are just as good or better.

Any time we have family/friends visiting from out of town, this is where we get their deep dish fix! Expect to wait to get in (a few spots around you can hang out at) and it takes about 45 minutes to cook the pizza. This is not bad service, it's typical so just be prepared. Their appetizers are really good --- the cheesy bread is super delicious. The place is nothing fancy but is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Their crust is what makes it!

The lunch special available on weekdays -- $5 cheese pizza with choice of pop -- is the best. I visited Pequod's with a family member and we weren't disappointed. Friendly wait service. You may have to wait for it to cook, but it's worth it.

This is the epitome of a Chicago deep dish. The wait was a bit long (around 45 minutes for me), but it was worth every minute. The caramelized crust and the thickness of the breading underneath all the sauce and cheese was perfect. i loved how thick the pizza was and how everything just came together. I got mushrooms and sausage on my pizza and it was just amazing. I do have to note that it's best if you come in a party of 3-5 so that you can share the whole deep dish!

I fly out from Los Angeles and come straight here. Best pie I've ever found in Chicago. There's lots of infamous spots, but this is the one. Not just this location, but any one of the Pequods you'll have the best pie; period love is an understatement. Best of the best is close.

Go somewhere else. This pizza is 90% bread, and barely any cheese. It is no where near as good as Lou's. We ordered a pepperoni and a sausage & onion. The amount of sausage they used was pathetic - 1 or 2 sausages per slice. Really disappointing, and the burnt cheese crust is a novelty I would not pay for again when you take into account the poor quality of the rest of the pie.

I like it, very distinctive. (Full-disclosure: I had takeout, not dine-in, so maybe fresher pizza would have given me a better experience). The burned crust wasn't quite for me, but the sauce was incredible. If you like this and live on the far north side, try Gulliver's on Howard (a very similar deep dish concept).

You've got to be kidding me.  Fucking seriously. LOL this "pizza" is a joke. This place deserves negative one star.  I hate writing bad reviews because these establishments have real people working to make a living. But I am appalled by the number of fake positive reviews and inflated rating. None of these people here who give good reviews of this place have probably ever had real good pizza.  I don't get the raving great reviews and horribly regret going here. Of all the good places to go eat, we went here and had to go out of our way to get here, in hopes the pizza would be delicious. It took us a 30 minute drive from downtown to come to this rickety area. That is usually a good sign but not for this place. There was a very slim layer of cheese on the pizza. It was 90% bread, 9.99% sauce and maybe close to 1 % of actual cheese. It tasted more like a burnt garlic bread, minus the good flavor. I shouldve went to the grocery store and bought some Texas toast. Would've been worth it more than this atrocious round bread. Please take a look at my pictures of the pie we received. It looks nothing like a pizza. And tastes nothing like one. To make a long story short: the waitress was so dismissive and oblivious half the time. She forgot we needed to order ( you have one job) then tried to be abnormally fake, extra sweet to our toddler. So much so that even he said he didn't want to be there. The atmosphere was more like a pub or bar. It reeked of stale liquor and was dark, and cramped. Such a joke. Not to mention THE 40 MINUTES IT TOOK TO MAKE IT. 40 minutes??? To burn some bread?? LOL. okay. You want pizza???? Real nice, thick, cheesy, goey, delicious pizza??? Go to colorado and try the pizza at Old Chicago. I guess the famous "chicago" pizza is only good by it's name, not by the actual location.
