After hearing all of the hype about Peaqud's, I was in the area last weekend and decided to give it a try.  I ordered a pan pizza with sausage and mushrooms.  I do like the crust very much, however the sauce and toppings were a disappointment.  Also be aware that although the crust is very good when the pizza is fresh, it doesn't taste the same when reheated.

Pizza is one of the best you'll have. Definitely 5 stars.  Downfall: the wait is excruciating (especially when you're hungry). Also, up stairs can get a little hot since they don't have A/C. The seating is definitely tight.  This place is super popular so as long as you have the right expectations on waiting times, you'll enjoy it!

Delivery/take-out review - I've never eaten in, the wait is always atrocious. Overall: Great pizza, but it can be hit or miss in terms of the waiting periods for whether or not its worth it. The good: When it's good, it's REALLY good. Hot and fresh, its on top with the best of Chicago. The carmelzied crust is signature goodness, and the thin crust is really good too. They pile the toppings on high, the sauce ratio is plentiful, and the meat is always loaded. The crust is thick and crunchy. The not-so-good: On one occasion, the super bowl, the order was terribly late and incorrect. Not sure whether to blame doordash or Pequods. Also, if the pizza is late and cold, it's not nearly as divine.

OK. OK. So my first review was a bit grumpy. But C'mon, a 3 hour rolling delay for a table? For fathers day my very lovely family ordered a carry-out pizza from the Morton Grove location and brought it home. And it was (drumroll please)...fine. It was better than Giordano's or Uno or Gino's. But not better than Pizzano's or Lou Malnati's. Not enough cheese despite the wonderful burnt cheese around the edges, the crust was thick and really just bread, the sauce was OK.  I'm glad I tried it.

Overall a good pizza but the hype was high and the pizza was just good.  The crust was overdone and while there were PLENTY of toppings the taste was just good.  Nothing wrong.  The brochette had a nice tomato based topping on garlic bread but was not worth the almost $8.  Calling ahead helped greatly with the wait and the service was good. Added a pic
This is without a doubt the best pizza in Chicago! they do a great job handling how busy they always are too, expect to wait a little but, but 100% worth it

We are from out of town and went here based on Yelp reviews. We went on a Monday night at 8pm, so we were seated immediately. Take note that even after you order, it's a 45-50 minute wait for the pizza. We ordered the small deep dish pepperoni for the two of us. My husband ate both of his and was full-- I could only eat one. It was really good but the underneath was a bit dry. The caramelized crust was delicious.
The best deep dish pizza I have had. It is a local "hole-in-the-wall" place in Lincoln park Chicago but well worth it. If anyone wants to taste authentic deep dish pizza then this is the spot!

2nd time trying ..... 1 hour and 30 mins still no pizza. It's with the driver and could be another 20 mins according to the woman who answered the phone. No thanks. No pizza in Chicago is good after being In the car for 20 mins +. We were trying again for Father's Day but this will be our last try.
Delicious deep dish pizza. Always packed. The crust was crunchy and delicious and so was the rest of the pizza. Would recommend this place over other deep dish places.
I really like the pizza have had it at the restaurant and take out. Good customer service good pizza. Couldn't ask for more.
Literally the best Pepperoni Pizza money can buy. An institution! They never let me down at lunch or dinner or party size. Its always been good.

We stopped in after a Cubs game on a Saturday around 515 place wasn't that crowded we got a seat right away . The inside is small and hot . The pizza was good , not amazing like I have read . They have a ton of workers with Pequods shirts on walking around , and multiple girls came back to check on us and refill our drinks . So we weren't really sure who our server was . Very small menu , but we went for the deep dish pizza . It was a nice Saturday dinner in the city, if we are in the area again we will stop by . They do have a call ahead seating option , your not guaranteed to be seated right away but if they are busy I would do this option on the way there . I also heard if you order a pickup and decide to stay and eat they seat you fairly quickly.   There is street parking (which is hard to get ) but also a Parking garage across the street .

I am not a big fan of deep dish pizza, but Peqoud's is pretty damn good. The crust is excellent, caramelized deliciousness; and the toppings are always fresh and plentiful. The service is excellent, and the background music always has me singing along, to my friends chagrin. I don't get here often enough. I love Lou Malnati's, but Peqoud's is a very close second. I adore this place.

Best pizza in Chicago hands down!!  If I could give more then 5 stars I would - it's that good.  Whenever I'm craving a good pizza, this is my go to spot.  From the in house special sauce to the  caramelized crust and the crisp yet airy dough, this pizzas got it all.  Personal favorite toppings - giardiniera + basil Make sure you eat it there as the crust has a 15 min tasty life otherwise gets soggy and need to put back in the oven.  This place gets crowded on thursdays and weekends. Also the Lincoln park location is much better then the Morton grove location.  I wish they opened one up in the western burbs, but until then, I'll be coming to the city often.

This place has the best pizza hands down and every person I have ever dealt with at this place...except the delivery people, are down right RUDE and TERRIBLE. Just try calling in...don't expect to speak with any decent person over the phone. The hostess...terrible. Servers...disgusting human beings. This place needs a kick in the ass by a savvy consumer who will open up right next door or across the street just to spite their bad behavior. But even worse, take away ALL of their business. Kind of like Marianos did to Dominicks.

I stopped here for lunch with a friend. The pizza was good and the price was right. I also like that it's BYOB! I ordered the lunch special, they make it fresh so it takes a little while but it is hot and delicious. I will be stopping again, Check it out if your in the area.

My favorite deep dish pizza ever. You just can't beat Peaquod's: quality ingredients, good sauce/cheese/toppings ratio, and the perfect level of char. I know the charred aspect isn't a favorite for everyone, but I think it completes the pizza and makes it into the perfect Pequod's crust. I've been here several times and the service is kind of hit or miss, but fortunately for them, their pizza is so good that I keep coming back regardless. If you're coming in from out of town and you want deep dish, THIS IS IT. Also try your fav topping with giardinera (spicy food lovers only)... thank me later. :)

Really bad pizza so much dough and it was so under cooked. Service was not bad tried there best for such a limited space. Need to improve pizza it not anything extraordinary like I was told. Everything else was great atmosphere, clean, and good attitude. But man just horrible food even mozz sticks where bad how can you make bad mozz sticks???

First time I had their burnt crust years ago, I wasn't so much of a fan.  Lately I have had it a couple times and find it very unique and addicting.  Friendly service, good unique chicago style pizza.  Definitely recommend trying it out.
Different kind of pizza. Two locations. Both divey and downscale. Fun, good pizza. Nothing bad here.

This is hands down my favorite pizza restaurant in the city. I am so addicted to their handtoss, caramelized crust pizza. The wait to get a seating is something I'm not a fan of but that's the price I have to pay for getting the best pizza in the city.

Being from NJ/NY area we are big on pizza in general. I have a couple spots in Jersey that make a good deep dish. So, we tried Giordanos because it's the "best", along with pizza uno too. Giordanos sucked, I can get better pizza at 7/11. So, we get to Pequod's I order a personal pie and it was incredible, half onions and half sausage. It was a solid 8.5-9 . Crust was perfect, some deep dish places or pizza in general get a flaky crust and I can't stand it. Their pizza sauce had an interesting twist to it, not sure if it had wine/brandy/sherry in it. But man what a delicious twist. Great job and we didn't wait too long either
Best pizza in Chicago. I want to rub it all over my body but instead I just end up putting It into my mouth. The wait can be long sometimes but it's worth it

Originally when I heard about this place, it felt like people were pulling my leg.   "Pequods" sounded like someone was luring you into a dark alley of a bad joke.  I've had my fair share of deep dish experiences around Chicago, but this one is definitely my favorite.  Maybe because it's not as "commercialized" as some of the cough, cough.... other competitors, but it has a great local, lived-in feel. The other thing I liked about it is that it was a little difficult to get to.... why is this a point I like to share?  It just feels like a little "off the beaten path" so that it's really not intended to be a tourist trap.  It is a good 15-18min walk from the Belmont (Red/Brown/Purple Lines) CTA stop, but there is also street parking available.  I suggest the walk... since it will prepare you for the carb-loading heaving you are about to experience when you come here. We arrived early.... party of 4 with a high-chair and we got seated right away (even though there was just 2 of us of the party present).  I like that it's first-come-first-serve so that people that eat early to avoid crowds are rewarded and there's no really extensive reservation process.  We were escorted past a bar (all seats filled) of people enjoying food and beverages and a bunch of high-top tables.  We were lucky enough to get a booth and the high-chair fit perfectly on the end of the table.   You can tell the server was busy with a party of 12/mix of kids and adults that basically "sheilded us" off from the other part of the restaurant since they extended the booth table with long tables to accommodate the large party, but our server kept checking on us.  We put in an appetizer that arrived as the rest of our party did and we placed our pizza order right away.  Half topping large between 4 people after a sample platter of appetizers was just enough food.  My only complaint is that the server that brought the pizza served us the slices so the photo op for the pizza was gone is a second.  I did what I could though.  We passed the time with beer and good company and just taking the atmosphere in.   By the time we left, the entire restaurant was full as were our stomachs.  I'd be interested to come back and try their thin crust... which a lot of tables were enjoying around us.

Overrated at its best. Location is not good, ambiance sucks and the pizza is very lackluster. Mind you I ordered a personal pan cheese only so maybe the toppings is what makes it. My pizza was pretty much burnt I wouldn't call it buttery definitely crispy and the cheese and sauce were nothing special. I would not venture here for another taste at all. Glad I went though to check out what they hype was about. Try for yourself!
So damn good.  Best Chicago style pizza in town. Their traditional style is really good too.  The staff is friendly but not intrusive too.  A must have every time I'm in Chicago.

Honestly, I could write forever about this pizza ... but why bother. Let me state categorically that I HATE Chicago pizza.  Having said that, my Chicago-style pepperoni, sausage and hot pepper pizza was without question one of the best pizzas I have had in my life. Absolutely insane!!!!! Forget ALL the other Chicago big names for pizza .... I have had them all and there is not even anything remotely close.  I really could write in great detail, but it would not be enough. See my photos ....

Extremely underwhelming. Never been here before, so I came here with an open mind. The pizza was lukewarm, the crust was very thick, which led to thin amount of toppings. The sauce tasted like it was out of a far. The cheese and maranta were great. This was on a Monday night. I really don't recommend waiting for an hour and a half.

Ordered delivery on a Friday. Never making the mistake of ordering here again and will take every opportunity to dissuade others. Wrote a much longer review but deleted, because why spend the time? Terrible pizza (yet always seem to order once a year thinking it'll get better). Rude and unprofessional customer service. Waited over two hours for delivery (was quoted 1:30 when ordered, again when I called to get an eta after 1:30, and can be seen clearly on my receipt). The manager(?) was incredibly rude and called me a liar about the quoted time ("I doubt you were told 1:30 - we train our girls to say 1:30-2 hours). Looks like some retraining is required starting with you sir. Life is too short to deal with people like this.  Point is...Many pizza joints that are much better and treat their customers with respect. Why bother with this bready, bland and sad pizza from an establishment that apparently doesn't value their customers? Easy decision and easy to remedy this situation before insulting a paying customer as well as your female employees.

Pequod's is one of my favorite Chicago deep dish pizzas.  The crust is caramelized and crispy, and the pizza simply hits the spot.  I usually go plain cheese, because I'm a simple guy.  Wait times can be long, but I guess that's a good thing?

Hahahah, Pequods. You like deep dish? You like this place. I think the overly-detailed bad reviews are hilarious. This is not burger king. You do not get it your way. You get it Pequods way, and sometimes, you have to just take it that way. But I am not here to talk about how long it took to get my food, nor if the server was rude to me, or if your box had a dent in it.  I am here to talk about how the food put in front of me was, which is really what we should all be talking about.
Great deep dish pizza. Sauce and the crust are both excellent. Very generous with toppings. Fun atmosphere with friendly staff.
Wow.  How do I describe this place.  It's Chicago style pizza, but better!  They put cheese on the crust.  How can that go wrong?

As good as it gets! I have gluten and dairy issues so I don't eat pizza very often, but when I do, I prefer Pequod's over everything else. I used to go here after concerts and they'd be slammed, but I'd wait an hour anyway!

As a native New Yorker eating New York pizza in New York and obviously being a New Yorker I want to say this pizza was good but I most certainly cannot. This pizza was absolutely the worst,(a solid 4/5 because I'm a New Yorker) my ego cannot concur enough with my taste buds.  Original Deep dish was a solid 4/5, thin crust was clearly also a 4/5. Beer selection was great. Ambiance was very fun, family friendly and casual.  I enjoyed the garden salad as my appetizer. The Staff were friendly and accommodating.  I bothered them a lot for multiple beer runs, pizza slices and a plethora of odd request like their phone numbers and if they wanted to go out on any dates to no avail which left them to clearly give them 4 stars. In all honesty this place was awesome.  Food environment and everything was on point. Hope you guys enjoy your meal here. Still not better than NY pizza though.
Hands down best deep dish in Chicago. Don't bother eating there because you will wait forever. Takeout is a must. Once you've had this you won't go back for any other deep dish. That is all.

My first deep dish experience... decent enough. The pizza wasn't bad in any way and I was satisfied, but was in no way blown away. Our server did her job only that- didn't attend to us right away and wasn't particularly friendly.

Walked in super excited to end my Chicago trip on a bang with Pequods as my last stop so I was SUPER bummed out when I walked in with my 3 friends and all our bags and the HOST who could've been the owner glared at me, looked at the Yankees hat I was wearing, signaled with his body that we were clearly in a Chicago bar, and moodily showed us to our seats.  ??? I was so thrown off by the lack of hospitality. I get city pride and I'm all about that as well.  Other Than that, 4.95  is a great lunch deal. Pizza was good. Our waitress was nice. But I wouldn't come here again.

The veggie pan pizza was just okay in my opinion. It wasn't bad and it wasn't great. I personally didn't care for the taste of the tomato sauce. As others noted, there was too much crust with respect to the toppings/cheese. Although the crust did taste decent. The quality of the veggie toppings was meh. And lastly I was not a fan of the caramelized crust. I appreciate them trying to do something a little bit different, but it just came across as weird. At the end of the day, there are other deep dish restaurants I prefer. I'm glad I checked this out though.

Absolutely amazing pizza!  Crust was incredibly crispy and that caramelized cheese...drool... We actually didn't have to wait long for a table on a Friday night (Tip: use their priority wait seating on their website!  It's not really a reservation but they'll put you on the front of their wait list once you arrive).

Came here as the last spot during our weekend in Chicago. Rating is for the attitude from the host when we got there. We came at 3 pm on a random Tuesday with all our bags, clearly tourists, and were greeted with hostility because someone in our party was wearing a Yankees hat..completely unnecessary.  I understand it's a sports bar with pride, but we didn't come during a big game, or during any game. There were maybe 6 other parties in the restaurant -- it was pretty obvious we were here as tourists just expecting genuine Chicago-style pizza. Instead, we got a load of BS and yet were still seated? Next time just don't bother seating us if you care about pride more than hospitality. Not worth it for me to even give a review on the food.
This was our first deep dish pizza, which was recommended by a lot of people. We absolutely loved this place. It was so delicious. I highly recommend.

Deep dish pizza, yum! I came here with a friend on a weekend for lunch around 11:30AM, and there was no wait. There was a wait, however, for the pizza to come out; I hear it's pretty typical though. We ordered a small pizza with spinach, mushroom, bell pepper, and pepperoni. The sauce wasn't very flavorful and towards the middle, the crust got soggy. For the most part though when the pizza first came out, the bottom of the crust was crunchy which was nice! I really enjoyed it. The outer crust was my favorite part though; it was a bit burnt and it was super crunchy and delicious! Good place to eat, I would definitely recommend it. The bill came out to be around $11 post-tax, which I don't know whether is typical or not for deep dish. Delicious though!

I waited to review Pequod's until I had many others under my belt (85+ at this point). I remember loving it about two years ago when I first had it; before I knew anything about the hype. You can argue who has the best deep dish in Chicago, but I want to put a spin on this. If you look at the menu, they call this "pan" pizza and I'm glad they do, because I'd consider them the best pan pizza in Chicago, not deep dish. What I'm trying to say is pan pizza is known to be over-compensated on the dough. This is a very doughy pizza. I consider deep dish more balanced with more cheese and toppings and less dough. To each their own. I really like the airiness of the crust. It has a well-cooked bottom crunch, yet a chewy center. The sauce is more savory and is a true sauce, not chunk tomatoes. I hate to say it, but the sausage tasted a little dry and gritty. This is more than likely due to it being cooked on top of the pizza. There was a decent amount of cheese. It was enough, but wouldn't have complained if there was more. Of course I have to mention the caramelized cheese crust. This is the best bite of the pizza and what they are famous for. Don't be alarmed, it does not taste burnt at all! I also got a thin crust pizza. It's nice that they do a braided outer crust. The toppings were abundant and the it was far more cheesy than the pan pizza. I really liked the thin crust. I think everyone should at least get Pequods once to say they did and it may be your new favorite pan pizza. If you like lots of dough, this will be your place.

Best deep dish in Chicago! The crust in thinner. You tell yourself one slice but always eat 2 because it just melts in your mouth and isn't too heavy for a deep dish. Great for eating in or take out. Free parking on the side streets too!

A++. Warning: can get crowded. They handle it well, but there's only so much they can do. We waited 1.25 hours on a holiday weekend night to sit, and once we did, people were waiting 2 hours or more. So, come on an odd hour, or a non-busy night. Otherwise, do like we did: bring a good book, sit on a bench outside (or order a drink at the bar next door), and wait. It's worth it.

Well worth the hour wait to get seated and 40 minutes for the deep dish pie to be baked. Loved loved loved. Told GM when he stopped by the table that he must open in Milwaukee. I'll be there daily. Mmmm.

We got the deep dish pepperoni and sausage pizza and it was perfect! We had family in town and wanted to show them the best Chicago pizza and it definitely did not disappoint! Can't wait to come back again!

Amazing deep dish pizza! One can't go to Chicago and not try a deep dish pizza. The toppings are a bit pricey but well worth. The crust was crispy and not at all soggy. I recommend Pequod's to anyone interested in trying Chicago style deep dish pizza.

This stuff is flame! Don't sleep on this joint, you tourist will regret it! Mouth watering pizza and a really smooth atmosphere will make wish you were born in such a city. This place is where real headz come and chill and enjoy a slice or two. Don't come to Chicago and not come to this place! Located in the center of yuppie ville, no need to worry about the neighborhood, just watch out for their delivery guys!

We got there right before dinner rush so we sat right down, pretty decent wait it appeared to be if you're not early!!! Food was great, we had a deep dish and thin crust pizza with salads.  Pizzas take about 40 minutes so don't come on starving, order a salad and wait!! It will be worth it! Servers are slammed but take good care of you.
Great! Just don't come in when you're already starving- deep dish takes 45min-1hour.

I'm a fan of the ambiance and the vibe Pequod's gives out - however their pizza was just not for me.  Their crust is very unique and obviously they have a huge following, but it was not my favorite.  I would truly recommend this place though - you have to try it and find out for yourself!! Be prepared for a line or go during an "off-time".

Great pizza!! It's a tough call... But their pan pizza might be better than Giordano's stuffed pizza. Attached is pan pizza with black olives and ground beef. Their thin pizza was ok, not the best... Pizano's or Pat's pizza might be better.

My friend recommended this place over all the other deep dish places so had to try it. I've only had Lou Malnati's and I wasn't a fan so figured I'd give it another shot. We had a 90 min wait so stopped over at the Drinkingbird next door for a couple drinks (pretty good) and finally got seated and ordered a large pan pizza with pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms and peppers and a full order of wings.  The wings were okay and looked like they came from a food deprived chicken. The pizza is massive and has this nice charred crust but I've come to the realization that I'm just not a deep dish fan. The toppings were fantastic but the pizza just lacks the amount of cheese and sauce that I like. It feels like you are eating a salad of toppings with some crust on the side. My friends liked it but I think I'll stick to New York style pizza myself.

Not much more to add besides I loved the pizza. Personal size is the right amount for one hungry person. Also, well priced for the quality you get. About $10 for a personal size with two toppings. The caramelized edges are the cherry on top of a fine pizza.

I have heard so many good things about Pequod's pizza from all of my friends, but I just don't think it's that good. I've had it 3 times now, and have never really enjoyed it. I usually don't write yelp reviews, but I felt it was necessary for this pizza.  I ordered a half sausage with cheese and half spinach and mushroom with cheese deep dish pizza. If you like a deep dish pizza with 95 bread and no cheese or toppings, then this is where you want to order from. I don't know if they decide to not try on takeout orders, that's what I've heard, but this pizza was so bad, I needed to write a review. I felt ripped off. Please observe picture.  I prefer uno's, due's, lou's, giordano's, and even dominos to pequods. Would probably never order myself again, but if my friends want to order pequods, I hope it will be better than this past pizza.

Just how do they do it?  How does this place achieve deep dish pizza perfection? After some research, I found out some of the secrets.  First is the cast iron pizza pans, well-seasoned after many years of use.  Next is the dough, spread in a thick layer on the bottom of the oiled pizza pain, but not up the sides.  The cheese is whole mild mozzarella, sliced in house to exact specifications, and laid in overlapping pattern on top of the crust but, and here's one of the secrets, also placed up on the sides of the pan.  A hefty ladle of uncooked seasoned tomato sauce goes on top, followed by toppings, dried oregano and pecorino romano cheese.  The thing bakes for about 20 minutes in a 600 degree oven.   The result?  The crust has a beautiful lacy caramelized ring around it, the sauce is sweet and tangy with great depth of flavor, and the toppings are charred to great effect. It's deep dish pizza perfection!  Hard. To. Stop. Eating. It. The only downside is that it's busy and the wait is long.  On a rainy Saturday at 1:30 pm, we waited about 45 minutes to get in, and then it took another 45 minutes to get our pizza after we sat down.  Don't fret, your patience will be rewarded!

Pizza and bruschetta were good. Waitress was nice. We were seated upstairs - sign on the entrance said they're open until 2am. No one told us the upstairs closed at 11pm so we were taking our time, completely unaware. When we realized we were the only ones left we asked the waitress and finished quickly to get out but overheard one of the workers - small guy with a puffy bob - talking to our waitress about how "these bitches are taking their time". Just make sure customers are aware of the different closing times. No need to be passive aggressive.

I called around 3 pm to order a pizza for take-out at 6:30. I got there a little early, around 6:20, and paid for the pizza. At 6:30 they told me that they made a mistake the pizza would be ready  in 15 minutes. About ten minutes later they told me 12 minutes, and the pizza wasn't ready until 7pm. The pizza was good, but not worth the hassle and chaos-- the restaurant was extremely hectic and disorganized. Not worth it.

It's pretty sad because I had such high hopes being that it was voted best in the nation but it let me down.  Upon arrival we sat very quickly which was another sign of awesome but it went downhill from there. To start our waitress smelled due to lack of deodorant and her stench was directed to my face with her wide open arms. I overlooked it and we ordered. We ordered the stuffed crust which describes itself as cheese oozing from the crust but when we received it there was barely any cheese at all.  It arrived to our table swiftly but upon our first bite, my husband and I both found a way to admit it was subpar. We decided we were full and when the waitresses walked by I said "can we get a box and the check." Without saying a word she used the pizza pliers to pick it up and allowed it to sit at her knee as she walked away from the kitchen with the pizza being moved around her personal space before she finally walked to the kitchen. She came back to our table without a word check on top of pizza looked away and walked off. We both looked at each other trying to figure out if we were rude to her at some point but could not think of anything as she barely came to our table in the first place. Bottom line. I will never go again and both my husband and i plan to apologize to our usual pizza place for wasting our money on such a subpar, rude and smelly experience. Side note: my husband used the washroom while there and he described it as gross and dirty.

Ok so this review is based on delivery. The pizza is amazing. My favorite pizza in the city. However, delivery is not what it uses to be. I initially called at 6:10pm today to place an order. I followed the prompts and was on hold listening to some awful music for 20 min. 20 minutes. Unreal. Then the music stops, and I get pushed to voicemail! The fact I even stayed on hold that long showcases how much I love this pizza. I call back and decide to choose the pick up prompt, which resulted in me speaking to someone right away. I advised what happened and instead of saying they will look into it, she said she could take my order herself. Had I known this I wouldn't have waited for 20 minutes. Now the fun part. I got my order taken, was told it would be here in about 1.5 hours (8:05pm). Pizza didn't come until 8:30. That is 2 hours of waiting. That's a bit ridiculous in my opinion. I'm not that far away, there was no rain, and traffic around 8pm isn't really heavy. I ended up calling the store asking if anything had happened because it's been 2 hours. The girl who answered said to call back in 10 minutes if the pizza didn't come. I mean, shouldn't this be addressed at that moment in time, regardless? What is 10 minutes after 2 hours of waiting?!?!? Customer service should have been better. I should have been given to a manager to discuss. Had I known I'd be eating at 8:30pm I would have ordered somewhere else, eaten by 730pm (at a normal hour). Pizza came lukewarm, not hot. Normally, I would say something, but I was so hungry from not having had anything to eat all day that I just said forget it. They won't do anything anyways- they didn't do anything when I told them I've been waiting over 2 hours and the pizza guy was 30 min late. For the price, I would have expected a little better customer service. I order pizza all the time and come in very frequently, so this experience makes me a little weary of ordering delivery from here. Maybe it's best to go sit at the store, and hope not to be stuck upstairs on the summer where it feels like 100 degrees! I want to emphasize that I called at 610 in order to beat the rush and be able to get my dinner by 730. Unfortunately, it's 9pm and I just finished. I'll report back if pequods reaches out. I'm not really holdingy breath though.

If you don't already know this place, you're obviously not from chicago.  It's an institution unlike any other here. While it's not my favorite Chicago pizza, the pan is super tasty. Burnt cheese + crispy bottom + bready crust = satisfaction. Don't be alarmed by the apparent size of the restaurant - it has 2 floors and seats a lot more than you realize.

Left feeling a little underwhelmed unfortunately.  I love both Giordano's and lou's for deep dish so I wanted to try the other deep dish place I kept hearing rave reviews about.  Firstly, our buzzer never went off for our table so once we finally realized that people who had come in after us were being seated, we politely approached the host who then seated us right away.  Not a big deal and not the workers' faults at all but not the best start.  Mozz sticks as an appetizer were good but the pizza was just slightly disappointing.  It was a little dry on the bottom and I kinda wish we had gotten extra cheese on it as the sauce to cheese ratio wasn't great.  I would come back, but I think I'll stick to some other deep dish staples.

Probably the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Visited Chicago and had to visit this place. Waited about 1.5 hours for a party of 2 on a Saturday night. I wish that they'd allow ordering before seating so that it's ready the the time the table is. Sadly, it takes 45 minutes from time of ordering to receiving the pizza. But it is so worth it! The caramelized crust makes it a masterpiece. Definitely visiting again when I'm in town

I love pizza!! I went to this place about twice the first time I was very happy because we were able to get seated right away and the food didn't take too long to come out. The second time I came to this place there were less people and for some reason our food took forever to come out and they tried charging us for water. I'm never a person to really point things out like this but I found it very distrubing that we didn't get the best service that night. But other than that the pizza was great.
I prefer Pequod's over Lou's. The one thing I will say is that eating it there out of the pan is much better than getting delivery or take out!

The deep dish pizza is a must-try and a cannot miss. Enjoy delicious toppings, quality ingredients and friendly service. Be warned - bathrooms are a little rough, but they also have a late night bar so that would explain it.

Ridiculously good deep dish pizza!  Nothing fancy inside, but the perfect place to get a beer and a large gooey slice of pizza.  Highly recommend this place if you're in town looking for good Chicago style pizza.

We came here on recommendation from friends that this was the best deep dish in the city. Better than Lou Malnati's or Giordano's. We ordered a pizza to go because the wait was over an hour and it's too crowded to wait inside and not a great waiting space. I was sorely disappointed by the deep dish and it was the worst deep dish I have had. The crust was really dry and there was a few dollops of cheese but mostly dry bread with sauce. I'm not sure if it was an off night since it seems like most people seem to like it, but definitely not what I expected. I would like to try it again to see if it was just a bad pie, but don't want to end up like last time. I will definitely update my review next time I try. I prefer Lou's and Giordano's at this point.
Simply the best Chicago style pizza; not even close. You will walk out here with a belly full of bliss, delight and complete satisfaction. Wing are great, too.

The Pequod's restaurant is known for their deep dish pizza with caramelized burnt crust. They typically have a long wait and the pizza takes about 40 minutes to cook once you put in the order. You should put in your pizza order right away because of the long wait.  I suggest you get the deep dish pizza with sausage. The pizza has large chunks of sausage with a hint of spice. You will leave feeling full.
not sure if I like it compared to lou malnati's! service was ok, wait was crazy, crust was a little too greasy for my taste, and atmosphere was extremely crowded
This is the best pizza around!  Beyond good!  Order the deep dish and you'll smile with every single bite!!!

eat's up food critics! an abundance of words is not needed to explain this 8th wonder of the world. jake almost shed a tear when eating this pizza. the deep dish with a caramelized crust was baked to perfection. that is all. a must go.

Pequods...be still my heart. Your deep dish sausage and pepperoni pizza is what pizza dreams are made of. Your crust perfectly crunchy on the bottom yet soft and so light. Your sauce deliciously zesty and full of flavor. Your cheese nicely crisped on the edges and melted perfectly on top. And your sausage and pepperoni (and I typically don't like pepperoni)...goodness it's all too tasty.  I've had the other Chicago deep dishes and they've got nothing on you. Not their crusts, not their sauces, and not their toppings. I shall dream of you til we meet again.

Want the city's best deep dish? Don't waste your time with the stuffed pizza "chains". This place is in a league of its own. Only downfall is that seating can be sparse on the weekends or during dinner rush hours. Great people run this place.
Crust is absolutely amazing. The actual pizza has too much sauce, and too little cheese. Overall, really good!

I used to hate Pequod's because I grew up on Giordano's. Well, Pequod's is in fact delicious. The cheesy and buttery crust is just so yum. It totally grew on me. We usually get sausage, which is always a good hearty choice.

Given how hyped this place is as the best pizza in town, I was incredibly disappointed!  The crust was incredibly bland, and to me, that's a mood killer for deep dish.  There was some cheese burnt around the edges of it that was delicious, but 5% great doesn't make up for 95% boring.  Add in absurdly late delivery and I just can't justify giving it another try.
Ordered take out with my friends. The wait is always very long but was worth it. They could just sell the crust and it would still be amazing.

My boyfriend and I came to pequods the first night we arrived in Chicago.  It was our first time trying deep dish pizza so we were very excited and very hungry. We had high expectations for this place and for the deep dish pizza itself. Thankfully we sat down right away and didn't have to wait in line. We ordered our pizza and the waitress told us it would take about 45 minutes for the pizza to come out....  :( we were really hungry so we ordered some mozzarella sticks to munch on while we waited. Finally the pizza came out and we were ready to dig in.  To be honest, my boyfriend and I were quite disappointed. Idk what we were expecting but it sure didn't meet up to it. It wasn't horrible but it just wasn't great.  I ended up only eating one slice (only because I was hungry) and my boyfriend forcefully ate two slices.  Maybe we will give it a try again next time

For 15 years I have gotten great takeout pizza from Pequods.  Last night my wife and I chose to actually eat in at the restaurant. It was not at all crowded (that is unusual) but a large sign at the greeter's table warned of a 40 minute wait (at least) if you dared order pizza -deep dish or thin crust.  The greeter did say we could get slices in ten minutes.  Slices came in about 20 minutes burned up and singed. 1/2 order of spaghetti ordered with cheese came quickly with a mountain of cheese burying a tiny bit of spaghetti and a small single meatball (for $2.95 additional). Unrecognizable as a small spaghetti dinner.  One of the worst  restaurant meals I've  ever had! We'll go back to ordering take out pizza from Pequods.

First, let me say I'm going to try this place again and eat there. We got delivery today, one pan pizza and one thin. The meatball on the pan was disappointing too thinly sliced and overcooked, dried out. Not at all worth the premium price for this topping especially since there was so little of it. The caramelized crust was delicious, but there was way too much sauce for my taste. The thin crust was a soggy mess. It wasn't very thin. It wasn't crisp or chewy. Just wet, maybe just doesn't deliver well. The Italian sausage on the thin crust was actually bad - no flavor and a mushy texture. It didn't taste like Italian sausage at all. The staff on the phone and the delivery guy were so nice. Hoping it was a fluke and they were having an off day.

I'm going to say something blasphemous here and say this is the best Chicago pizza out there. I definitely take folks from out of town here more often than their more famous counterparts. Can't go wrong at Pequod's, especially before catching a movie or heading over to B&N to browse some books.

I had heard so many great things about this place and was super excited to try it. I had the deep dish pizza with mushroom and spinach and it was so delicious! We got the fries for an appetizer (the pizza takes about 45 minutes to make) and they were perfectly cooked and crunchy! The staff was super nice and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

Heard of this place from coworkers, and I was interested in the carmelized cheese lining the crust. SO good - the pan pizzas take ~ 40min to come out, but the wait was clearly communicated and there are a lot of appetizers to choose from while you wait. The deep dish slices were surprisingly light and easy to eat. The sauce was really fresh, too. Wonderful experience!

Delicious everything and a kind staff that didn't mind this professor sitting and grading papers on a packed Saturday. Great service when your stomach us gnawing at your backbone. The staff did alot of kiddy flirting back and forth management may wish to address this so the staff is paying attention solely to clients as opposed to each other

What is there to state accept this is the best pizza in the city. They take pizza to another level for taste and the restaurant experience is not bad either. They did a remodel some years ago at the Clybourn location to add more seating and to update the look. The crust and the pizza sauce is just magnificent. This place is definitely worth the trip if you are not close to this location. They also have a location in Morton Grove.  bon appétit!

My family and I visited weeks back and I'm just finding time to review. This pizza was iconic back in the day and I haven't visited in many years. Maybe it's unfair to compare to my memory but our last visit was mediocre at best. We ordered the cheesy garlic bread and it was warm, gooey and satisfying! We followed this with a pepperoni pan pizza which is their version in the deep dish pizza.  We all enjoyed it but feel eve crust was soggy and impossible to pick up and eat causing us to have to use fork and knife. This was fine for me and the hubby but the kids had a difficult time and made a mess. Service was a bit slow but it was a packed house.

Man, this place is kick ass. It has a real, local feel from the exposed brick walls to the staff and people inside. Nothing fancy or hip bit feels like a place where real deep dish pizza is made the same way they've been doing for decades (could be wrong). The service was really great. Not overly attentive or anything but a casual sense about it. Three guys total, after a night out, we split a medium deep dish with Canadian bacon, pepperoni, spinach and sausage. 6 slices total and 2 slices each and the waitress was absolutely correct-totally enough. Proved us wrong when we thought of doing two pizza pies. The pizza was absolutely savory and delicious. Thick and heavy with a crunchy harder exterior and a chewy soft doughy bread on the inside and amazing toppings. Not the kind you grab with your hand and bite in 3 goes. Definitely a knife and fork sitch. Also, great value for the yums - $30 for a medium with five toppings. Left very satisfied.

Ok...if I could eat here everyday I would.  Amazzzzing pizza. Best crust ever.  And if you don't believe my review just ask the thousand people that are there, every-time & anytime you try to go (that would be my only complaint). Seriously even at lunch, during the week this place is packed & it's huge.  But major bonus points to them for buying the bar next doors, so you can have a drink while you wait for a table.  I like their style of thinking.

It's an o.k. spot for pizza. It's not the best deep dish pizza in the city. but it's also not the worst. It's an alright spot. It's comfortable, casual, and affordable. I would go again and I would recommend it to friends too. It's a good place to drop in after seeing something at Steppenwolf theater, or after Spamilton at the Royal George Theatre like I did.
Their pizza is unique and heavenly.  We had good service and nice facility.  They are always busy but with good reason

Ok the deep dish here tastes pretty good I suppose when you get the RIGHT pizza. The service however left a lot to be desired, they tried to seat my boyfriend and I at a small table despite the plethora of open booths (that had a few couples in each). I asked if we could be seated at a booth as well (we had reservations and everything), my server was so annoyed. On top of that, the pizza we ordered was served to another party. The staff there didn't off any sort of compensation for the longer wait and they said the other people ordered pretty much the same pizza except it had garlic in it. So we decided to bite the bullet and have the garlic pizza, it turned out to be extremely garlic-y for my taste... we did NOT order pizza with garlic but the only other option was to wait another 30-40 minutes for our pizza to be made right. I wouldn't be in a hurry back to this place. It was disappointing to say the least. Who gives other people pizza and doesn't double check to make sure the order was correct? I was pissed watching others eat the pizza we ordered and even more angered that our server didn't even apologize or offer us a voucher in return.
Best deep dish!! Wish there was a location Southern California!! The sauce was so flavorful and the mozzarella was top quality.
Favorite deep dish / pan place in the city.
Great pizza good environment, awesome beer. The waitress was nice, also the wait is a bit long but well worth it.

Great experience, great pizza, great value! I had heard this was the place to go and it was. Nice, cozy, local neighborhood joint with friendly staff, totally took care of me and made me me feel welcome. The name is pronounced Pea-Quad and that's the name of the Chef from the book Moby Dick. They also have a bar next door called Whales Tales where patrons can go and enjoy a few drinks while waiting to get in, think you might even get a discount if they know you're waiting to get in for pizza. The lunch special was 4.95 for a seven inch pan pizza and a drink, for this quality that's insane! Really, perhaps the best pan pizza I've ever had and it was a thing of beauty to eat and look at. Such perfect sauce, caramelized cheese and pepperoni. I also had a very good appetizer of garlic sticks and marinara. My total bill was maybe 10.65 or so. I was worried about long lines, so I got there rift when they opened at 11am on a Wednesday morning and there were only two ahead of me. If anyone ever asks me where I think the best pizza in Chicago is, this is the place I'll send them!
Pequod's has amazing pizza. It might be the best in Chicago. Everyone should try this place at least once.

I've tried out two other pizza spots in Chicago while traveling here for a few days and this is the best! I would come back here again for their cheese pan pizza which is what I got. They have a lunch special during the weekdays from 11:00am to 3pm for $4.95 so I would recommend ordering that. You can get a personal pan pizza with a fountain drink for the price, which is very reasonable. The quantity is sufficient too for one person but you can even share it. My friends and I ordered an extra one to go as well.

YES! believe all the buzz and fuzz you read online! this place is great.  The service is great, the food comes out fast even though they are BUSY... Friendly wait staff and the pizza! oh the pizza! it's so good! Only negative part is sometimes the wait, but it's totally worth it!

Pequods was my first deep dish experience in Chicago, and the only way I can describe it is good enough. We got a small 10-inch pizza with sausage and pepperoni, which paired with a side of fries was the perfect amount for two hungry dudes.  The pizza takes about 40 minutes to come out, so I recommend ordering right away. The cheese is crispy, the toppings are on point, and the crust requires a fork and knife for sure. I do really like the atmosphere, which is like a cool locals bar. Not as touristy as the Lou Malnati's in downtown Chicago. That gives it a slight edge in the comparison, but the pizza comes down to whether you like a crispier or slightly softer pie.

Pequod's stole a pizza my heart. This is the best 'za in town! My wife and I dined in last weekend and are still talking about that caramelized crust! I don't think we'll be eating Giordano's anytime soon. The service was great too. Erin and Alan took good care of us...my mouth was watering when that first slice got cut and placed gently on my dinner plate. Goodness, I've gotta get back to this joint ASAP. God Bless Pequod's!  PS - If for some strange reason you don't like the pizza from this spot, you're a weirdough!
The place is awesome the personal deep could feed a army I ate 1/3 of the pizza and was stuffed.  I have also tried the Italian beef there one of the best.

We made a reservation and we still had a long wait, so make your reservation as far in advance as you are able. Our waitress was great (split the check between a bunch of college kids' debit cards) and the pizza was delish! Loved the cornmeal crust :)

Got here at 8pm on Wednesday night and there wasn't a wait. We ordered some fries and the single for 2 and it was more than enough of food. Be aware that it does take 30-40 minutes for the pizza to come. I was really hungry, so the fries were perfect to hold me over. Pizza- it was pretty good, as we ordered pepperoni and sausage for our toppings. It's greasier and messier than Lou malnatis, and they burnt the edges of the crust for a crispier flavor (not sure if that was intentional or not). We split the small 10" between 2 people and it's more than enough food. Don't order more than that or you're going to end up with a ton of leftovers Service was good and it has more of a local atmosphere (compared to Lou's where it just felt like a touristy restaurant). Liked the bar ambiance and being able to watch the bulls and cubs games. Great value. Paid less than $20 for the whole dinner. Overall, the food is excellent, but it's not going to blow your mind. I see the appeal of Pequod's being a local favorite.

We got there at 11:30! Thank goodness! Within in 15 minutes we would've had to wait 2 hours...we had a group of 10. In summary, excellent Chicago pizza! My family argues between Lou's and Giordanos... but we unanimously agree this is the best! The cheesy carmelized crust is to die for! My favorite is the pepperoni, then the sausage, then the cheese. I like mine saucy... so definitely the meat pizzas were the most saucy. Excellent sauce and high grade meats!  The Pequod salad was also very good!  Overall... worth the drive from downtown!

Hype. I really wanted to like it because people rave about it, but its just not good.  First of all. This is not deep dish pizza. Its pan pizza. So if you're expecting a pizza like Lou's or Giordano's, go there, because this is not the deep dish you know and love.  Pequod's pizza is more like a focaccia bread, very doughy, with a little bit of sauce and toppings and a hint of cheese. If you cut it in half it would probably make great sandwich bread.  What toppings there are, are very fresh and of good quality. The best part of the pizza is the burnt cheese on the crust. Burnt cheese crust really shouldn't be the highlight of your deep dish pizza though.  The wait is usually long and even if you place your order ahead of time, you'll likely be waiting anyway. Its like they're doing you a favor serving you bread with some sauce on it.  Skip Pequod's and Burt's Place for that matter and go anywhere else for pizza.
Pretty damn good deep dish! The tomato bisque soup was also yummy. The appetizer sampler wasn't that great, but we ordered it since we knew the wait would be long. If not for the app, 5 stars!
My favorite pizza in Chicago.  The pan pizza crust reminds me of Quatro's back in Carbondale.  Pequod's can be pretty busy, so be prepared!

What a gem! I love the vibe in Pequods, the staff, & the food. Normally I am not a fan of their pizzas, but I do find that their pasta is AMAZING!! I love how this Chicago pizza place separates themselves from the others. It's definitely worth a stop!!

Be prepared to wait for this Chicago classic. I came around 5:30 pm and ended up not getting a pizza until 8pm! Plan accordingly guys! I think you can take the food to go as well but we dined in so it took a bit longer.  We ordered a large pizza (for 3 girls) with a variety of toppings and extra cheese. We also got a cheesy garlic bread appetizer.  The appetizer was ok. It's just bread with a lot of cheese. I was starving so I thought it tasted good but it was pretty generic. They were also super skimpy with the marinara sauce.  Our pizza was super cheesy. I don't know why we got extra cheese! Deep regrets. It has enough cheese. The toppings add up so choose wisely. Our pizza ended up being ~$45 total (from a base price of $18). Each slice weighed like 5 lbs. That's a lot of food. The vegetables are really fresh and the premium meats very good. You can't go wrong with your favorites. Service is good, albeit slow because of its popularity. The space is cramped and dark but I think that is the genera design of these pizza places. I will probably not go back because I don't like this kind of food plus the wait was no fun. But when in Chicago - you must eat deep dish and Pequods is a great place to go get some.

Absolutely my favorite pizza in the city. A unique take on deep dish with a delicious crispy cheese crust.  Would recommend the pepperoni banana pepper toppings - so good.  Long waits if you go in person pretty often but ordering takeout works great.

Came here because it was highly recommended, and I had tried all the other deep dish chains. Our wait was 1.5 hours on a Friday evening. Be prepared to wait if you dine here!  The best part of the pizza was the thick and caramelized crust. The rest of the pizza was pretty good, especially the sausage we selected as a topping. However, it wasn't as cheesy as I would've liked it. The crust also tasted and looked quite burnt.  Solid place to get deep dish pizza, but I still prefer Giordano's, Gino's, and Lou Malnati's.

I went to Chicago for vacation and knew I couldn't leave without trying Chicago's deep dish pizza. We ended up picking Pequod's. We came on a Friday evening and had an approximately two hour wait. Luckily, there's a Barnes and Noble nearby to pass the time. After getting seated, we ordered a medium pizza, which was the perfect size for three, with fresh basil, sausages, and mushrooms. The basil seemed to be lacking in both quantity and flavor, but the other two toppings complemented the pizza really well! The crust of Pequod's pizza is also to die for and was yummy.

On my 3 day trip to Chicago, I made it a point to try 4 of the restaurants that continuously showed up on several "Chicago's best deep dish pizza" lists. For such a popular restaurant I was surprised to learn that they deliver. This was great as I did not have to trek out using mass transit and walk 0.8 mi from the closest station like I was planning to do in order to try this highly rated pizza.  I am not sure if "stuffed" is synonymous with "deep-dish" because this pizza was definitely deep-dish but most of the depth was the bready dough vs other deep-dish pizzas that consisted of a thick layer of cheese and whatever other toppings. It is easy to get awed by the nice crispy crust of the pizza. I originally gave this 4 stars but when I came back and tasted the left overs of all my deep-dish pizzas side by side, I realized that comparatively I enjoyed it less than the others because it was mostly bread/dough. I am glad I did not have to make the trek for this one as I could have done without it.

Love this place! Try not to eat this kind of food often, but everytime is a meal well planned. Great staff everyone was thoughtful and carried the place Well. Gold i call it golden. This joint right here, Yummy for sure! Dont forget to ask Sally when you get there to Upgrade the special you will leave insatisfaction mode.
The wait is awful, but all is forgiven when the pizza arrives. Amazing pizza and the crust is super yummy!

Always excellent pizza. We just booked the private party room upstairs for our wedding rehearsal and are so excited! Sean is the best and the space is great. He gets right to the point in the emails when responding to book the private room and no time is wasted. Very flexible. Good draft beer list also included in the package. We can't wait!

I see it advertised on Chicago's Best and everyone says how great it is.  I was at an Air bnb and decided to order.  I'm sorry but it was just ok... the sauce was bland.  Maybe it's me? I will try them again.  The delivery was fast.

service is horrible!!!! pizza is phenomenal!!! let's start with service. i get there just as shift change today on 4/23/2017 happens. we are sat on the second floor and start with a great server for five minutes and then get changed to martha. i warned them that when i have food in front of me, i go through my drinks quickly and to please keep up to my first waitress. i was told martha is taking over for shift change who will wait on my table there on........... no where in site!!! martha never comes. there is a waitress waiting on tables next to me who's attention i keep trying to get to first find our waitress and to please help fill my drink that's been dry now for a bit!! can"t get """"that"""" waitress to even look my way as much as i call to her!! finally, i scream at her!! she turns. i ask her who is martha and where is she??? surprise surprise,,, she is martha,,,, and she """""knows"""" she is my waitress!!! she even tells me before i can say it that she knows to keep up with my drinks that she has so far failed in all of the above!!! she brings one drink that goes dry soon after and once again, can not get martha to come by!!! i am dressed fine!! engineer with my nephew eating out!! no service!!! manager comes by asking how's everything? i tell him all of the above to which he says,,, our waitresses here are not that good, they are bitches that back stabb each other all they time!! """"""he literally says this!! no joke""""""". to which he adds in conversation, that he doesn't get along with most of them.... i wonder why!! maybe because you bad mouth them to your customers!! he also adds that your tips """""never""""" go to your waitress, it goes to a """"pot"""" that is shared by """""all servers, cooks, bus boys""""". hence, the bad service!!! a waitress there doesn't even have to try and she will be rewarded by the efforts of the rest of the staff!!!      with this said, the pizza is to die for!!! it is one of the best pizzas i've tasted growing up in chicago all my life loving and eating pizza. we ordered two large deep dish pizzas. they literally burn the edges of the cheese on the crust.... it is their thing!!! i like it, my wife peeled it off when i gave it to her at home.      now the manager talking with him, literally told me that he can not manage the crowds that come there and that patrons """"""regularly do not leave tips!!!""""",,,,,hmmm, i wonder why!?!? because service is horrible!!! get the menu and have it delivered or get a frozen or half cooked to go!!!!! good luck in getting good service or a manager that literally respects his women that work for him without calling them literally bitches!!!!
Good luck with delivery here. Waited over two hours and was lied to about the pizza being on its way. Will NEVER order from this place again.

Pequod's is the only deep dish pizza that I recommend to friends and family visiting Chicago.  Other pizzerias tend to have a spongey crust that gets soggy towards the end of the meal, but Pequod's caramelized crust holds up to the weight of the ingredients on top much better.  Quick tip:  Instead of sharing a medium pizza between two people, get two personalized pizzas for more caramelized crust.
First time in Chicago and everyone told us to come here. Expected more from this place but a lot of people love it.
It was very good, wait for the pizza was longer than expected! Bad news, their is nothing like a NY Style pizza from back home in NYC!

My husband and I love this place so much!!! Yesterday we went to get our favorite pizza and of course there was a huge line like always but, we were happy to wait! Luckily across the street this wonderful book bar just opened a few months ago called The Kibbitznest and we were able to have a nice drink there while we waited with our clicker. We even got a discount on beer and wine because we had a clicker!! It was fantastic! The bar tenders at the Kibbitznest held onto our clicker while we explored the beautiful place and came to get us when it buzzed to eat our favorite pizza!!! Couldn't have asked for a better night that began at the Kibbitznest and ended at Pequods!

First time there and will never be back!!!  Waited nearly 2 hours to be seated and another hour forty five for a cheese and sausage pizza, which by the way was nothing  special at all!!!!!  A party of 8 which ordered nearly twenty minutes after us had their pizzas and were leaving before we even got ours.  Our waitress Kaylee and the manager had nothing but excuses rather than a simple apology.  The place was dark and dirty.  If you want a really good pizza, try Palermo's 95th or Gino's on Superior.  I'll be sure to spread the word to everyone I know.  By the way, this place doesn't even deserve one star!!!!

The pizza tastes good but the customer service is terrible. According to the Peaquods website we live in the delivery area. When we ordered pizza today, however, we received a call 10 minutes later cancelling our order and telling us that we are outside the delivery area. We pointed out to a manager that on the web site where they map out the delivery area, we are clearly in the zone. But the manager didn't care. Very frustrating. Sad that we won't ever order from here again.
Hands down my favorite pizza place in Chicago! Good brews, amazing caramelized crust and a fun environment! This is my go-to rec for people looking for the best in Chicago style cuisine. Period.

Lives up to the hype and worth the wait. it's the best deep dish, bar none. I am not a huge fan of deep dish generally but this place won me over! Get enough for leftovers and pop right in the oven. You won't be disappointed, as it is just as good day 2.
Great pizza, fun and lively atmosphere and good service. Got a table right away, but had to wait a bit for the pizza (but they tell you that right up front, so you are prepared).

Pequod's Pizzeria, tomato sauce masters! I'm speaking specifically to all my heartburn people out there, this sauce will not keep you up at 3am in the morning, but enough about all that.  I came to Pequod's with my girlfriend, Gaby, wanting to try out this heavily hyped pie. The joint was juking, which was to be expected on a Friday night, but it only took us 40 minutes to get seated which was not bad due to the reputation of the joint and the incredible crowd waiting outside (pro tip: you can get ahead of the wait line if you call in for a table the day before).  To pass the time we went three doors over to the Drinkingbird and had a couple of Schiltz and PBR's for 3 dollars a pop while we waited. Once our buzzer thing vibrated we rushed over. Walking to our table all I was getting was college/frat vibes (esp. on the second floor) from the decor to the people. I went to UOI, so I'm a natural in this habitat (just wanted to fully disclose for all the anti-bros out there). Once seated we ordered immediately since we already knew what we came for and did not want to drag out the hold time of the pizza. We ordered buffalo wings and a medium pizza (sausage & pepperoni - 1/2 jalapenos).  The wings came out immediately and they were really good, the only problem for me was the price of the wings in comparison to the size of the wings. I literally, in one bite, can clean those wings. I drank one beer and a 1/4 of my second beer before the pizza came out which is okay (I like my pizza out before I finish my first beer (I sip lightly everyone, at restaurants only of course lol)).  Once the pie arrived, we dug in. The ingredients are to die for, plain and simple. It was GREAT! I can really see what all the hype is about and the fun atmosphere complemented the entire experience. Trust me - if you haven't tried this place, don't let the hold time faze you, you will be rewarded in the end.   *****I will say this though, I AM NOT A FAN OF THE "CARAMELIZED" CRUST at the end. Idk if this is an accrued taste like wine or something BUT TO ME IT TASTE BURNT. The cheese and crust underneath the burnt ends tasted great nonetheless. The restaurant as a whole is 4/5 for me - the wings 3/5 (this rating is leaning on the weight of the price) but the stuffed pie was 4.5/5. I will def. recommend this pie to friends and family. Cheers everyone!

I visited the Morton grove location which is the original and it is no comparison to the Clybourn location. It was still good but it was no match for Clybourn. The Clybourn location has more and bigger toppings and even the cheese is cheesier. This will always be my favorite pizza place.

We came to try because we heard this is the spot for deep dish pizza! We arrived on Sat. Night and we were super hungry!!! We were told there was a 60-90 min wait to be seated plus once seated 45-50 wait for our pizza order. We were super sad and not in the mood to wait 2.5 hours for pizza, so we ordered it to go and took it back to our hotel. (This was a 50 min wait).  The bar area is super small, so we couldn't get a seat. We decided to sit outside and wait for our pizza. We did meet some cool people while all of us were waiting for our pizza or to be seated.  We ordered 1 pepperoni and 2 pepperoni and sausage pizzas. Yes, the crust is caramelized and yummy! The toppings yummy!! The only negative is that there is not enough cheese in the pizza. It tasted more like bread and toppings. We did try Gino's East for deep dish pizza the next night and that was more tasty. Toppings and cheesy! Yum yum. But if your looking for less of a cheesy taste, Pequods is your spot.

Ordered a personal pan sausage deep dish for takeout on Saturday around 4pm. Was told that it would take around 45mins.  We came straight after sharing a personal deep dish from Lou Malnati's so we can compare the two side by side. The one from Paquod's is much larger for pretty much the same price, but the crust is more soggy. The sauce tastes like it's from a canned one but overall it's not bad. Definitely less cheesy than Lou Malnati's.  That being said, to each their own and I would suggest trying all!

Best deep dish in Chicago. Like most locals, this is a topic we take seriously!! I will fight you on this. Their burnt cheese crust does it for me. As an original Wisconsinite, cheese is important to me. My friends and I agree that Canadian bacon and pineapple here is the best but go crazy and get whatever you want. Add pepperocini!  Outside of the food being amazing - it's a fun atmosphere / sports bar. It's also unique and not a huge chain. If you have a weekday free go before 3PM for their awesome $5 personal pizza deal!

Let me start of by saying pizza is not one of my favorite foods, but I do consider myself a pizza connoisseur. I back this up by saying that I grew up with a father that loved pizza. Loves pizza so much. We frequently traveled to new pizza places always trying what's new and highly rated. So, with that being said, I have a strong opinion of "good pizza" - I do believe there is bad pizza. Pequod's is the opposite of bad, it's one of the best. The ingredients are super fresh and I would go as far to say the best sausage I have ever had on a pizza. Besides, Burt's Pizza, who was the guy that opened Pequod's and then went to a smaller pizza location in the burbs until recently, when sadly he passed away. The pizza was delicious, yes it is doughy, if that isn't your style, you may not enjoy this. Mike, my boyfriend, wanted to make sure I mentioned how great the crust is, in his words "it's top-notch" (I don't eat crusts). My only complaint is the garlic bread. How can you have such delicious pizza and such below average garlic bread.  Will we be back, absolutely. Pequod's definitely hits the spot and fills your pizza craving.
It's one of the three top pizzas for sure. You're doing this for a chicago tradition. Not for the taste Giordanos is my go-to

deeee-lish deep dish! Pequod's was my welcome food to Chicago, and after having tried two others after, this is still on the top of my list. My cousins recommended this place, and it's easy to see why they rave over the deep dish pizza here- served in a cast iron skillet, with a burnt edge crust (just the top, really), they get the pizza right. Down to the sauce, the amount of cheese, and toppings- I'm drooling just writing about this!  We were able to choose a half and half option, which was awesome! We went with spinach, mushrooms, and sausage for one half and pepperoni, garlic, and basil with the other half. Coupled with a pitcher of beer, this was the perfect afternoon! The pizza was finished, and now I'm wishing I was back in Chicago for more. Definitely would return!
The Italian beef and sausage sub was just incredible. The deep dish was great too - kids loved it, but I'm a thin crust guy. Great ingredients, service, and atmosphere. A must for a Chicago visit.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!! One of my favorite pizza places in the city!! I can't believe that other chains get more recognition because Pequod's is definitely one of the best!! Aside from the phenomenal pizza, the hot wings are also delicious!

Be aware that like most deep dish places out takes a while for your pizza to be made, but luckily here the appetizers are pretty good. The cheese garlic bread was just okay, but the jalapeno peppers, mushrooms, and mozzarella sticks were on point. Pizza uses a lighter crust than other deep dish places which I think is a plus.

Before anyone gets outraged for the 1 star rating, this review is only for their veggie pizza.  I got a pan pizza while my friend got the thin crust one and both of them were so disappointing, the thin crust slightly less so. It looked like raw unseasoned veggies were just added on top of a cheese pizza. The pizza sauce tasted like canned tomato sauce. The only thing good about the pan pizza was the crust. Rightly done, I am sure this pizza could have been amazing.  It took us 30 mins to get a table and additional 30 minutes before the pizza was brought out. So not worth the time or money if you are a vegetarian.
Always good!   A must try!! The best Carmelized pizza crust!  And if you can order ahead pizzas take at least 45 minutes.. But so worth it

I've been to a couple of different joints for deep dish and never quite cared enough but this though is a different league. The sauce was amazing though a little too wet to make eating not too messy. The cheesy garlic bread was great too. The crust was part cheese, adding to the flavour. Service? It was great. Our server checked in with my friend about the definitely drunk group next to us just to make sure everything was a-ok. It's rare that restaurants care if your neighbours are nice or not. My only unhappiness is that I've to wait to order my pizza. Guess I've been spoilt by how Lou Malnati let's you order them while waiting for a table.
It isn't technically Chicago style pizza, but it is my absolute favorite pizza in Chicago. Try the ground beef pizza, it's not the most traditional topping but on their pan style it really works.

Great place, great food, today unfortunately the service did not meet up to par. Waitress/server Never gave her name and just seemed to be in a rush. Our order was taken and she made sure we always had drinks but a bit friendlier would've worked too. When you get charged for a slice of cake for a birthday girl, you know this ain't the place to celebrate in the future.
Best Pizza I have had in my life, anywhere. Truly this place is Legendary. I miss it like you miss old lovers.

Just received my delivery...absolutely yuck. Thin Crust Basil, Tomatoe & Garlic was undercooked, had no basil & too garlicky (& I looove garlic). Thin Crust Half Pepperoni & Half Sausage was a thick crust, burnt & all pepperoni & all sausage. Neither pizza had any taste. Appetizer Sampler was inedible. Will never ever eat Pequod's again.
Sweet sauce, amazing crust and perfect amount of gooey cheese. The pepperoni was crispy and the pizza wasn't greasy! Totally worth the drive out. Worth the hype!!!
Their pan pizza is good. I wouldn't get thin crust as it's not the same and here are better options, but their pan pizza is bueno.

Okay, so this is my favorite pizza of all time. Sadly, I haven't gotten it as many times as I would like. The personal pizza I recently ordered really lacked flavor compared to the full size deep dish I normally get to share. The biggest issue I've had here is when I waited an hour for a large pizza for pick up, went to pick it up to find out they made the wrong size. The size they made would not have been enough food for my group, so they offered the pizza they made at a discount, or wait another 40 minutes for the pizza I ordered. I had no choice but to wait and still had to pay full price for the pizza. No discount, no apology, nothing. Really frustrating. Such a shame as I've always been such an advocate for this place and have stayed away lately.  Might have to venture out to the Morton grove location to get my fix!

5 star pizza- 3 star service. Really good pizza. Went on pizza tour and fell in love with the pizza. Went back our next trip to Chicago and the pizza was great again but the service wasn't the best. Didn't mind waiting an hour for pizza but the waitress seemed like they could care less if they we were there or not. Constantly had to wait for soft drink refills. Will come back for the pizza but wishing for a five star experience next time.

Unfortunately it's kind of easy to get tired of deep dish pizza sometimes as a Chicagoan, but this place never disappoints. The wait time can be a bit unbearable at times but if you have the patience, it's for sure worth it, and it's nice that even on a Sunday at like 11 p.m. it still feels busy, not like you're at a place where they're waiting to chase you out. Tips: go for the deep dish that has the full layer of sausage meat in it, and try the WINGS. You've been waiting to get a table for a while, and the food is going to take even longer once you're seated, and you won't be sad you ordered the wings while you're waiting. Delivery is pretty great, too, but don't order when you're hungry as it usually takes a while (90 min or more, sometimes 2 hours) even if you're close by. The food almost always still shows up hot though.

My party of 8 dined here for lunch on a Saturday . We used the website to request seating a few days in advance . We were seated right away. The food was amazing. We ordered the appetizer combo, everything tasted fresh. We also had a sausage and cheese thin crust pizza, it was really good. A few people in my party thought the sausage tasted weird or like it came from a box. I do not eat sausage so I wouldn't know. I would come back
Yummiest deep dish in town. Period! Must go, must try.

I have never dined at the restaurant, only ordered delivery.  It will be a minimum 90 minute wait to get your delivery so order early.  The individual pan pizzas are great, I am a big fan of the spinach as it is fresh and not frozen.  The Pequods salad is awesome although the big chunks of raw yellow onion are overpowering.

I'm writing this in hopes that someone from ownership or upper managment sees it and can talk some sense into their management team......I ordered a large pizza for deliver and I ordered half pepperoni and half veggies (because of dietary restrictions) When the pizza arrived, there was only 2 slices that did not have meat on it. This was obviously an error on the pizza makers part, but mistakes happen. I called to see what we could do to fix the situation the manager over the phone was (and still is) a complete jackass! He said "That just means some pepperonis laid to the side while in transit & we don't guarantee our half doers to actually be half" Really? That is the worst attitude and approach you could take to this situation. I work in the restaurant industry and have done so for the past 6 years. I have managed, served, bar backed, hosted, etc......I can't even wrap my head around how ownership can allow this manager to talk to his guests the way he did. I certainly understand that mistakes happen, but the way this was handled was absolutely terrible.  Losing me as a customer, I'm sure will not effect your business at all, but if you keep up this attitude, I promise you sill start to see a significant decrease in sales.  PLENTY of other delicious pizza available. Good riddance UPDATE: Someone from management (Sean) reached out to me and offered his help in coming to a resolution. When I proposed a fair resolution- He did the most un professional thing possible and IGNORED AND DID NOT RESPOND, after HE INITIATED A RESOLUTION.....

I really liked the deep dish here! The pizza was soft and moist but the crust was still nice and crisp! It was worth the wait! I think their pizza is a good size and can definitely serve up to 4 people. Definitely check this place out if you're in Chicago!
Always great and worth the wait! The pizza is amazing!!  Best pizza in the city hands down!  I will definitely be back again! Great Staff and Atmosphere!
Great pizza dine in or carry out....Always consistent. Love the deep dish....

Food was good but massive mess up the one thing I was adamant about was that there was no cheese on any of the salads what was there to much cheese for my vegan girlfriend to notice. Good going guys.  Also pineapple is not a veggie it's a fruit.

Pequod's is coasting on their reputation. The pan pizza is mostly bread and short on cheese and toppings. This is only thick focaccia with too much tomato sauce, and not enough cheese, toppings, or flavor.  On two visits, the pizza was under-cooked. We waited a very long time for everything, so...did not send it back. The sauce is goopy and wet, which creates the illusion of more content that there actually is. While the caramelized crust is okay, it's not enough to save this weak pie. The deep dish they served me looked as if they cooked it for 15 minutes. The deep dish I prefer is a pie, with layers of ingredients, which would take 45 minutes to cook. Look at how many tables they are turning over, how small the kitchen is, and it makes sense that these are "fast cook specials" i.e. - mostly bread. While I can enjoy a non-pretentious atmosphere, the decor and vibe is out of date, cramped, and creaky. Goes to show how powerful (yet wrong) word of mouth can be, as people are waiting in line up to 2 hours to even get in the door.  Service was not good for me at the bar, as the bartender was chatting with his co-workers more than attending to his (3) customers. Space is cramped: If you sit at the bar be prepared for every single guest walking in to be seated, pass within inches of you. I was (unintentionally) hit in the back by elbows, carry out containers, and even an employee's silverware carrier.  Not worth it at all. Do not believe the hype.
