Have had on numerous occasions.  Fantastic always.  The crust is quite possibly better than Lou Mals butter crust.  I go back and forth continuously.  One thing that puts this place ahead of Lous is the amount of toppings they put on.  It is ridiculous in a great way.  Order it well done.   Favorite thick/pan pizza in America.  Keep up the good work.

Generally, I'm a pretty calm individual. Unless it comes to pizza. I will literally fight anyone who bad mouths Chicago style pizza. (Why are there so many people who hate on the deep dish?! It's a lot of people I have to fight!) So when I got the opportunity to visit Chicago, and got the opportunity to try authentic deep dish, I was in a pizza-induced haze for the weeks leading up to the trip. My boyfriend's brother lives in Chicago, and recommended Pequod's as a place the locals eat at. Now, I don't know how accurate that statement is, especially since I'm not a local, but it was crowded nonetheless! Very crowded. As a party of 4, it took a little while to get seated, but not long at all to be a bother. (I've had longer waits at an Olive Garden.) We ordered two pizzas, with a multitude of toppings, and waited. Both my boyfriend's brother and the waitress warned that it was going to be a while, so I got a salad also. It was delicious, and helped pass the time while I waited for the magnificence that is Chicago deep dish. And when it came, delivered piping hot to the table, I swear I almost fainted. I wish I got pictures, because it was literally one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen in my life. Much like one of the wonders of the world, it'll take your breath away. Don't even talk to me about my first bite. It's just a void in my memory because as soon as I put a bite in my mouth, I ascended to a different plane of existence. When I came back down, I can remember the bubbly, gooey cheese, and the flavorful robust sauce, and the crunchy, caramelized crust. My mouth is watering just thinking about it now... Oh, how I wish I could go back! The pizza was so good! The service was fantastic, too. And the price, for the literal pounds of food you're getting, is very worth it. And the interior is very cozy and very homey. One of my favorite parts of Chicago, for sure!

About as good as deep dish gets in my book. The cheesy crust may look burnt but it's the best part of the pie - don't throw it away! On the downside, something clearly needs to be done about the wait times given that reservations aren't really taken.

Great pizza, this is my go to place for out of town visitors that want to try Chicago deep dish. I like thats its outside of downtown area and visitors can see how chicago looks outside of the hustle and bustle downtown

Great service - really friendly! I brought 17 co-workers here on Friday for lunch and they were so accommodating! I called an hour beforehand and before we got there, they had set-up a table and small, semi-private area for us! The food was incredible - the personal pans, appetizers and salads were all a hit!

I've had super mixed experiences with Pequod's.  The first time I tried it, it was the best deep dish I've ever had.  Perfectly cooked crust, awesome sausage, tons of cheese.  However, the last two times I ordered from them, it took almost two hours for my order to arrive, and it wasn't quite as good.  It got a bit doughy, and the crust wasn't as good as that first night.  I'll probably give it one last try for delivery, and I'm guessing it's best eaten at the restaurant, but I've had less than stellar experiences overall.
My number one spot for deep dish pizza in town. About 15 min drive from downtown Chicago but definitely worth the drive.

I'm obsessed with their deep dish. The best I've tried so far!I traveled from the south side of Chicago just to try it out and I'm extremely impressed. Will most definitely be back sometime soon. Worth it
Pizza was marginal and service was average at best. Heard a lot of good things about this place from the locals, but it definitely didn't live up to the hype. One and done for me.

Overall disappointed. A group of six of us were excited to enjoy Pequod's pizza after seeing a movie across the street earlier tonight; the pizza fulfilled our cravings but the service left us hungry for attention. We were expecting a decent wait since six of us were going around dinner time; fortunately, the wait was only around 15-20 minutes. But then realized this table was open when we originally checked in with the host staff. Our server mentioned the pizza would take about 45 minutes and suggested the combo appetizer plate while we waited. We did order it but wouldn't suggest spending money on it. We expected the wait for the pizza to be around 45 minutes as she mentioned but in the end it took well over an hour. During our wait we asked the host staff if the Cubs game could be turned on since the Bears game was on every other TV. The original TV we asked for it to be put on was denied; however, they did put it on another TV nearby but only for 5 minutes before another guest said they wanted to watch the Bears. Considering they have several TVs which all had the Bears game on, having the Cubs who had a better chance at winning the game (and did!) didn't seem to much to ask. It took forever for us to receive our bill. The bill also included a drink that one of us ordered although it was never delivered. When we mentioned that to our waitress she first questioned us but then apologized and removed it from the bill.  Overall the pizza was good; however, the service needs a lot of improvement before we will return.

My first real chicago deep dish pizza! We walked in a few minutes after they open, and there were already a few customers inside... a good sign. Took about an hour which is reasonable, so we ordered a half order of fries to keep us entertained (yum and cheap). A "small" pizza has only 4 slices but is definitely enough to feed two people.  That delicious smell of freshly made pizza, the cheese string lasting forever, the toppings are big and juicy. and stuffed at capacity. The crust is solid... crispy crunchy almost cookie like. The sides are baked with caramelized cheese and is almost 4 inches high. Very satisfying. Staff was friendly and was great at helping us customize our perfect pizza!

Ordered from here on a Saturday night and took about an hour 1/2 for the food to be delivered. We decided to go wild and ordered mozzarella sticks, onion rings, spinach thin crust pizza, pepperoni and sausage pan pizza, carrot cake and red velvet cake.  * Mozzarella Sticks - cheesy goodness and the marinara sauce that came with it has extra tasty. Not sure if they put cheese or something else in sauce, but it was delicious. (5 stars)  * Onion Rings - crispy and crunchy. They come with BBQ sauce which made them even better (4 stars). * Spinach Thin Crust Pizza - the sauce was bland city. I wouldn't get this again. (1 star)  * Pepperoni and Sausage Pan Pizza - so meaty, great amount of sauce and nice crispy crust. They give you nice chunks of sausage, which have a sweet taste to them. I recommend ordering this pizza with these toppings. (4.5 stars) * Carrot Cake - was good, but the slice was super small for the $5.95 price they charged (3.5 stars) * Red Velvet Cake - my friend said it had a pizza taste to it (this was said after he brushed his teeth) and was the worst red velvet he ever had (1 star). All and all if you going to order/dine at Pequod's I recommend sticking to the appetizers and pan pizza.

Simply the best pan-ish style pizza hands down. The pie is so full of flavor with the right combination of cheese and toppings along with the traditional cheese/baked outer crust. Remember - while thin crust is on the menu - do not order it - always go for their famous Pan
Best deep dish pizza in Chicago! The cheese crust makes the difference! The ambiance is more like a pub! Definitely recommend either if you're visiting Chicago or are here for good

I thought I didn't like deep dish pizza. Then I ate a pedquods. I apologize for now for my immature dislike of something so damn good.  Best pizza in Chicago. Absolutely loved it and could unfortunately eat many many more. So delicious.  Pizza was available late as well which is great after a fun night in Chicago.  A must try!

Customer service is shit. Don't get me wrong, I understand that when a restaurant has a substantial following, they give less shits about their customers, but this is ridiculous.  We ordered a pizza at 126 am, had to repeat my credit card number 6 times before she actually got it right. Then, we call to check on our order and the person can find no order for us. None. Gave our number, name we put it under, address, nothing can be found. Super pissed. Finally we get a manager on the phone. She says they guarantee it by 302am?  Ok. It's 303am, and guess what? No pizza.  We called back to see where it is and with a bitchy attitude says its in the same place that it has been the last two times you called.  Fuck this place.

Pizza is okay, but I would never dine in here again. We ordered takeout because of the line, and when it arrived they said we could eat at the bar. As soon as we sat down, the bartender decided that because we came from takeout we weren't going to order anything and weren't worth a second of her time. No waters, no napkins, no utensils, she didn't care to spend one second. Disgraceful. Too bad, we actually DID want beers. The lady at the takeout register took care of us (when it was obviously not her job), and I made sure to put the tip in her hands.
This place is so overrated.  Who likes burnt pizza?  I have never eaten in, only had delivery.  But there is way better pizza in Chicago.

I'm not a Chicagoan.  I don't mind Deep Dish, I love cheese.  But to me, it's more of a casserole type of pizza.  I have tried about 5 different places deep dish here in the city and this one is far and above the best.  The pepperoni is so crispy and there's the yummy slightly crispy cheese parts around the edge.  And the crust isn't super sweet like all the other deep dish places!  That's a big one for me.   I would never wait the 2 hrs for my pizza again.  1 hr outside and then 1 hr at our table.  It was Saturday around 8 so our bad for the timing, but, it is way better to eat there than delivery.  Doesn't hold up well with delivery.  At least up to Lakeview area.   Anyhow, it's delicious.  Highly recommend for ppl that want deep dish but aren't huge deep dish fans.  In my opinion :)
The pan pizza is a staple and the thin crust isn't too far behind. The dining service has always been so-so (My party invested 3 hours one time due to waitstaff errors). Overall a great place.
Great deep dish but also a little something for everyone in case you're not a deep dish fan.  Salads and regular thin crust pizza are amazing as well.

We ordered delivery from Pequod's around 4:15pm on a Sunday, and it was delivered at about 5:45pm.  Do I think the wait was worth it?  Not really.  Maybe the driver delivered others before us, but the pizza was basically glued to the box and it wasn't hot (or even very warm).  The sausage was very tasty, but the abundance of cheese was way too much.  I think I'll have to try it at the restaurant next time to understand the hype.  Overall, it was decent pizza, but I rather have pizza from elsewhere in the city.

So our waitress was a real sweetie, but overall we waited about 45 minutes to get in around 6pm (earlier than peak according to Google), then when we ordered, we were told it was going to be about an hour for a deep dish pizza. It's understandable I suppose, but the folks across from us sat down much later than us and their deep dish came about ten minutes earlier than ours. When ours arrived it was definitely not the temperature we'd assumed it would be (we both had fun picking up the pan with our bare hands) and we really questioned what all the hype over this place is about once we'd had a slice. I'm not an expert, but I did have my first deep dish just 4 days before coming to this place and enjoyed it much more.  At Pequod's, the crust is flavorless and takes up about 75% of the height of the dish. We were expecting much more sauce and much more cheese. And much more flavor. Overall the only thing not disappointing about this place was the sausage and the whale shaped mozzarella cheese they'd grated on the salad.

Bruh. Why does this place exist and can I have one for Christmas? Best pizza in the city, hands down. I don't even like deep dish pizza and I will eat an entire pan pizza by myself and not share. The burnt, crispy crust is the business. The sauce and toppings are fresh and tasty. My go to for pizza.

came here on my visit to Chicago since everyone swear by it.  I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza due to the tomato sauce, I normally get the white sauce pizza because the red sauce is a bit sour for me. However I could actually enjoy the pizza here as the sauce is not sour, and everything together makes it quite delicious.  Call ahead so you don't have to wait for hours and also place your pizza order over the phone because those deep deep dish pizza takes over an hour to make especially when it's busy.

I have been going to Pequod's from about 15 years. I don''t lie in the area, but try to make it out there every now-and-then. They char the edge of the pizza crust topped with cheese making their already delicious pizza so much better. It is truly unique and really tasty. The location is your standard pizza joint, nothing fancy, but last I was there they were quite family-friendly. The staff is also diner-friendly, some friendlier than others.

When there's over an hour wait for a place, you know it's good. I ended up ordering to-go because it was already pretty late on a Friday night and there isn't a huge abundance of seating in the restaurant. Long wait aside, this is some quality pan pizza and after trying Lou Manalti's as well, I can say Pequod's is definitely the superior pizza.  Ordered the large (14 inch) pan pizza, with pepperoni, mushroom, olive, and sausage. All the ingredients were fresh. Pizza wasn't too oily. Mozzarella was stringy. And sauce had good tart zing. On my second slice, I realized they do use a lot of crust on the bottom, but when you're eating it you don't really notice.  The caramelized crust is crack. Single-handedly the best pizza crust I've ever had.  Bottom line: great quality deep-dish pizza.

It was good, very good. But my personal preference is still Malnati's.  The big difference is the the crust. The crust here was thick and airy, like focaccia bread. If that's what you like, this is your place.

This is the greatest pizza in Chicago. Period. I've had Lou's and Giordano's and local spots and this blows all out of the water. I had this pizza from delivery on a rainy Valentine's day with my girl and fresh out of the oven with my colleagues and it is consistently delicious. The sauce is impeccable (not too sweet or too watery) and the crust is a caramelized delight. It's deep dish that isn't overly bready. Don't even bother with thin crust, just go for the special. You'll have to wait a little while for it to cook, but it is worth all the pennies!

hmmm... i don't know.  either we went on an off night, or this place is supremely hyped up.  i honestly don't know if we went on an off night, because people were waiting outside to be seated.   long story short, it took over an hour to get our pizza, and once the pizza arrived, the bottom was burnt and there was not enough cheese. maybe i'm holding this place to such a high standard, but i should right??? Michelin recommend this place, and you know if they recommend it... it has to be good.  the crust and bread holding the pizza was just too thick and the sauce was kinda lacking.  the price for a small pizza is roughly 12 bucks, and toppings are an extra 2 bucks.    not to mention, parking is almost impossible to find on the streets, so you'll have to park across the street at he movie theater lot for 10 bucks. =/  i was going in with high hopes, but this place fell short of them.

Pequods is my love. Their crust just gets me. So caramelized and delicious - so good. I would suggest going at an off time otherwise the wait time get pretty long. Getting it to-go just isnt the same for me but that's also an option. One of my favorite pizza places to eat at in Chicago.

GO HERE NOW!! This was the BEST deep dish EVER! Casual bar vibe with a great selection of local beers on tap. We had such a nice server with blonde hair, I forgot her name. The pizza tho is incredible....heaven on earth. DON"T come to Chicago and NOT eat here - it's a MUST!! Get the sausage!

Now this is what I came to Chicago for...some DELICIOUS deep dish pizza!! It's a telling sign when multiple people I know in Chicago tell me that Pequod's is their favorite pizza joint. We came here for lunch and there was still about a 30-45 minute wait. I like how Pequod's isn't a chain (compared to Lou's) and it has a much more homey vibe to it. It's a great pizza pub. It's not located in the downtown area, but it's a definite must if you're visiting Chicago. The trek out is worth it. My buddy and I split a small pizza. They don't have pre-set pizzas on the menu; they really encourage customization. We settled on the cheese only with sausage, pepperoni, mushroom and onion. Talk about out-of-this-world pizza!!! I'm a huge fan of deep-dish and to get an authentic taste of Chicago deep-dish pizza was amazing. Everything, from the crust to the toppings, was delicious. I love how the crust is caramelized and I loved the thickness of the pan pizza. Not to mention, the sausages were huge!! Let's just say that each bite was magical. The wait once you're seated can be a while because they make each pizza to order. It might be a good idea for them to take your order while you're waiting to be seated in order to speed up the process. In any case, the wait is definitely worth it and it's probably one of the best deep dish pizzas I've had. I can't wait to go back when I'm in town!
Always delicious even though it takes 50 years for a pizza. But how else are they going to get the crust so perfectly crispy?? Love Pedquod's.

Best pizza in the world! Pepperoni, sausage, meatball.. love them all. Delivery can take awhile and sometimes may make sense to order half baked and finish in your oven. (Honestly, it comes out perfect.) I'd avoid getting too many vegetable toppings on same pie, as the veggies are cut kinda big. Lunch special is the best deal on the planet. Been eating this for a decade and never disappointed.

This pizza was awesome... Loved the crust! I had cheese and my brother had sausage and we were both very happy. Service could have been a little better especially since it wasn't busy but the food was great:)

Really good pizza, but service is as bad as the food is good. I've been there many times and I get the impression they think they are doing you a favor by serving you. They DO get backed up, since they are popular, featured on Food Network and such, but they are very disorganized as well. If you're ordering takeout, expect to sit there for 10 minutes twiddling your thumbs even if your pizza is ready. They have really bad communication between the counter and kitchen.  Once their power was out during a storm and I remember thinking; "Oh boy if they can't get it together during normal conditions this'll be a challenge." I probably waited 45 minutes or so only to be told they lost my order. I was polite and realized it wasn't their fault but I got a major "Can't you JUST WAIT??" attitude which didn't surprise me much. The food IS good but Chicago has so many great pizza options I don't really think much about coming here.

By far the BEST pizza in Chicago!!!  Thick caramelized crust, choose your toppings.  It does not get any better.  This pizza place was recommended to us by a local so we went there.  It's north of most of the  downtown activities but so worth the extra time it takes to get there.  We went twice during out time there it was sooooo good!!!!
Truly delicious pizza!  I've tried pizzas from coast to coast and this is truly the best I've had.  Perfect crust and just the right amount of all the ingredients.  Spot on flavor
Sooooooo disappointed! Ordered extra cheese & barely got any on a 16" Thin. 6 tiny pieces of sausages? What is up with the "hype" on this pizza? No real taste yo the sauce & too much dough.

Let me preface this review by saying that I'm not a super big fan of pizza, no matter it's shape or form, but I can appreciate a good deal when I see it. My wife and I wanted to experience the Chicago Deep Dish pizza and found this place to be well loved by the Yelp community. First of all, if you are relying on public transportation, be willing to go on a mini hike across the LePaul campus to get to this little gem. We came here on a weekday, just barely making it to the lunch specials, which was a personal 7" cheese pizza for less than $5. That is freaking amazing! Of course, we splurged a little bit more, added numerous toppings, and got a small side salad for $2 and a local, honey infused root beer. Alright, I wasn't a big fan of the salad or the root beer, but it wasn't that bad either. You can see from the menu that Pequod makes each pizza individually, with a minimum wait of 30 minutes to accommodate for the toppings. I initially thought we'd be safe from that wait time since the restaurant was fairly empty (which is unusual, based on the reviews), but I guess the wait time is unique to a deep dish pizza. MY biggest disappointment, aside from the pizza being salty, was that it was served on a regular plate, instead of a deep dish. Ok, so 7" pizza may not have needed it, but it would have given an unique illusion of a deep dish pizza. We eagerly scarfed down the pizza and found it to be perfect sufficient for the two of us. Unfortunately, I got incredibly nauseous a few hours after lunch, so I had to dock a point for that.  Food: 3 stars Price: 4 stars Ambiance: 3 stars Service: 3.5 stars.

If this review were for the pizza itself, it would be five stars. But when I called for delivery, and pulled up the delivery zone map, they refused to deliver to us. We live in Logan Square at Milwaukee and Sacramento. As you can see in the map, that is clearly within the boundaries of their delivery zone. And yet they refused to deliver. So I asked to speak to the manager, who unapologetically also refused to take the order, claiming my address "didn't show up in their system." You can't show one thing on your website and then just respond with "Well I don't know what to tell ya." Beware Logan Square residents. No Pequods for you.

This was so far out of our way, but I was told by a friend to go.  This hidden gem was worth the trek.    This is a hole in the wall, locals only bar with great pizza.  This is not a tourist stop and shouldn't be.  We were able to get a cold beer and a personal pizza for lunch.  The pizzas were everything I hoped a Chicago pizza should be.   Our service was outstanding.  I was a little concerned when we walked in, but the entire staff did a great job.  They were very friendly.

Visited from California, this place was recommended  by two different people! It was definitely worth the trek out of downtown for amazing deep dish! Sausage and pepperoni! The crust suprising.. but  might be some of the best pizza in my life. Takes a little while depending on how busy it is for the pizza, but a beer and a appetizer  will  make for one magic meal

I don't get the hype for pequods. No cheese, and way too much dough. I get that it's deep dish but all of that bread is not necessary with no Cheese to compliment it. Just a crunchy outer crust, doughy pizza with sauce. Sorry but Lou malnatis all the way!!

This is as legit as it gets to chill with some buddies or significant other in a very casual environment.   The thing to get is there pan pizza and a couple of beers, end of story.  No particular ingredients, anything tastes great!   If you are looking for a good pizza place to visit at night, look no further!   Super chill staff.  You will feel right at home.

Really is as good as it gets. No specialty pizza needed. Classic cheese, sausage or pepperoni is enough to make anyone believe that the pan pizza is the perfect style pizza there is. And Pequod's sizzles. The cheese is puffy and stringy. When you bite in, you keep biting for a hot second. There's a lot of pizza there. I'd eat it at least once a week if it was more conveniently located!!

Pequod's. Pequod's. Let me count the ways I love you.  1. That caramelized crust: It makes my taste buds water just remember that deliciousness. 2. That sauce: not too overpowering but spread evenly across. 3. The pepperoni and sausage: delicious flavors that compliment the cheese and the sauce perfectly.  4. The mozzarella sticks: the best I've ever had. The cheese and the breading and  the marinara - they've perfected the formula. 5. The Pequod's Salad: a delicious salad with meat and cheese and pepperoncini. I've heard about Pequod's ever since I moved to Chicago in 2010. But I never went ... until last week. And now I've been twice in the less than a week. Because the pizza is amazing. The service is great. Everything is amazing.  I've ordered the pan pizza twice with friends and it's amazing. The caramelized cheese with a sturdy, yet flaky crust makes an amazing vehicle for the cheese and sauce and toppings. Every bite is a little taste of heaven.  I love pizza of all types but this is incredible. It's officially made it's way into the number 2 spot in my list of favorite pizzas, which had been occupied by Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza for over a decade. But now it goes 1) Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinder's pizza pot pies, 2) Pequod's pan pizza, and 3) Lou Malnati's deep dish.

Best Chicago style pizza! Skip all of the other touristy places and head up to Pequod's.  They have the best lunch deal! For less than $5 you can get a personal cheese deep dish and a drink. Don't miss this! You know this a good place when Chicago PD is eating there.

There are hundreds of pizza places. However, Pequod's is different. Their pizza is worth the trip, the difficulty to find parking and often the wait to get in. The secret is in the carmelized crust. If you want a deep dish that is worth the calories, flavorful, and some, if not the best pizza in the city this is the place to try.
Some of the best deep dish EVER! One of our favorite spots for pizza over Lou's, over gino's, giordanos, you name it. The crust is best part.
The BEST pizza in Chicago. Don't go to the tourist traps. Go here. Get a thin crust pizza. Trust me.

I never fathomed giving my favorite pizza joint in the entire city of Chicago three stars, but I am. The pizza continues to be stellar, but the service has gotten bad. Really bad. On my second to last visit, July 25 for lunch, our server was also the bartender. She was very unfriendly and acted like we were a bother. Then, to top it off, our lunchtime special pizzas arrived with the wrong toppings. Fast forward to a couple days ago, September 4 in the early evening, when our pizza again arrived with the wrong toppings. We had to ask twice for refills because the server forgot. And the pizza took 1.5+ hours, nearing two hours! We were told because it had "a lot of toppings." I've been going to Pequods for almost 10 years, ordered very similar pizzas, and never heard that excuse. Do you mean you forgot to put in the order, perhaps? Or maybe the kitchen messed it up? Who knows what happened, but when waiting a total of 2.5+ hours, it was disappointing to end up with the wrong pizza. I recommend the servers repeat back the toppings to customers. I know Pequods has a loyal following (that was once me) but you can't let service fall by the wayside.

We visited Pequod's for the first time on Friday, September 2nd.  We arrived at about 8:15PM.   As a visitor, it appears that there are three main competitors that are popular with both locals and tourists.  Pequod's, Lou Malnati's and Gino's East.   Well, Pequod's was our favorite of the two that we tried (The other one was Lou Malnati's). We absolutely loved the crust and the way they browned the cheese that was melted over the crust.  We found the pizza and toppings to taste delicious and we were pleased with the amount of sauce and cheese used.   I would DEFINITELY RETURN and eat here again,.  Why three stars?  I have one suggestion. I wish you would be able to "order ahead" once you put your name in and then by the time you get your table, there was less of a wait. I know, that would probably cut into profits for ordering other things like appetizers and drinks; however, during busy times, would that really be a problem?  It seems like there is always someone waiting anyway. Secondly, and due to no fault of the restaurant, there was a group of really, really drunk party of five slurring generalized insults the entire time.  They were rude, throwing food around, saying discriminatory things that several tables could hear and just were a terrible group of people to be sitting around.   Should we have said anything? I'm not sure whether we should or not.  The server who very clearly heard them should have been the one to take care of the issue (I personally believe) So, overall -- our favorite pizza -- and we would return.

Came here today for lunch and had a personal pizza with pepperoni and sausage. As someone who makes their own pizza from scratch several times a week, I thought this pizza was ok. The toppings were very fresh and the wait time wasn't as long as lou malnati's.  If you are used to your large chain restaurant pizzas such as pappa johns and pizza hut you will probably think this pizza tastes amazing.

Such a long long wait that the pizza doesn't taste as good as anticipated. The dough tasted bland, the toppings were good, overall just okay, but seriously do something about the staff, we made reservations online and still waited almost 2 hours. They said you must have a confirmation when you reserve! Remember that!

This place has really gone downhill.  4-5 years ago it was great but the quality has gone way down.  We went in for a table and it was a 2 hour wait!  I got my buzzer and they told me it would only work at their "new bar" the Whale tale"... I always go next door to The Drinkingbird.  They have half priced Draft beers on Sunday's!  Pequods told me the buzzer wouldn't work there (lie). The people that work there are great but pizza quality went down and they try to get you to pay $7 for a bud light at their new spot when I can get a good beer next door for cheaper!  Don't know why they would disrespect their neighbors!  Going to Lou's for now on

I'm gonna give this place a 3 because their pizza was was just ok BUT I will need to think twice before returning. Went with a group of bad moms after catching the movie nearby.  Service was awful---we did not get menus till about 15 minutes after we were seated and it took more than an hour and half to be served.  Our appetizers arrived with the pizza; the bottle of wine we ordered to accompany appetizers arrived warm and way after the pizza. Our soft drinks were never refilled since we saw our waitress twice: At time Of order and time Of payment.    Atmosphere was good but the bathrooms were scary.  Not only dirty and non-functional but very trashy looking.   We paid for parking.  Doubt I'll return.
Chicago deep dish is the same everywhere, load it with bunch of cheese and tomato sauce. But this place has great value when compared to Lous or Giardinos
Yumme yumme yummee!!! One of my favorite places when I visited Chicago. Ordered the large deep dish pizza and 3 orders of wings. Both were delicious! I am a pizza lover, this place didnt dissappoint.

This Pizza wasn't better than Pizzeria Due,Came in and ordered a personal to go ,they gave it to me uncut I asked could they cut it ,the guy at the front desk wearing the CIA wire said they don't cut personal pizzas.that's like saying we don't take dollars on 5s and up,gtfoh..

I absolutely love pizza and after first reading about Pequod's in Bon Appetit (my food bible), I had been jonesing to swing by for a personal pan pizza. I finally did just that and I got the lunch special for $4.95 which included a personal pan pizza and a soda. Since this was my first visit, I wanted to try the pizza with cheese only. I was quoted a 30 minute wait and it did take 30 minutes. I love burned cheese and the pizza was good, especially the crust! While it was good, in my opinion, it doesn't top Giordano's, which still ranks as my favorite deep dish pizza ever.

My sister & I came here Monday afternoon and we made it in time for the lunch special. We tried Lou Manalti's the other night, but we weren't amazed. On the other hand, Pequod's took our breath away. The Chicago Lunch Special is Monday - Friday 11 AM to 3 PM. You get a 7" cheese pan pizza and soda (no refills) for $4.95. If you want to add any other toppings, there is a charge per topping. For two lunch specials (w/ toppings), the bill came out to be around $12. One thing that I hate about Chicago deep dish pizza is the wait, but Pequod's was worth it. The crust was buttery and flakey. The sauce was amazing and it was cheesy (but not too cheesy). I highly recommend going here as the flavor is outstanding.

So I ordered a full order of pasta with a side salad specifically asked for marinara sauce on top of the pasta with the melted cheese I hope I get the post a picture because they are as dry as can be no Parmesan cheese at all maybe I'm supposed to request that but actually it should automatically come with it so that will go in the garbage because I work 12-hour shifts and there's no way I'm going to wait 12 hours to eat and hopefully the salad will fill me up I will never order from them again!!!!!  NEVER AGAIN!!!!

I believe the Pizza was OK, Kind of like a French bread with pizza stuff on top.  It may have been better had the 60-80 minute wait had not become a 125 min wait but who knows.  I like supporting the little guy but this place is so busy it is ridiculous, they do send you 2 doors down to their new waiting room / Bar and give you 10% off of your tab if you drink down there but still.  With the volume of people going through this place they could at least afford to have the commercial free Pandora playing rather then the commercials ruining the music every 30 minutes, which you notice when you sit for over 2 hours then another hour for you pizza to come out.  Would I go back?  Probably not.

Deep dish pizza doesn't get better than this.  I don't even usually eat this style of pizza, but I make an exception for Pequod's.  Generally there's plenty of seating, there's an upstairs area if you walk in and it feels crowded.  Service is fast and friendly.

Pequod's brings back those good ole memories when I used to live in Bucktown and used to order on a late night to fulfill my pizza craving and/or after a late night of drinking. For those who need a break from the typical Chicago style deep dish, try Pequod's.  I had this with a friend and she didn't eat the crust and I was like, "Wth you doing, don't be ridiculous and eat your crust!" She thought it was burnt and that it was just another piece of crust like all generic pizza crusts. Their caramelized crust is to die for alone, although I'm pretty sure it's not good for your health haha ;( (oh well YOLO) The sauce to cheese ratio is perfect and the sauce has a nice tangy taste that isn't overbearing. I usually get jalapenos, pe=pperoni and mushrooms on mine to keep it simple. The jalapenos gives it a nice kick to complement the tanginess of the sauce. There's always a line running down towards Webster so just a heads up for y'all who have special plans afterwards. If you live in the area, delivery is your best bet to avoid long lines or if you're feeling lazy on a Sunday afternoon.
One of the best pizza joints in the city. May not be the healthiest, but hey , it's pizza. Want healthy ? Go someplace & get a salad.

Be. Prepared. To. Wait. (no matter the hour) Good deep dish, not the greatest in Chicago.  Dough is a bit bland as is the sauce.  Make sure you add lots of yummy toppings to make the pizza worthwhile.  Would I eat here again? Yes.  Would I choose this pizza over another place? No.

They're making pizza the right way here. I'm not a huge fan of the traditional Chicago deep dish style- but Peaquod's really nails it. The pizza pub atmosphere is great for a few draft beers and a couple slices. They make the pizza in such a way that the crust and end of the pizza is carmelized giving a crunchy bite of cheese. It's simply good, and unique from the other deep dish spots in the area. Can't miss this one!

I was in Chicago last weekend and on Sunday night me and my buddy wanted to gorge on some good Chicago Deep Dish pizza. I had tasted deep dish before, and knew what to expect. My buddy and I were bar hopping, and every bartender we spoke to told us to visit Pequod's Pizzeria for the best experience. As we were in downtown, we had to Uber it to this location, and it was less than a ten minute ride.  It was late on Sunday night, so luckily for us the place was not totally packed although they only had a few tables where we could seat ourselves. Since we are vegetarians and were only two people, we ordered the ten inch, and added veggies (onions, tomatoes etc) to the basic pizza. The waitress told us it would take about 30 minutes to get ready, and we knew that going in.  We asked her if we could go next door to Drinking Bird for a quick cocktail (Our bartender friends had also recommended we visit this bar). To our surprise, our waitress had no issues with us leaving the place for 30 minutes, and she did not ask us for a card or pre payment. That was awesome! Upon our arrival, our pizza was at our table and it looked delicious.  Needless to say, it tasted amazing and the crust was so chewy and did not crumble. I cannot vouch for the meat laden pizzas, but ours was top notch. Will make it a point to visit this joint when I am in Chicago next.

-IMPORTANT NOTE: avoid the temptation to order an appetizer to fill the 45 minute cook time.  It's worth the anticipatory wait!! -  Amazing pizza, long waits (for a table and at the table), and one of the top pies in Chicago.  Not sure if it's a "deep dish" in the traditional sense, certainly not "stuffed" (though you will be), maybe more of a "pan pizza" on steroids.  The edge of the crust is magically caramelized, which is awesome on the first piece, from there it loses its structure.  Massive amounts of toppings.  Seriously, you need to try this place.
The pizza is good, but average. Doesn't compare to Lou Malnati's.

I love deep dish and, in the past, have loved Pequods. I picked up a pizza last night and was really excited as I hadn't had Pequods in several months. The pizza was not what I remember. It was mostly bread/dough. I realize this is deep dish, but this wasn't balanced out by the cheese/sauce on too. The pizza managed to be dry. I will likely give Pequods another shot but I won't be craving it like I once did.

BEST DEEP DISH PIZZA IN CHICAGO!  Ok, that's all the yelling I'll do, but yes, just so you get this straight, you can't beat Pequods, it is the absolute best!  If you want to have the warranty of getting seated, you have 2 options: 1- get there before 6 on a week day 2-  call ahead and he put in their list 24 hours before you want to dine  [they don't have reservations, but if you do this they cut your waiting time by half once you get there] If you like pepperoni pizza, go for it, they sprinkle that one with magical rainbow powder that really pairs very well with the cheese caramelization that happens on the cheese at the edge of all the crust. Service has always been great every time we went, and they have a good arrange of local brews. Please tourist, skip Giordanos, come here to get the real deal!
Amazing pizza!  Some of the best pizza in all of Chicago, rivals anything else the city has to offer.
Best deep dish in chicago - yeah, I said it.

Best deep dish in Chicago.  If anyone is ever in from out of town this is my go to "Chicago pizza".  The pizza does take 45 minutes at least to bake, so plan ahead. BUT you won't be disappointed with the delicious, cheesy, crispy, crust.  Just writing this review is making me hungry for Pequod's

The carmelized deep dish pizza here is second to none in the Second City! Great for take out if you live nearby and keep the pizza hot and ready for eating! So many different toppings to create mouth-watering pizzas. I particularly like having pineapple with bacon on mine. The location in Morton Grove is great and very handy for north suburban residents off of I-94. It is located in a charming little woodsy building that is intimate and fun. If you haven't tasted Pequod's, check it out. It is a top-notch Chicago deep-dish pizza experience.

Best deep-dish pizzeria in Chicago!  Okok so I am still a deep-dish newbie as my only previous experience has been Lou Malnati's. But I really dig the way Pequod's prepares its pizza. There is a reasonable layer of cheese on the bottom with plenty of tomato sauce on top and a crispy crust. If you like mounds of oozing cheese, maybe Lou Malnati's is for you. But I prefer the cheese to be a component in my deep dish (because otherwise, I might as well have a lasagna, right?) The two of us split a medium with garlic, onion, and basil on top. We only managed to finish half, however, but that might be because we had an early dinner and had Purple Pig for lunch... But that just means more leftovers for the next day!
This place is great.  Lunch special is amazing and filling but that deep dish is DA BOMB.
Very good service and food we split the appetizer platter and had a personal pan pizza. Not your typical deep dish ver good crust a bit thinner pizza game changer you must try if you love pie!

Best chicago style pizza in the city. I don't always eat deep dish, but when I do, it is Pequod's. Take your out of town friends here or order for pick-up or delivery. Get gardinera on the pizza! Adds another dimension of Chicago flavor and heat!

I've been a diehard fan of a Chicago pizza chain that rhymes with Sue Pavarotti's since I can remember eating pizza. One of my buddies told me that I had it wrong, Pequod's is the ultimate in Chicago style deep dish. Psssshhhh. I've been drowning in deep dish forever and I've never even heard of them. But my roommates and I decided to give it a go. We were all skeptical, and I must confess that we were pretty biased and ready to write them off as just another pizza parlor. We could not have been more wrong. This is HANDS DOWN THE BEST DEEP DISH IN CHICAGO. From the caramel ones crust to the fresh ingredients and amazing sauces, their pizza is unbeatable. The prices are pretty fair, too. If you fancy yourself a deep dish aficionado, or even just a true Chicagoan (those both go hand in hand, anyway) and you haven't been here, you're doing it wrong.

I don't really understand the hype for this place. We went there today as part of a pizza tour. The tour guide hyped it up as being amazing, an institution, a classic, etc....and I gotta say I was REALLY not impressed. The pizza was super "bready". Tough to accurately describe but basically tasted like a somewhat dry dinner roll with some melted cheese and sauce on top. It just really didn't work for me. I've had Chicago style deep dish pies elsewhere, such as Lou Malnati's, that blow the doors off of this place. Maybe I'm missing something. Maybe it's just not for me. But I found it really disappointing.

My personal favorite pizza restaurant in Chicago, the service is good and it's a Blackhawks fan's dream. This is a great date restaurant especially if you pick the spot because it's always a hit. I love the people who work there. They are very busy but still manage to make you feel special.It does take a while to get your Pizza but it's worth it, so plan your time wisely, relax and enjoy this amazing restaurant. Martha Daniel
MY wife's favorite pizza in the City (my second favorite). Love the carmelization on their pan pizza crust.

My first pizza i had from them was nothing special.  I decided to give them another shot and try something a little more diverse.  The crust, sauce, and cheese really cant hold it's own by itself.  GET SOME TOPPINGS AND THIS PIZZA COMES ALIVE!!!!!

Delicious pizza! The deep dish personal size is very filing.  It took about 40 minutes to get our pizza so plan to stay a while and get an appetizer if you're hungry already. We got the cheesy garlic bread and it came out quickly and was very tasty.
cmon. youre kidding yourself if you think this is not the best deep dish in chicago. great atmosphere, great sports bar. great place to watch the blackhawks. friendly service
Incredible pizza. All that needs to be said. Call ahead and they'll get your order started because deep dish/pan pizza takes a while.

I consider this the best deep-dish in Chicago, but ironically the menu says that they serve "pan pizza." From what I can tell, the main difference is that the crust is slightly less thick/tall, but Pequod's makes up for it with an unprecedented crispy and flavorful crust, which is rewarding given that so many deep-dish crusts are just soggy barriers for the delicious fillings. This place just barely beats Lou Malnati's for best Chicago deep-dish. Read about 4 other top Chicago restaurants on Cat the Critic:  catthecritic.wordpress.c…

Would have given them 0 Stars but it wasn't an option so one star was the very least available. I was told by the host that there was a wait  when there was visible seating available. Told I could go upstairs and find a seat but the staff upstairs said I had to speak to the host,which I had already done.. Confusion and no communication amongst the staff. Rude people working with customers, ridiculous. The pizza isn't at all worth the hassle!! Better off getting a Groupon cause Pequods sucks!!

This was one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had. I arrived with my party at 6:30 pm, and was told it would be an hour and a half wait to be seated. At 8:15 pm, we were told by the host that people who called ahead got to skip the line past people who were waiting in person outside the restaurant. I honestly don't understand this logic. After we saw a party of 4 walk in and get seated at a 6 person table before us, we left. I'm sure the food is great, but I can't say, I never found out. The service is just awful though. And with as much competition there is in Chicago for pizza, you would think the customer service would be better.
Customer service is absolutely aweful- and the manager has no respect for the people actually waiting in line to come

Tremendous pizza long wait but well worth it. U need to plan on spending along time waiting but the pizza is off the charts. Caramelized crust is something u must experience because words will never explain the true eating experience. Garlic is a must get with your other toppings. Can't wait to go back.
Hands down best pizza in Chicago.  It's what I recommend to every out of towner.  Forget Lou Malnatis, forget Giordanos, forget Gino's East.  If there is one place to eat pizza here, it's Pequod's.
Nope. It's fine. But that's it. There are maaaaaany better deep dish places out there.

This is the best deep dish pizza! I have to get it every time I go to Chicago. This time I went for lunch and the lunch special is on point! The side salad you get, I would not recommend wasting 2$ or however much it was because it was just some iceberg and cucumbers. The crust is like burnt carmelized cheese, I dream about this pizza and can't wait to go back to Chicago to have it. You have to get sausage on it!
The Pequods I went to was in Morton Grove and its been great for over 35 years!!

Standard LP faire with great pizza and a bar vibe.  The pizza is what you go for, not the ambiance (which is like a college bar), not the location (on a boring intersection on Clybourn). I love their lunch specials and the place is not crowded at that time either.   Try it and you will love it.

Whether you live in Chicago or are just visiting this is by far and away the best pizza in the city.  Make sure you get the carmelized crust.  You cannot go wrong.  Service is good, apps are just OK but you are there for the pizza.
It's worth the wait. I try to steer people here over the other well known deep dish places. Blackhawks games are usually on the TVs with the sound on.

The gnats walking all over the wall probably didn't help me enjoy this restaurant. I've been here twice, hoping I'd understand why the lines are so long to get in, but I haven't.  I don't find the dough or sauce particularly tasty; the crust and sides tend to get burnt in the cooking process, which I think is their "thang" but there's not enough of it on the pizza to really enjoy it. Mixed experience with service.  I ordered pickup once from their Morton Grove location and I'd rate the pizza there a 3.

This is MY FAVORITE pizza in Chicago when it comes to deep dish. There is nothing like it and it's worth the wait if you come during dinner. All of my experiences with staff have been extremely pleasant and the pizza, drinks and appetizers are always what I expect-DELICIOUS! I want Pequods now! Soooooo gooooood! Keep up the excellent work!!

Every time I visit Chicago, I go out of my way to make it to Pequod's. The crust is buttery, flaky and perfectly crisp. According to them, the crust is caramelized. The cheese, sauce and toppings make this some of the best pizza I've ever had.  On my most recent visit, I came at lunchtime and got the 7 inch personal pizza with sausage and black olives. The lunch special comes with a fountain drink for $4.95. I added the toppings so my total was under $7.50. It was delicious and cheap! A few things to note: *It takes awhile to get your pizza (at least 30 minutes but could be 45 minutes if they are busy), so if you are in a hurry, probably not your best bet. *They have great craft beer choices to go with your pizza. *It can get really busy so lunch or a weeknight be a good option. *You MUST go here :) Make sure to check out this amazing pizza place if you live or are in Chicago!
I would wait 5 hours for this pizza it's that good. Give me all the caramelized onion goodness you have. #carbsforlife

Doooooowngrade for delivery - they don't use third parties so you have to call. Understandably it's busy but I got through. Placed an order at 5:30pm. Hour and a half she says. We live 10 minutes away but with my bronchitis and the rain storm figured delivery was the way to go. Got the pizza at 8:30 (double the estimate). Noticed on the receipt the order wasn't put in until 6pm. Received it medium warm and the onion rings were cold - and they forgot the ranch .... straight to garbage and they are my favorite onion rings in Chicago. At least they got the pizza toppings right...? I know you're popular and busy, Pequod's. But at this point you should have a system in place for deliveries. Get it together, P.

Great pizza, but apparently an 8 pm reservation means maybe by 9 and pizza by 10:15. Fine, you're busy, but tell us the truth of the situation so we don't waste our time not getting a table on a Friday night.

Pequod's has really gotten down how to get the perfectly crispy crust. If you love a crispy crust then you will love Pequod's. The taste is great and is a good location for deep dish pizza. The only thing I will add is that they could be a bit more generous with the toppings. I could count the pieces of ham that received on a pizza on 1 hand. Most other pizza locations overload the pizza with toppings.

THAT CARMELIZED CRUST THO.  If you love Chicago and love pizza do yourself a favor and get here. The toppings are delicious and plentiful, the beer menu is great, the service is good and the ambience, is, well, just ok. Not a deal breaker.  It's definitely worth ordering a large and taking the rest home with you.
Best deep dish in Chicago ask for extra cheese and sauce and you will not be disappointed!

I came here, because I've always heard great things about this place. I would definitely direct friends from out of town to Giordano's or Lou Malnati's though. I don't know if my experience was out of the ordinary, but the service was not great as the waitress was not attentive & the deep dish was very dry and bland. It also took about an hour for our pizza to come out.

I want to start by saying the food is great - this review is specifically about our server, who on the check had her name as PP. (The busser said her name was either Katie or Kelly, but he was pretty unsure) - She had the worst service for us. She wasn't very attentive and did not care to refill our waters/sodas, give us napkins, or ask how we were doing; In conclusion she genuinely just did not care about us. She was not friendly. It was odd because she did appear to care a lot more about her other tables in her section. For every 3 times she went up to another table, she only came to us once after we had to flag her down. My group of 7 was very unimpressed with the service, and did not tip her at all.
Chicago. Day 7. Pizza. Deep dish crust - 5/5 Toppings (pepperoni + sausage) - 3/5 Toppings (italian beef + ground beef) - 4/5 Overall, best deep dish I've had. "As good as it gets."

I won't be calling it my favorite pizza... I prefer the stuffed "more cheese less dough" pizza, but that being said it was stupid good pizza. So glad we took up the guy from the apple store's recommendation to give it a try.  Be prepared to wait 50 minutes for your pizza, but when it comes out you will know why.  We loved the caramelized crust!

A friend asked me for a recommendation for Chicago pizza last week. I would have sent him to Burts Place, but he was just driving through the city. Pequods is the first joint that came to mind. Being back in SoCal, I really miss the Chicago deep dish pizza.
So delicious! Chicago style pizza at its finest. Delicious tomato sauce, super crispy and flavorful crust. Great beer options as well, several local craft brews.

We had two pizzas.  One deep and one extra thin. The deep was delish but the extra thin was the bomb..!  You get what you want for toppings, we all have our own tastes, that's a gimme.  But you look to the crust and its flavor when you've identified a delicious pizza.  It's REAL at Pequod's..!

This place is always packed and there are always people waiting to be seated. It's up to you to decide if that's a good thing or bad thing. I love the pizza here both pan and thin crust. There is a reason they are so busy.

This place is overrated. The crust of pizza was hard but the toppings were legit. I heard a lot of people say top 5. I have to disagree. I had their thin crust too was okay I give that 3.5 and their wings I give a 4 star. Try it for yourself and be the judge. Also not disability friendly took me and my friends to the second floor with a open table on the main floor hostess gets a 1.0
Pequod's is where you go to get your comfort food- deep dish pizza. My fiance loves Pequod's and I've learned to love it as wel. :)

Personally, my favorite pizza in Chicago! Living in the city, we've had our fair share, but nothing compares to this! And SO IMPRESSED that they deliver all the way downtown to us! Thanks, Pequod's! Best pizza in Chicago delivered right to our door!! YUMMMMM... (also, the ONLY pizza I'll cheat on my diet for) :)

I'm normally a thin-crust/NY-style pizza fan, but I'm down for deep dish pizza ANYTIME if it's from Pequod's. It was so good that I overate and had a stomach ache the rest of the afternoon. Keep in mind that you end up waiting ~20-40 minutes or so for your pizza since it's a deep dish and needs to bake longer.    There are a lot of pizza joints to choose from in Chicago, but  if you're trying to pick one, Pequod's should be at the top of that list.

Went on a busy Saturday night last weekend and the wait was ridiculous. We ended up squeezing in at the bar and ordered drinks and our pizzas. The drinks were delicious; definitely some of the best Patron margaritas I've ever had. After about 40 minutes our pizzas came out and they were huge, hot and fresh. We had deep dish sausage and pepperoni. They were very bread-y, but the sauce and cheese was plentiful and flavorful. After two slices I was stuffed and satisfied. It didn't take the top spot on my list for Chicago deep dish, but it's a pretty close second.

I had this place written down as a restaurant to try, based on a food show I watched years ago.  My husband and I were running errands and got hungry.  We decided to stop in for lunch since we were only a few blocks away (thank you trusty list of restaurants to try).   The place has an Interesting vibe and great pricing for lunch.   I can say the rave review from that food show was totally appropriate.  Perfect pizza!  And we have driven there for a pizza since having lunch silently wishing there was a downtown location.

Honestly, the only reason I gave it 1 star, is because there is no 0 star rating.  My friends and I showed up to try what was recommended to us as Chicago's best deep dish pizza. We waited over an hour to be seated, which was expected, and when we sat down to order we were told it would take another hour for the pizza to come out. Shortly after another hour our server came back out (for the first time since she handed us our water and took our order) to tell us that the kitchen had accidentally put a couple of extra toppings on the pizza. At this point, we were fine with that, we just wanted to eat.  So when the pizza came out we realized it wasn't our pizza at all; there were no mushrooms, or jalapeños like we ordered. Just a random pizza with random toppings. The crust was burnt black, and was difficult to cut through. In Nashville we have a good Chicago style deep dish restaurant that I wanted to compare to an authentic pizza place in Chicago, and hands down the Nashville restaurant won the comparison. In fact, you can't even compare the two. That would be like comparing a 5 star steak house to McDonald's. Pequods was an outright disappointment, and I regret the 2 and a half hours of my life/vacation I wasted there.

Honestly don't get the hype. In my opinion any of the other Chicago deep dish pizzas are better. This is essentially an inch of bread with sauce and whatever toppings on it. Caramelized crust was good though. Not dying to go back.

Pequods was recommended to us by numerous people, giving it the title of "Best Pizza in Chicago". We were anxious to try the amazing caramelized cheese crust everyone was raving about. We arrived at Pequods on a Friday at 5 pm, thinking we would beat the dinner crowd. Upon arrival, we were told the wait time would be 20-45 minutes. After a little more than an hour, we were finally seated. We placed our order, and our waitress informed us that the pizza would take about 75 minutes. I wish they would have told us that earlier, but we decided to wait it out since we already made it this far. They weren't lying when they said 75 minutes.  When the pizza finally arrived, we devoured it in less than 10 minutes. Was it amazing? Yes! Would I wait 3 hours again? Probably not. Next time, we're gonna try to avoid the weekend dinner crowd. Waiting 3 hours for a pizza is kind of ridiculous. Plus, they have a great lunch deal.  Now back to the pizza. The bottom of the crust was buttery and golden, with just the right amount of crunch. The caramelized cheese crust was just how I imagined it would be. It had a nice chew to it. The ratio of bread to cheese and toppings was perfect. Not too heavy like most deep dish pizzas. I'm officially giving Pequods my vote for best pizza in Chicago. Four stars for wait time. But I guess good things come to those who wait.
Not great at all. Really unhappy. There are so many better places in Chicago for pizza. A co worker suggested this place, sad I wasted my money and brought family from out of town here.

Best freaking deep dish around. The crust itself is airy and awesome and Carmelized (what they are known for)! Not a bit soggy. Layered with the perfect amount of cheese with your choice in toppings and probably some of the best marinara on top. The breaded mushrooms with the homemade ranch was also amazing and the zucchini slices weren't bad either. But prepare yourself, the wait is long but you can call ahead and do a seat reserve to move your name ahead on the list. You'll still have to wait but they just bought fillipos two doors down and will give you 10% off at pequods. Get the personal pizzas with a group - more crust!

The pizza was great, very filling, and we were prepared for the wait based on tips here. Busy weekend night but we were given a booth & plenty of time - weren't rushed out the door. The only thing I found confusing is that the wait staff didn't have a set uniform - some were wearing black tshirts with the logo, others were wearing street clothes, and someone who seemed like a manager was wearing khakis. It made it seem like customers were rushing around, which I found confusing and distracting. The room got warm as the crowd grew.

Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing - we didn't have enough time for deep dish so we got the thin crust. I've never in my life had a piece of pizza I didn't think was worth finishing - even elementary school pizza. I subscribe to the pizza/sex mentality - even when it's bad, it's still pretty good. Not the case with this pizza - it was not worth finishing and I didn't even try.

I guess I just don't get it. First off, I don't really care for "Chicago Deep Dish." But during a tour of the best rated pizza restaurants in Chicago we were sure to try both deep dish and thin crust at those places that offered both.  The crust at Pequod's reminds me of Jiffy Baking Mix biscuits you might have with some sausage gravy and hash browns. Of the deep dish places we went, this was by far the most disappointing. The people here (customers and employees) were nice, but the pizza is not the best we had in Chicago, let alone on a level with NY, LA, SF, etc.

So let me set the record straight...this is by far one of the best pizza places in this damn beautiful city. I love this place.  I eat here probably 3 to 4 times a month.  this pizza is GREAT! With that being said I am so unbelievably irritated by the 16 year olds running the front door. My goodness I came in at 7 pm called ahead of time I understood it was a two hour wait.  This was no surprise,  a place like this I would expect nothing less.  The problem here is I talked this place up to my family for a few days, they were in town visiting....So anyway I walked in at 7 pm they said the wait is two hours.  So I explained to the kids up front running wait list I get the wait is two hours we would like to put our name on the list well be back at 9pm. They put our name on the list...great.... Two hours later we get there at 9pm on the dot.  I get they don't take reservations. Any who, the same kid that took my name down I tell him hey bud we put our name on the list at 7pm we decided we would go down the street to a bar instead of scratch myself on the sidewalk for two hours.....This kids with a big ole smirk on his face tells me is gonna be another hour wait and we're checked in at 9pm....wait is 50 mins........what?! I explain to the kid (s) didn't you say it was a two hour wait at 7pm and you TOOK THE NAME DOWN AT 7PM! Not one crap given, instead I got this 16 year old giving me a huge smirk right to my face and making jokes to his coworkers like I was the bleeping pinata....then went on to respectively run his mouth....the point being, teach your employees to represent your business with respect. That's the crap the loses business and gets your clientele talking poor about your business.  Fix it. 5stars for pizza, 1 star for service.

Came here for dinner alone (lol) after a TON of people recommended it to me while being in Chicago. Arguably there is a bit of a competition between this + a couple of the other more popular pizza joints, but I decided to go with what I was hearing majority of people recommending. Ambiance is very "local." Nothing exquisite or decorated or curated or charming, but felt very Chicago. Don't really know how to describe that. It was packed - came around 8pm on a weekday, but luckily was seated pretty quickly since I was just 1. Most there were in families/bigger groups.  I ordered the personal size deep dish cheese pizza. It was absolutely DELICIOUS. Caramelized butter crust (that is thick and chewy, but not overly so like some other deep dish pizza joints) and a solid amount of cheese (again... not too much cheese).  Overall, loved my experience here and would definitely recommend. I easily scarfed down the personal size pizza for myself (but I also am a pretty big eater - probably would have been good to split this with 1 other person, or save 1 slice of pizza for the next day. But it was just too good!) Pretty affordable as well. Would highly recommend to someone wanting an authentic Chicago experience that doesn't feel too "done up." Great tasting pizza doesn't hurt either ;)

My first experience with  Chicago deep dish turned out to be enjoyable. I shared a sausage onion pizza with a friend. The sauce was very good, the crust was deliciously crispy and the dough was what I expected - a bit soggy but I guess that's Chicago right? Still doesn't beat New York though!

The pizza is great. We got "priority seating" days before for an 830 reservation to get there, and be told to wait 45-60min. To then wait 90min. To then get seated and see 10 open tables next to us. Seating is run horribly. Pizza is fantastic. They also charge for ranch dressing. It also took us getting the waitresses attention 3 times before they would take the bill.

This is hands down the best Chicago style pizza in Chicago.  The crust melts in your mouth. The burnt cheese is a really nice touch. I love that part.  I have been to both locations, but I thought the food was actually a little better at the Lincoln Park location versus the Morton Grove location.  Service was definitely better in Lincoln Park, too.

The hype is definitely real. So this is how Chicagoan does pan pizza. Buttery flakey crust with nice and zesty tomato sauce. The caramelized crust is also really good. Here, you   build your own pan pizza, base comes with just cheese and sauce so add additional as you wish. Weekdays lunch special is probably the best deal. For $4.95, you get your own personal pan cheese pizza then add whatever toppings. Weekday lunch service is pretty quiet so if you're a tourist then I would recommend coming during this time.

Overrated. Maybe it was because I got a to go order though. Had to wait 30 mins at the store after their quoted pick up time. They then forgot my appetizer combo and had to make it "fresh". But when I got home everything was super soggy and luke warm. Will try again but eat in store this time.

Remember coming to this place way back in the day like in 96 when it was not crowded and not all hyped up like it is today. I used to work across the street at the movie theater and myself, and the crew used to come on over after work; and have drinks and eat. Pan Pizza is still the same unique flavor with the famous burnt caramelized crust. I'm giving it four stars due to there lack of taking proper reservations/system for a table without waiting. I tried coming here the other day and called ahead and forget about it. Place had boat loads of people waiting outside. Even though you call ahead you still have to wait two and a half hours to be seated; and then an hour and a half to get your food! If they have gotten this popular throughout the years; then they need to have a proper reservation system in place and not a stupid podium with arrogant high school kids taking phone calls and names!

Oh Pequod's, you frustrate me so much.... This is definitely my favorite deep dish pizza in chicago.  The sauce/cheese ratio is exactly what i'm looking for and the caramelized crust is incredible.  However, I have had a few experiences with bad service.  If you want to have the best experience here, get take out or sit at the bar. My last pequod's experience was ordering delivery:  I was told the delivery would take an hour and a half, which is standard for pequod's since their pizza takes a while to make.  After 2 hours, i tried to call to check on my delivery, no answer.  After another half hour, I gave up on the expectation of getting my pizza at all.  The next day i emailed them to request a refund to my credit card, which was done a few days later.  But no response to my email, no apology,  or anything at all. I am generally pretty patient: if I received a call the night of the delivery saying "hey, something happened with our driver, we have to cancel your order"  then i would have been disappointed, but understanding.  What bothers me is the lack of communication, and wasting of my time.  If you can't handle deliveries, don't offer delivery.
Caramelized crust is what sets this place apart from the others. It's the bomb!
good pizza, pepperoni, extra sauce. wings are decent. you will always wait 30min for sure... but they allow you to place your order before being seated.

SO OVERRATED. First of all, the fact that everyone raves about this place as the best pizza place in Chicago is pure bs. This was my first trip to Chicago and I've been hearing that this place and Lou Mal something are supposed to be the best. Boy was I SO DISAPPOINTED! I should've known when I arrived at this tiny hole in the wall looking bar scene that the fact that this place has more than 3 thousand reviews is a little suspicious and most likely due to some incentive given for checking in or writing a good review.  Anyways, on to the pizza. So my husband  and I were super excited to try some really good authentic Chicago pan pizza. We ordered the cheese with mushrooms onions and olives. Visually, the pizza looked kind of dull and grayish all over, which I do not know why since all the veggies are supposed to make it look colorful.  TASTE: SO BLAND and BARELY ANY CHEESE !!!!! I felt like I was eating a fat piece of bread with veggies on it. The bread to cheese ratio is so off. I hate pizza that does not have enough cheese that's the fun part ! Eating the gooey cheese with a good amount of sauce and a nice balanced crust. But anyways, this is what killed it for me. Pizza Hut has more flavor than this place sadly to say.  CRUST: The ONLY good part was the outer burnt edges of the pan pizza. The pan dough that the pizza is baked on however, was so bland and nothing special.  COST: What also was annoying is the fact that they charge $2 which so much for each topping and they have no options to choose from, only cheese and you pick whatever toppings you want. They already charge $16 for a medium which is way overpriced anyways. For such a tiny hole in the wall they charge so much. The place definitely does not reflect the quality or taste of the pizza.  Overall Review: DO NOT get fooled by the massive amount of reviews. That's the only reason I picked this place as our first Chicago pizza experience over Lou Malnatis or any other famous ones. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY here ! I honestly am so baffled at how in the heck this place is famous. SO DISAPPOINTED.
Best deep dish in the city!  Can be a long wait, though, even during the week.

BEST PIZZA IVE EVER HAD!!!!!!! Hands down best pizza I have everrrrrrrr had!!!!!!! Pizza: The crust was amazing like non other, every bite had a crunch to it, and best part was even though it was deep dish I did not feel like I was eathing something that was really heavy. Atmosphere: Place is huge, two floors of pizza heaven, I suggest you call ahead if time and make reservations. Service: All of the staff was friendly EXCEPT for the girl taking our order, from the second I sat down she was giving my group an attitude, it was obvious she did not want to be there. After asking for her opinion on a few items and getting such a salty response all I wanted was to have her leave our table and stop ruining the happy vibe we had that night. Its a shame because there are a lot of people who would love to have a job these days....If the owners are reading my review put the server with the attitude in check....server number AZ010 on my receipt
Amazing, amazing, amazing. True Chicago-style deep dish pizza. Crust is filling, but not dense. Sauce is light and and very tasty. Stellar pizza.

Amazing Chicago style pan pizza!! Perfect cheese, perfect sauce, cooked just right. I wanted to keep eating more but I was so full, couldn't even finish the small size. A little far out of the downtown area but worth it to avoid the chains

The deep dish pizza here tastes like lies. I promised my family from out of town that this was the best deep dish pizza in town because it was voted online. It was far from it. Delivery took two hours in town. Pizza tasted like a beer biscuit. It was almost entirely dough, not enough cheese although we ordered extra cheese.

3 stars for the pizza and 1 star for the service. I don't mind waiting 2/3 hours for a table but why not allow your patrons to order before they get sit? Is your kitchen that busy? It might increase your covers by a lot. Saw many, I mean, many tables where people had nothing at their tables because the pizza takes 75 min to prepare. Not going back... Sorry

We called and made reservations tonight for 7:30pm. We arrive and were told it would be an hour. When we reiterated we had reservations the hostess explained that it cut our wait time down from two hours to one. What kind of system is that?! There is a sign that says pizza wait time is 75 min from the time you order. So with a reservation we can expect to eat in two hours and fifteen minutes! This is some serious BS.

Golden Carmelized deep-dish pizza!  Need I say more?  The timely waitress returns to make sure food IS good.  The manager circles the tables to ensure the service is spot on.  The atmosphere is cool and clean, pepperoni is plentiful, slices are thick, and the Coca-Cola classic is bubbly.  No Kitchen Nightmares here.  Nicely done!

Recommended to me by numerous people before my trip to Chicago, and most definitely praised by locals while I was here, I was on a mission to get to Pequod's. Seriously, this girl in an UberPool we were with was talking about the usual big dogs of deep dish since we said we were from out of town, but the moment I brought up Pequod's, she yelped (haha) like there were ants down her pants. It was a group of 5 of us, so we got the large (14") pie with pepperoni and sausage. We each had a couple of drinks so one slice was definitely enough, and two would bring you over the top. I had two :) While I still prefer the classic New York slice, I can definitely get behind the deep dish from here. The crunchiness of the crust is what sealed the deal, balancing out the gooeyness of the cheese, and the tasty (and not too salty) pepperoni and sausage. It truly tasted like they used some top notch ingredients and put a lot of love into their pies.  To sum it up, there's no beating their meat! Might be fine in the back alley, though...

Last week was my first time eating deep dish pizza. There were so many options of pizza in Chicago. After reading so many reviews on whether it was better to eat at the tourist chain restaurants or driving out to Pequod's, we decided to listen to the locals.  We went on a Monday night and even though they didn't seem too busy we still had to wait a while to be sat. Keep in mind your pizza will take an additional hour to make after you have put your order in. I was with a group of 5 and we ordered the mozzarella sticks and the garlic cheese bread. The mozzarella sticks were nothing specials but the garlic cheese bread was so good and got us even more excited about the pizza we ordered.  Our pizza definitely did not disappoint! We were so stuffed. We ordered two large pizzas and we were not able to finish one!  We did not get a chance to visit Giordanos or Lou malnati's, so I can't compare the pizza to theirs but we were definitely happy with our experience at Pequod's. I did take a star off for service, our waiter was very snappy. Took too long checking in on us and bringing us our drinks.

Honestly to preface this, I'm sorry, I'm just not a fan of deep dish pizza, it's not my thing so don't take my review too seriously. Got the deep dish pizza and while it's good, I wouldn't really go out of my way to go get another one any time soon. The lunch special looks like a steal though. I just prefer east coast (NYC) pizza. Sorry guys, I wasn't a convert.

This review is specific to delivery.  Bad experience all-around.  First, pizza arrived 25 minutes later than they noted it would. I was asked if I wanted to pay when I ordered, or pay the driver ---- so I noted I would pay driver.  They failed to mention that was cash-only.  I didn't even think 2x that this might be the case, given options these days with the Square and other technology, So, that took another 10 minutes to resolve. And on top of it all, the pizza wasn't hot!!  Ugh, really wanted to like it, but it was just ok.  I might try eating in sometime - I'm sure that's a different experience.

I have been enjoying and recommending Pequod's Pizza ever since my first taste but my recent customer service experience set my opinion above and beyond what it was before (I apologize in advance, this will be detailed). My parents were visiting for dinner so I ordered a pizza for pick-up. When I arrived to get the order, the restaurant was swamped with at least 20 people waiting outside for their tables and even more waiting for their to go orders inside. A woman also picking up a pizza had an issue with her order but I didn't give it much thought until I brought my pizza home. After digging in, I realized there was a number of things wrong with the order and I sent a Facebook message to let the management know since something seemed to be happening in the kitchen causing orders to come out incorrect. I received a response that night offering to send a gift card, which wasn't at all necessary, but certainly appreciated. I received the gift card two days later and just went to enjoy a Friday night out for dinner. Upon arrival, we were told the wait was significant so they recommended we wait at a new bar two doors down where a receipt for our purchase there would give us a discount at Pequod's. The wait was much shorter than anticipated and we were able to place our order immediately once seated. The beer was exactly what we wanted on this steamy evening, the pizza was perfect and our Friday night was everything I wanted! Although the initial order was wrong when my parents were visiting, the customer service I received exceeded my expectations. The suggestion to wait at the bar next door, who's atmosphere was exactly what we wanted,  was everything we were looking for on a Friday night. I already was a loyal customer, but this experience was so much more than I ever expected that there's no doubt I'll go anywhere else for pizza, beer and Blackhawks games.  Pequod's, thank you, for this experience. Businesses can take a note from you on how to ensure lifelong customers!

Okay, I'm one of the biggest pizza fans I know. I don't discriminate against crusts, I love all types, despite the people that love to hate on the Chicago deep dish.
