I really liked the bread to cheese to topping proportion for the most part, and with just a drop of cholula, I loved my bites. We had 2 leftover pieces from a medium pizza, and when eating it the next day, I could taste the bread way more than anything else and that's when the proportion seemed off. Other than that, I definitely enjoyed my time there.
OMG!  Pequod's pan pizza is so delicious!  Just be prepared to wait a little longer than expected for your food on game days. But, well worth the wait!
The BEST deep dish pizza in all of Chicago!!!  Don't even waste your time going to the other places.  The pizza was the perfect combination of fluffy crunchy cheesy and yummy!!
Best chicago deep dish...period. Yelp wanted me to write more but I said enough
Best deep dish in Chicago! Caramelized crust FTW! Try giardiniera on it!

You clearly need to make a big decision regarding deep dish pizza, so I'll make this brief and hopefully useful: Pequods makes a solid deep dish. They're "famous" for their carmelized crust, which is really just burnt cheese around the edges. You will wait a very long time to eat it (45 mins from the time you order, that's not counting waiting for your table). You will be tempted to order a salad, because waiting 45 mins to put food in your mouth seems unbearable. The salad will be the saddest excuse for a salad you've seen, a complete waste of stomach space, but you'll be somewhat happy to not be starving anymore. Your pizza will finally arrive almost an hour later, and you will inevitably think it's the best pizza known to man, mainly because your stomach is half-full of sad romaine. But this! This is hot & cheesy and bready. Your rational brain may kick in and remind you: this is merely cheese & sauce on a thick piece of dough -- don't get so excited. Ok, ok, the edges are crispy, and that part is incredible, you wish you could eat a whole pizza made of the edges. You will then wonder: did I just order this monstrous pizza just to eat its edges? Perhaps. Perhaps you did. But that's what people do in Chicago, so there must be something to it.  If that didn't help you make your decision, I'll just add: this pizza may not change your life, but it will fill your belly, and sometimes that's good enough. You'll also experience an authentic, bustling, pizza parlor vibe that doesn't feel touristy (except for all the people who are clearly tourists). The beer selection is pretty basic. The servers are all in a hurry, but remain nice enough. And those salads - please don't.  There are lots of places in Chicago and beyond that make a tasty deep dish. Little Star Pizza in CA is still my favorite of them all, and they aren't in Chicago. The end.

In my humble opinion, best pizza in town. Not going to get into the debate on deep dish vs. pan vs. whatever-the-fuck but have a couple slices of this and tell me that crust isn't the standard bearer for deliciousness. Fun, noisy atmosphere. Great for a bite before the movie or with a group for a birthday. Grab a cocktail at Drinking Bird while you wait!

I came to Chicago for one thing. DEEP DISH PIZZA.  Lunch special. $4.99 Monday-Friday. 11am-3pm. The special includes cheese pizza with a soda.  If this was available back in Los Angeles, you would find me here everyday. I added sausage, pepperoni and mushroom. It does take awhile for it to be cooked roughly 30-45 minutes. Totally worth it. The pizza is a bit bready but I totaled love it. Especially the burnt crisp. Ugh i'm salviating as I write this and wish I could eat it right now. Definitely a personal size is perfect for a person and I eat quite a LOT. I was totally stuffed after eating this. This spot is the spot. I tried the other competitors and this one ended up being my favorite. I came here twice before leaving Chicago.  Now i'm sad that I can't eat this pizza anymore.
Definitely better pizza and service (here at the bar) than the Morton Grove location, though that really is faint praise. ~Peter O.
The quality was top notch but the crust was just too much like bread and chewy. We ate what we could but tossed the rest. *This was an issue of personal taste not quality.
Good was decent it was a 30 min wait but it was decent waitress was really nice.... Pizza  was decent appetizers was OK
Awesome pizza i'm not a big deep dish Pearson but i love this pizza .The caramelized crust is the best .tell your friends it's the real deal.

So great going here every time I'm in this city. I always manage to take home 3 personal pies for the flight home. BEST deep dish around, don't be fooled by all the advertisement and billboards throughout the city.
What is all the rave about?? The deep dish is sub-par. It's very doughy and the place is packed with usually rude costumes. Sorry to all my Pequod loving friends out there.

So many places to go for good pizza in Chicago, i don't get why people suggest this one?? Usually packed and the pizza is mediocre at best. Pop next door to drinking bird for a better atmosphere and good eats (a little pricey though).
Unique pizza. Not always predictable, particularly if doing delivery, but usually pretty delicious no matter.

Yeah, this is pretty great pizza. Unique to their deep dish is the bit of burnt/carmelized cheese around the edges. It sounds crazy to describe something burnt as good, but it is. The sauce is so rich in flavor, the sausage is homemade to perfection, and the crust is crispy at the bottom while the insides are cooked just right. Because it takes a long time to cook (30-40 min.) give them your pizza order as soon as you can. Their onion rings are out of this world but the Pequod house salad is unremarkable. They are always packed so come early. They don't take reservations but you can get priority seating if you call ahead. I want to withhold a star because it is nuts to go there on the weekend and with tons of people it gets really loud but the pizza is just so good.

After hearing awesome things about Pequods we had to come try it. Overall I was a bit disappointed. The toppings were great, but I'm just not a fan of how they do their crust. I know that's what makes them unique, I just didn't enjoy it as much as a traditional deep dish crust.

Ordered for pick-up.  We were so unhappy with this pizza that we threw it away and ordered from Malnati's.  First, it really isn't a pizza.  The crust is so bready, it would more appropriately be called pizza bread.  Secondly, the crust is not caramelized, it is burnt. Finally, the pizza was out of balance:  too much sauce, not enough meat (canadian bacon).  The flavor of the toppings individually was actually pretty good, but the "pizza" did not come together as a coherent whole.  Not sure why people like this place.  Maybe it's the dining in experience?

I know this place has rave reviews, but honestly, I just don't see it.  Pros-  Delicious and generous toppings (I got the deep dish sausage and peppers) Fast delivery Cons- While the sauce and toppings were amazing, the pizza was a thin layer of cheese followed by 90% bread. And it wasn't the soft "gooey" kind you'd find on a typical pizza. It was super dry and flaky. Very disappointing.  I'm glad I was able to say I tried it. But just not worth the hype in my book.

Instant improvement. Called the next day (after Pequods had offered to pick up a pie on the house - although I didn't take them up on the offer). It's like they had done training in the intervening day (or maybe I just had bad luck the day before). First thing they told me was the wait - very helpful and friendly on the phone. Pizza arrived and tasted great - one star subtracted from the solid 4 star delivery because the pizza had been held unevenly and toppings (and pizza) had formed on one side of the box. Didn't effect the delicious taste. Thanks for the great pizza and good luck on turning around the phone etiquette. Still the best deep dish in Chicago.

I haven't been to this place in years, but my return did not disappoint me. I had a personal pan pizza with sausage, along with a beer (which I had to take back because it was too bitter). But I replaced it with a root beer and it was a perfect combination. The pizza is just like I remembered: thick with that irresistible caramelized cheese crust. I couldn't finish it, so I had to take some home, and the second time after microwaving was just as good.  I ate at the bar, and frankly, I won't do that again, because of its narrow walkway and I don't like being brushed up against by passersby. The service is very good and I look forward to going again but next time I'll be in a booth.

Thin crust is like pan pizza. Not worth the wait. Server ordered wrong pizza and then charged us for the pizza when she asked us if we wanted it. After waiting another 30 minutes and never seeing our server again we finished up some pan pizza that wasn't anything special. Didn't feel valued as a customer.

The staff was great & so was the atmosphere. I had the individual pizza & it wasn't very good. It was really doughy & dry/over cooked with skimpy toppings.  I can definitely see the charm of the place even w/the less than average pizza.

this is definitely a chicago staple.  I live not too far from here so I go a bit. It takes about an hour n some change for a pie when its busy (evenings and sunday nights) so plan ahead. Honestly get the much reccomended pan pie, their thin crust is lacking

I like deep dish pizza. I've always been a fan of the style growing up in Los Angeles we had good Mexican but not good pizza. I tried Lou's but I liked Pequads better the inside of the restaurant is darker and the pizza crust and bottom are burnt in those big black pans they use.  Great sauce it's near the Lincoln park area which is a pretty cool area of Chicago go there and be prepared to be full!

Having heard so many praises for Pequod's, I was super excited when I found out we were going to get a delivery of their pizzas for a party on a Friday night. We ordered the pizza on the Wednesday to be delivered on Friday at 7:30pm, the order was confirmed and my friend's credit card was charged. My friend called the next day to amend the order, still confirming the order to be delivered for Friday at 7:30pm. My friend called again on Friday afternoon to confirm the order to be delivered for the previously agreed time, and it was once again confirmed. Friday comes around and we made a little appetizer to be enjoyed while waiting for the pizzas. 7:30pm comes around and no pizza. 7:45pm, no pizza. 8:00pm, still no pizza. We call Pequod's to see how much longer until we were to expect our pizzas. The person on the phone said the ordered was placed, but the kitchen staff didn't want to make the order, so they tossed it out. He said they were going to make it now though. He apologised and gave us a $30 credit to be used on our next order.  The pizzas finally came at 9:30pm, 2 hours after the thrice confirmed time and didn't look very good and was super doughy, so I didn't quite like it. I guess the kitchen staff really didn't want to make this order. I'm extremely disappointed with this encounter with Pequod's. What is management doing to the kitchen staff to make them choose to ignore an order simply because they did not want go make it? Or was it just an excuse for them forgetting to put in our order all together?  Please fix how you operate your business!

One of the best deep dish places in Chicago. Went here on a Chicago Pizza Tour, hadn't even heard of it much before the tour, or I guess I hadn't noticed hearing about it. After knowing about it I seemed to hear it all the time. Great quality deep dish with a kinda burnt crispy crust that's awesome...now I order it all the time for delivery.

BEST pizza in Chicago hands down. It's the perfect combination between thin and the traditional deep dish Chicago pizza, it's a not too thick pan style pizza with crunchy cheese melted on the crust. It's pure perfection. Add meatballs to your pizza, you won't be disappointed!

I've ordered delivery from Peaquods a couple of times in the past and had I never been to the actual restaurant, this might be a 5 star review. I feel like the longer I live in Chicago, the more I hate deep dish, but of all the deep dish places, this is one of my more preferred...It's saucy, there's a hell of a lot of toppings (so you don't feel ripped off paying $30+ for a damn pizza), and though heavy - you don't feel as terrible as you do after eating Giordanos, per say. My visit to the actual Peaquods though (and I've been twice), was kind of disappointing. The actual pizza parlor is a little reminiscent of a dive bar (similar to the feel of Pizano's on State/Gold Coast). My complaint though has to do with the waitstaff. It really seemed like they were doing the minimum. "Can i take your order?" "here's your food" "Here's your bill." It just took away from the deep dish pizza experience. That all being said, I still recommend Peaquod's to all my out of town friends (vs. some of the other well known deep dish chains in Chicago).

Great deep dish pizza. I've been to a number of really good Chicago pizza places. Pequods is hands down the best. I liked the laid back atmosphere, beer selection and staff. Get there early or late, it's gets crowded.
Come on !!!!! The special lunch is just for dine in !!! I don't like that.............
My favorite deep dish in Chicago.  Second favorite thin crust pizza.  Definitely a place I need to bring people visiting Chicago.

I've loved Pequod's ever since I was little and my mom would bring home a pizza after work from their suburban location.  Now that I live close to Lincoln Park I try to go here every once in a while.  I won't get into an argument about the best deep dish in Chicago but just know that no discussion is complete without someone mentioning Pequod's. The place gets crowded so last time I was strategic and arrived just as the Hawks game was finishing.  This was perfect as everyone was leaving and tables were opening up left and right.  We opted to sit at the bar.  We were told the pizza would take like 40 minutes so we ordered mozzarella sticks.  The pizza came out about 20 minutes later so I was pretty bummed we ordered an app, which I wouldn't have done had I known the pizza would be out soon.  I guess that's a good upselling technique on their part but I didn't have enough room for delicious pizza.  Tell your rumbling tummy to shut up (or hold it over with beer) and wait for the pizza.  They also have a really good salad, if you're into that kind of thing.

Service was good and got seated promptly but I came in at about 3 pm on a Monday  Ordered the personal pan. Sausage extra cheese and mushrooms.  $9.85 Pizza was average and was missing something but wasn't quite sure what, maybe a little more salt in the sauce or more cheese instead of bread.  All in all I will come back to try the thin crust but I don't have much hope for it.  If I could sum it up in one word it would be: overrated
Not a huge deep dish fan, but if you like deep dish, this is the creme de la creme

"Ooh, baby, do you know what that's worth? Ooh, heaven is a place on earth They say in heaven, love comes first We'll make heaven a place on earth Ooh, heaven is a place on earth" Little did Belinda Carlisle know, her 1987 smash hit 'Heaven Is A Place On Earth' would describe a small Chicago pizzeria with the most generous helpings, tastiest crust, and friendliest staff on earth.

I was in Chicago. I needed to get pizza - the real stuff. And I had just come off one of those:  "last night - late night ....had to order what I could, what was open.. last ditch effort unspeakable thin crusts that actually arrived to brick cold and bleh."   Thats a review to come later - Save the better for first. I did take out and called ahead from the train - I had to do a quick stop and grab on our way to the airport or I couldn't squeeze it in. I walked like miles off the train for this pizza and I don't go far out of my way (which at the time it seems like I was walking forever) but it was WORTH IT, amazing and the people were rocking. 1) I don't need to even comment first on the pizza - because let it speak for itself. I liked the atmosphere. Cute, on the corner - walked in - we were greeted right away with smiles and "What can we help you with!" Awesome! They were so gracious and kind - basically knew it was me! We were thirsty and they got us cups to go, accommodated us for our road walking journey with a speedy check out. I was so grateful. I wanted to stay! 2) Pizza smelled so good in that box. Good price too although I just got myself a small thick crust cheese (basic) but it was piping hot and I couldn't wait to get my hands on it. Rich and saucy. I was in heaven. I couldn't eat it all and that says miles for an appetite like mine. I was fortunate enough to pass it off to someone in passing that probably needed it more than me and they got to share in Pequod's Yumminess too. Thanks for your "drive by" hospitality, delicious pizza, affordable pricing, cool venue and lifesaver when I needed my Chicago Style Pizza. I will be back!

Hate to be hard on a small business, but this is NOT Chicago-style deep dish pizza. The "deep dish" option was just a thicker crust. I mean this pizza was so bad I took the time to take a picture and warn my Chicago friends. Would I be mad if I bought this for $10? No. But I paid a lot more than $10. Save yourself the time and money and get a gas station za instead.

THE BEST OF THE BEST! Do not waste your time going to Lou Malnati's or Giordano's. Pequod's is where it's at!  I'm from South Jersey and am all about crispy, thin crust pizza. However, I actually debated my deep devoutness and commitment to thin crust pizza after taking just one bite of my personal deep dish mushroom pizza from Pequod's. I would be satisfied eating the crust alone, that's how delicious it really is. The crust is made from basically cheese that crisps and caramelizes while cooking. The inside of the pizza is not as dense as I would have expected from a deep dish pizza. It was creamy, light, and I didn't feel gross after chowing. I could write so much more about how unreal their pizza is, but I would prefer that my mouth stop watering.

Pequods is my favorite pizza place in Chicago so much so that I always bring out of town guest here first because you can easily get Lou Malnati's or Giordanos but noting compares to the caramelized crust and indulgence that is Pequods. For people that are uninitiated to Chicago pizza, I always say that you must try a couple of places and compare it to other Pan/Deep Dish places. You will be unsatisfied if you compare Pequods to other pizza you've had because of the difference in the category. Also, be careful reading any reads on Yelp -- always see where they're from! Most people giving low reviews to Pequods are out of towners and have not had Pequods or any deep dish pizza place more than once. If you compare it on it's merit to other Pizza, you'll be disappointed because there is no proper comparison (apples to oranges, both are fruit, but quite different.)   The one thing that Pequods has over it's closely competitor is the amazing crust. It's caramelized and burnt looking but it's toppings are no joke. Equipped with a fork and knife, it's a difficult proposition to eat more than a couple of slices. Generally, a large can feed a group of five or more! My only advice is to actually request more sauce. On lazy days, the pizza may come out too dry and a dry pizza is no good. More sauce gives it more of a hearty tomato taste that really balances out the superior Pequods crust.  Otherwise, pick your favorite toppings (Note: pepperoncini is not pepperonis, don't learn the hard way).  Overall, the place is good for groups EXCEPT on any game day which will inflate your wait for both the pizza and a table. I wouldn't necessarily suggest bringing a family here either especially with younger kids or older adults because it has a very bar-y feel to the restaurant. Otherwise, it's a great place for friends (esp. those visiting from out of town to convert to Chicago pizza believers).

Pequods pizza was a bit disappointing, I'm already not a fan of deep dish pizza (New York Pizza all day e'ry day) but when in Rome... Pequods supposedly has an amazing crust, I must disagree, my crust had a doughy consistency (like not completely cooked, but come on, you made me wait 40 minutes for it...) the toppings were stingy and I paid for a premium topping (meatball) and barely got any.  The pizza seemed under seasoned and just was pretty meh.  The meatball I must say was tasty, it wasn't tough and and a decent flavor on its own but not enough to carry the pizza Service wasn't terrible but wasn't amazing either...

I am not a huge fan of deep dish BUT I am a huge fan of Pequod's deep dish!!! That has to mean something right?! Don't get sucked into the hype with Lou Malnati's because Pequod's is significantly tastier, and it's so much more well made! I never thought I'd see the day when I would be craving deep dish. :) Thank you so much Pequod's!!

Figuring where to park almost led us not to go here.  We found a spot,  and once inside the staff was very friendly,  so that was a nice start. We were seated quickly,  but came in between lunch and dinner,  so not a huge crowd.  It definitely picked up as we were leaving.  We loved the pizza,  the crust was delicious and has such a great crunchy bite.  My niece got a thin single slice and I thought it was a little soft for a thin crust,  but she enjoyed it.  I would definitely come here again,  service was quick and friendly. Barnes and Noble had validated parking for 3 hours if you shop there,  but the machine that does the validation is towards the front of the store,  so you can probably be sneaky lol.

Went here because friends raved about the pan pizza...maybe it was my expectations but I was underwhelmed. It's not that anything was wrong per say but I've definitely had more flavorful pizza at other places in Chicago. Friendly staff though! And it's a nice casual atmosphere.

Got take out, so I can't speak for inside of the restaurant. I had a friend visiting and he was on a mission to try different kinds of deep dish pizza. This place did not disappoint. The crust was sort of odd, more like bread, so if that's not your thing I wouldn't recommend their deep dish. We kept it pretty simple with giardiniera and sausage in one, with pepperoni and basil in the other. Very tasty!

Was honestly not much of a deep dish fan until I had Pequod's. Thin crust is also a solid option. It can get crowded quickly in there but the pizza is certainly worth it. I'd recommend the Italian beef on a deep dish pizza
My favorite in the city! Be prepared to wait a little while, particularly on busy nights, but it's worth it!

Pequod's is THE BEST pizza in Chicago. Seriously close off your ears and yell very loudly at anyone who tells you differently, especially if it's your friend from Indiana who wants to go to Uno's or Lou's..... Get new friends. Pizza is like french fries, it's hard to have "a bad pizza" but Pequod's takes it to the next level. The toppings are premium (try their homemade Italian sausage), the sauce delish and oh my: the crust. It's doughy AND crispy. Mind blown. Sure, there are other excellent pizza places in Chicago, and you should try them all. And that folks is why Chicago is awesome.
Amazing deep dish pizza at a great price. I got a person pan with 1/2 sausage, absolutely wonderful!!

I love deep dish and before going here it was hard to find a place that can compete with Lou Malnati's. This place definitely does. The pizza styles are still different both the pan pizza at Pequod's was delicious. I am excited to go back and have another.  Plus, the prices were very reasonable.  Go early as you can pretty much guarantee there will be a wait!
First time at Pequod's last night, and I was very impressed. I don't usually toy with deep dish, but the crust was delicious, and the service was good. I will eat again.
is this real life? i think i blacked out during this meal or went into a trance of cheese and caramelized crust.  as my boy zubair khan would say, this is simply JAF.  the GOAT of pizza in Chicago
Best deep dish in the city!  Keep in mind we live on the west side,  within 15 min of 3 Lou's and a Giordano's, and we'd still prefer to trek up here for delicious pizza!

This was one of my favorite places unfortunately my last visit the pizza was not as good and they sat us upstairs and there was like no heat on so we all had to eat with our coats on. Probably will be a while before I come back we usually drive about an hour to come.
My belly was already full from all the pizza's I'd tasted on the pizza food tour, but I could still tell that it was good. Will be back another day to taste more.

Since when doesn't this place take reservations but preferred line status only?  Would of been Better to find out before actually going there, but thankful Bartoli's is not too far away, has a small seating area that was open, and quick 30 minute deep dish order was done promptl before our movie time. Pequods has been more of a disappointment than a blessing the last few visits, so a thumbs up to trying Bartoli's location vs just quality delivery. Chicago Mag was not wrong with the past years pizza ranking, there is a ton of new players in town that appreciate your business and mine.  Last thing, Pequods bacon is Canadian, so not TRUE bacon, buyer beware.

The pizza. What can I say?  It's honestly freaking delicious.  Now, I am not one to stand on a soapbox and diatribe daily about the superiority of pizza to other foods. Because usually- I wouldn't eat pizza if you paid me.  But here... This pizza is seriously delicious. We came on a Friday evening, it was jammed pack. More sardines than in a old Soviet tin but we held on to our patience and stalked the guests at the bar for their seat like hawks.  It's the only way to eat in a halfway reasonable amount of time- say an hour.  But a good 2 hours later, when the pizza finally came.  It melted away my angry.  You say, oh it must be the joy of alleviating hungry after such a long wait.  But no sir- I kindly filled my gluttony with wings and salad.  But let's get back to the main point- the pizza was the bombdiggity.  The crust was thick but not soggy.  Cheese, this could be improved as I could barely taste it. But the toppings.  Oh the toppings! Seriously made you want to slap your female paternal unit- yes it was that good.  Dense, packed and meatballs the size of fists- it definitely didn't leave you wanting. Trust me. Coming from someone who literally lives to eat and studies taste like the Quran, if you ever feel the need for pizza.  You will not regret eating here, as long you can survive the painful waiting.

Took them a while to have us seated, took them a while to get us a booth since we didn't want center seating, took them a while to serve us beer and starter (garlic bread with marinara sauce was amazingly different and tasty!) and took them a while to get us our pizza... Total wait time was about 40 minutes (blame it on Friday, eh?)  Loved the deep dish veggie pizza (cheese with onion, tomato, spinach, black olives and jalapeño) we ordered.  Small size is more than enough for two when you are super hungry! Moderate pricing for amount of food.

Not impress at all... Came in on a Wednesday night before the rush and the pizza was just basically bready. Major lack of sauce and cheese!! Our pizza wasn't even cut symmetrically, let alone it was even barely cut we have to use the pizza scooper to get a finer cut before putting it on to the plate. Been yearning to try this place out but left pretty disappointed. We got a sausage and pepperoni pizza and those two ingredients were point on. But the sauce and cheese was a different story. All of the tomato sauce fell onto the crust of the pizza and I like pizza crust and all but our pizza crust was burnt! So I wasn't even able to enjoy it as much. The thickness of the bread was major carb overload. Not enough cheese and sauce to balance it out at all. If anything, I say get thin crust so you won't be as disappointed as I am. But I never had thin crust so I'm not sure if it's any better.
I cannot rave about this place enough! Amazing food and staff. Leftovers are even amazing! Try a side of ranch to dip your pizza in. The word is out so be prepared for a wait!

Best deep dish in town. Careful on the weekend or during a Hawks game because it gets really crowded. You can duck into the Drinking Bird next door while you wait though, so at least you've got options.

Their pizza may be fantastic, but I'll never know. After taking the kids on their first trip to Chicago, we decided to treat them to a real deep dish pie. Pequod's treated us to a twenty five minute fifteen minute wait. We walked in before the dinner rush with most tables empty, by the time we determined they didn't want our money, they had seated several two tops, three three tops, and the final straw, a four top which pushed two tables together that we could have occupied with our five people. Shame that they are so focused on being an institution instead of a restaurant.
This is Chicago deep dish. The best pizza in Chicago, with a great atmosphere and a fun, attentive staff. This is the place you want to go for your taste of Chicago deep dish.

The year is 1994...or was it 93? Anywho, been digging this spot since the neighborhood boys washed dishes and me and the girls waited out back till they finished there shift,  toting a freshly made pie! My neighbor was one of those guys, so I got the dibs! Fast forward and I can't get a seat without a reservation. Who would have thunk it. Thanks for the memories and great Pizza! The good old days....
Eh. Not so much. Too bready. Lou Malnati's is way better.

The girlfriend absolutely loves this place.  I just don't get it.  You are supposed to avoid burning things, but their "carmelized" pizza crust is bitter because in reality it is just plain burnt.   Not only that but there is usually a wait during peak times and once you order the pizza it takes about 1.5 hours to get to your table.
Best deep dish pizza in the city! Tip: Call ahead with your order on weekdays if you eat in or make a reservation!
Sauce is just a tad too sweet for me personally, but this is still really good pie. It does get busy so if you plan to dine in, get here early!

I'm so torn about Pequod's. I know a lot of people love it, even close friends of mine, but I find it really basic. I've tried it on a few occasions--twice for takeout, and recently I stopped in to eat at the restaurant. It's definitely bready and more of a pan pizza than a deep dish, at least to me. I find that with takeout just getting it with plain cheese wasn't enjoyable. It just congeals and also loses its crispy texture underneath. I think the toppings are what offset the breadiness of the crust. That being said, the caramelized crust is really delicious, even as leftovers.  My husband and I stopped in a few weeks ago on a Saturday night around 4pm. It was already pretty busy but it was only a 20 minute wait for a table, and they told us pizzas were taking 50 minutes. We got a table upstairs that was in the corner, which was nice. Our waitress was nice but I have to say the service was extremely disappointing. It took forever just to get a drink and our appetizer came out and was the wrong thing. A few tables around us also received wrong orders. We shared the house salad with ranch, and the dressing was really tasty. The wings, once we got the correct ones, were pretty crispy and had a nice BBQ sauce. Our pizza ended up taking almost an hour and a half to get to us and by this point we were starving even after apps. It was very cheesy and had good flavor. I like their sauce, it's not too sweet or too tangy. We did half with sausage and onion and half with cheese. I definitely prefer the side with toppings-- it offsets how thick the crust is. Eventually our area started to get really crowded and there was a big group of drunk people that snuck past the host and were trying to order pizza without waiting. The waitstaff just kind of let it happen, which was frustrating because it caused us to have to wait a really long time to get our check and leave. Overall I think the pizza is good, and I don't mind eating it, but I don't find it special. I also think that other Chicago "deep dish" varieties like Lou's are much better and have a much more enjoyable ambiance at their locations. Dining in at Pequod's was crowded, slow, hot, and just not worth it.

This was my first time having pequods and also my last. Was quoted at an hour and a half for delivery. 2 and a half hours later I had to call and they had no idea where the pizza was but it arrived shortly after. The actual pizza is my least favorite deep dish in the city. Way too much bread with hardly any cheese or sauce. The burnt crust is delicious and unique but not enough to save the rest. Glad I got to pay full price for a lukewarm pizza after 2 and a half hours.

Thin crust pizza had fresh ingredients! The jalapeños and olives were so good. I like the flaky thin crust. Tastes almost like a thin croissant. The small was perfect for two people.  Pizza took a while but I guess you gotta wait for quality food. Iced tea tasted watered down but I didn't give them a chance to fix it so can't dock them too much for that. Manager was attentive and was there to get things done!

Was surprised by my boyfriend with a night at Pequod's. Had the deep dish which was amazing. The carmelized cheese from the seasoned pans was so delicious. The staff was courteous and extremely professional. Everyone was smiling - employees and customers! Can't wait to go back.

Terrible Customer Service. Ordered at 630 with an order promise of 8. They called at 815 asking if the food was here and we said no and that it would be there in 15 min and the driver is on his way. Called restaurant at 845 and they said sorry driver is still here and still waiting on your apps to be cooked. We're told we would be comp'd the apps and we were not. Pizza arrives at 9... 2 1/2 hours later! When I called back the restaurant the driver was supposed to give cash back so if I didn't call they would've not credited.

While visiting my aunt she suggested we try one of her favorite pizza spots. We started with mozzarella sticks that were best out of a box and baked and the cheese was so stiff I almost gagged. I opted to get a personal pan deep dish cheese only and the family got a medium pepperoni and sausage deep dish. Be prepared to wait 45 minutes or longer for your pizza to arrive. The pizzas are cooked and served in a cast iron pan. For me the pizza lacked flavor even with cheese only. The crust was thick and bland. The rest of my party seemed to enjoy their pizza but I was not impressed.

I went on a night that was not crowded.  We had the deep dish and it was good.  I had visited to their other location for lunch, in my opinion, this pizza here in Chicago tasted better than their other location.  Service was good, I enjoyed my time here with my friend.

The best deep dish in the city. Don't agree with me, well your wrong and you're probably a damn New Yorker.  The crust is fluffy and the the cheese ring completes the experience. The awesome sauce is just the icing on This triumph of gastronomy.
I've never been to this location but the original up north is one of the best pizzas I've ever had   (on a side street off of dempster)

My husband  LOVES  their personal pan pizza's -  I just was not a huge fan. I am sorry.  but you know with things  like Burgers  and  Pizza - everyone's  taste  is different.  So many people  LOVE  this place -  I must be the odd man OUT!

Definitely worth the (probably insane) wait to get a table. The pizza is delicious and so much better than other places. I love the carmelized cheese crust. Plus, it's across the street from the Webster Place theater, so it's great to go out for pizza and a movie.
Great place - authentic Chicago deep dish! Really nice place to chill out on the weekends.

I don't get the love for this place. Our pizzas lacked flavor, were terribly under-seasoned, and required a large portion of the dried Parmesan found on the table next to ours. The sauce is basically tomato sauce, which also isn't seasoned. The dough with the cheese on the side just tastes like burnt nothing. I don't understand how this is the "best" deep dish in Chicago?! They could honestly learn something from Little freakin' Caesar's about how to do burnt cheese crust. That's how average I find their pizza.

During my short weekend trip to Chicago, I had the pleasure of trying 3 of (from my research) the top deep dish pizza joints in the city. Pequod's is ranked #2 for me. I highly recommend going to their website and making a reservation right away. They will text you a day before to confirm your ressie and you're set. When we walked in on a Saturday night at 7pm it was PACKKKED. The party of 2 ahead of us was given a 2.5 hour wait time. We were a party of 7 and we were seated right away. MAKE A RESERVATION. Loud, large dive bar feel.  + bruschetta - Skip it. It's bland and not good at all here. + ravioli pesto and marinara - Both were tasty, but nothing to brag about. If you're craving ravioli and want to order one, I'd say go with the pesto. + PIZZAAAAAA CRUST - their "caramelized crust" is their specialty and what separates them from the rest. It's basically burnt layers of cheese -- ok that doesn't sound too appetizing but trust me, it's so crunchy and SO good.  TOPPINGS - You can choose your own toppings (from basic and premium lists). They say  not to pile too much on. -- Sausage and pepperoni - per our waiter's recommendation. Basic, but SO SOLID. I think would've been better with mushrooms and bell peppers. -- Bell peppers, mushrooms, and Italian beef - also per our waiter's recommendation. It was good, but the beef didn't really go well with the pizza overall. I wish we would've gotten more veggies and tried the meatballs instead. I think if we weren't starving and did more research on which toppings to choose, we would've enjoyed our pizza way more. Nonetheless, Pequod's is still a MUST on your hit-list for Chicago eateries and we're glad we got to enjoy it with little hassle/wait.

Let me tell you I was so excited to finally try the pizza my family raves about all the time. Unfortunately, right when I entered I waited 5-10 minutes at the door when the bartender and the host were talking. I was seated after with no menu and had to get up to ask for one. Server took 20 minutes to approach my table and another 20 min for a glass of water. Our appetizers arrived and our sample platter was undercooked. The batter was soggy from the inside and the mushrooms were dried out. The two tables after us had gotten their pizza and my table was still waiting. The pizza arrives after an hour of waiting on a slow Monday night and it was wrong. I'm a vegetarian and was given a sausage mushroom pizza when I asked for half sausage and half spinach. The waitress came back and rudely said we had to wait another 45 min for another pizza and didn't offer an apology. I was I furious by this point I paid and left. I paid for horrible service and food. I called the restaurant and a lady under the name Mariah picks up, without any greeting and says "hey" I explained to her what happened and reads 6 different orders but my order. She says "I can't do nothing for you you can call Thursday Shawn will be here and will fix your problem". My server was a medium height African American woman:  Save your time and money try Lou Malnati's

Was great 5 years ago, when they cared about their product. Now they rush out orders of all dough and sauce, no meat toppings or cheese. To top it off got our whole party sick the next day, easter sunday to top it off.

Meh.  Very overrated pizza.  Hype Hype Hype If you want to wait for an hour for a decent Chicago style pan/deep dish pizza then go to Pequod's. If you want a GREAT pan/deep dish pizza go to Lou Malnati's, Gioradano's, Gino's East....all three put Pequod's to shame...this is coming from someone who has been eating Chicago pizza my entire life.

This is the pizzeria you go to in Chicago if you don't want to feel like a tourist. Lou Malnati's and Giordano's may be more famous, but I couldn't care less. Pequod's serves the best pizza in Chicago! Their secret is layering the edge of the pan with cheese so that it's baked into the crust, giving it an amazingly delicious flavor that's highly addicting. The pizzas are made to order and you can pick and choose whatever toppings you want. Because of this, it could take 20-40 minutes to get your pizza, but that's totally fine because you can kill time with pitchers of beer or whatever sporting event is on at the time.

Best deep dish in the city. If you're not from Chicago you need to come here for deep dish! If you are from Chicago you need to come here for deep dish!! I absolutely love how crunchy the caramelized crust is. They're not stingy on the toppings either! Expect a wait, but have no fear it's all worth it!

Best pizza place in the city, they don't do standard chicago deep dish. I think that's a good thing because nothing kills the night faster than a stomach full of cheese and sausage. The caramelized crust is something unique, the toppings are plentiful and service prompt.
My favorite deep-dish Pizza. The sausage is the way to go. Plus it's nice that they will deliver both to my work and home... neither of which are exactly close to the restaurant.

This is the best deep dish in Chicago.  It is best to order take out as there is very little seating.  The service is good but when dining in it can be slow.  Overall if you are wanting deep dish pizza in Chicago, this is the place to go.

This place has been hit or miss for me. The quality can really vary every time. The first time i went I wasn't a fan. The last time, it was absolutely delicious. So if you go once and don't like it, give it another try! Also better to go on off-peak hours when they're less busy.
Went there for a final stop of a pub crawl. Service was fun and entertaining. Appetizers were good, especially the wings. Great deep dish. The cheesy  crust is one of the best. What a great spot.

My favorite deep dish in Chicago. The atmosphere is cozy and perfect for a pizza place. and they let you order your deep dish when you put your name in so the wait time once you sit down is minimal. Sometimes I dream about the caramelized crust...
Great thin crust pizza. Fresh toppings love the sausage.  I personally dont recommend the  deep dish tho..

This Pizzeria is on my top 3 places to get a slice of pizzzza! I still haven't many places that I need to check out but this place is the one place I like to take girls out to dinner who are pizza lovers. I do recommend it to some folks also, because, well its delicious lol Anyways, the best part for me is that the crust looks burn but its actually especially delicious

Very DISAPPOINTED! Had to toss it in the trash. It was NOT deep dish more like bread with marinara, cheese and meatball slices. How whack is that?!? It was a thin layer of cheese on top of thick bread. I don't understand why it takes 45 minutes to make bread dip dish.  I'm only giving the two stars for the friendliness of Makayla (Filipino girl) she was very friendly. People like that who are friendly make the establishment wonderful.  Parking is so hard to find but there is street. Like I said before good luck.

Deep dish pizza at its finest. Truly, it doesn't get any better than this. Beautiful, carmelized crust that is to die for. It's heavy and you'll be full afterwards, but your tummy will be happy. I'm fairly picky when it comes to deep dish, this place hits the mark.

I'm not in love with deep dish pizza, but this is my favorite of the thicker style in Chicago, probably because it's actually pan pizza. This means that the crust gets nice and caramelized, which adds textural contrast and helps it not to be all mushy. Pequods also makes phenomenal meatballs - worth a detour just for them.

I'm from the east coast, so clearly I think you all are weird neophytes for thinking pie is pizza. However, Pequod's is the absolute best, and I refuse to let weird pie you people call pizza pass my lips unless it is from Pequod's.

I had always heard about Pequod's from all my friends, but never went. FINALLY, I went and had the pizza. I will have to agree with everyone that it really is great pizza! Highly recommend checking it out!

Yummy in my tummy!  I have been coming here for take out for about a year now and I love it!    I usually order the same thing every time which is the deep dish pepperoni pizza with extra sauce! The sauce they use is rich, seasoned right and just plain delicious, so that's why I say extra sauce!!!  The caramelized onion crust is what makes these pizza's perfect!  The most recent visit was unforgettable! I ordered a pizza for pick up and I arrived early. So, I told the hostess I will be waiting in my car and I will come back in 10 minutes. As I was waiting she knocks on my car window to deliver me my pizza! Now that is worth 5 stars!!  If you are looking for somewhere different for deep dish that isn't Lou or Gino east.. Come to the north side of Chicago and experience a different style of pizza with outstanding service.

It's pretty good.  I don't know why this often gets listed among one of the best deep dish pizzas in the city, though.  I found the crust a little lacking, the sauce just a bit bland, and the sausage tasted a little strange to me.  I would go with Lou's, Giordano's, and Gulliver's pan pizza over this place.  I'd still come here, though, just wouldn't be my first choice.

Pequod's, you truly live up to all the hype everyone is talking about. Pequot's has the best deep dish pizza you will ever taste. Forget Lou Malnati's, Gino's, and Giordano's. They don't even come close to Pequod's. Come early or call-in before you arrive to get on the list. My husband and I came on a Saturday night and were predicted a 2-hour wait. No worries though, we walked to the Drinkbird, just 2 stores down from Pequod's, for a drink while waiting. And shortly after finishing our first drink, we were notified that our table was ready. We waited for ~ 45 minutes before our table was ready. Just in case you were wondering, Barnes and Nobles is out of range for the sensor to work. Trust me, we asked them too.  What makes Pequod's so unique is their crust. That caramelized crust is so delicious that there are no words that can properly describe how amazing it tastes. You just have to come and try it yourself. I promise you you won't regret it, and it's worth the wait. You have to pay extra for each topping, but don't worry, they are very generous with their toppings.  NOTE: It takes ~45 minutes for your pizza to cook after you order, so you should order an appetizer. Their garlic bread is a great start for an appetizer when you're about to get hangry. If you're Blackhawks fan, you'll love this place even more. :)

Relative newbie to Pequod's though long time Chicago resident and pizza fan. I like all styles of pizza and often seek the local favorites when traveling. Pequod's pizza is good. Good enough that I wanted to come back and try it a month later. On my second trip, I was disappointed. Not by the pizza, for we never got a table. The wait was 60 minutes at 10:00 on a Saturday. What struck me is how much of a dive the place really is. Dingy, dirty, cramped and generally run down. Not what you'd expect from a popular place. The bathrooms are a disaster of ancient plumbing and water leaking on the floor. I hope it was only water. Pequod's is not kitschy or old school or hip, it's just tired, very tired. Even the bar looks forlorn and obviously neglected with cheap decorations and unstocked shelves. I'm sure the owners make a mint on the place. But they sure don't spend a dime making it nice, clean and modern. Fire trap comes to mind. But the pizza is still good. Just not good enough to endure the building and environs.

Their bartender(?)/manager behind the bar warmly greeted us as we walked in.  Deep dish pizza isn't my thing, so not going to rate based on that. On the other hand, my friend had a thin slice pizza and she said she's had better, "it was ok".  I LOVED my tomato bisque/soup paired with bread and butter. I ordered plain wings as well with ranch on side-- chicken is chicken.  My only qualm is the hipsters loitering by the bar. I'm not sure if they were workers on the clock (pretty slow evening; 12a) or they're just hanging out. Regardless, they took away from our server's potential attentiveness. They were loud, obnoxious, and kept talking to our waitress, while we were trying to get her attention for the check. If they were off the clock employees, I don't care how slow the place is, they need to take it down a notch and stop impeding on the server's job. It's like, you want to tip a server, but why would you tip someone who's just bringing you your food, and not checking up on you on a timely manner or to see if we're waiting on you to take the check because your back is towards us blabbering with your friends/coworkers. Shit, if im tipping you for satisfying bare minimum, leave the food at the bar and I'll pick it up myself. Regardless, because I know how entitled most millennials/this generation is, I'm forced to tip, for social courtesy.

After much researching into who had the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, Pequod's made the final 4 (Art of Pizza, Lou Malnati's and Gino's East were the others), which I tried while I was in Chicago, this past Fall. After having all 4, Pequod's ended up at the top of my list. Being a Pittsburgher, I think it's a travesty that they don't ship nationwide, like Malnati's and Gino's. That said, I have asked and they said they will par bake pies for shipment, but somebody would have to pick them up and ship them themselves. Might any of you local Chicagoites be willing to help out a fellow Pequod's-lover? If so, you can reach me at  bassbone26@hotmail.com . Thanks!
Best deep dish in Chicago if you like crust more than sauce. Their crust is soft and crunchy... It's really good!
Caramelized onion crust deep dish pizza!  Phenomenal is an understatement!
Pequod's to me is the real authentic CHICAGO deep dish pizza!!! The caramelized crust is to die for! Absolutely a must for those people looking to eat the best of the best deep dish!

It's crowded, but it's worth the wait for this savory cheesy deliciousness. At Pequod's it's all about the pan pizza--which is Deep Dish, but not stuffed (like Giordano's--which is also delicious). For toppings, I  highly recommend the meatballs. Pequod's is a Blackhawks bar, so its particularly crowded when the Hawks are playing.
Pequod's is the only "pan" pizza my family eats, definitely a landmark restaurant!
Good pizza. Love the lunch special. Love the burnt cheese crust. Art C

I've gotten Pequod's a couple of times now, and I don't think that I'll be doing so again.   The first time I ordered pick-up while I was running errands, and was told it would be a 45-60 minute wait on the pizza.  That was fine, and when I showed up, my order was completely wrong.  I ordered a thin crust with peppers and mushrooms, and was given a deep-dish pizza with only mushrooms.  When I complained to the staff, I was told that it would take another 30+ minutes for them to get my correct order out to me (that time included being given "priority" so that my pizza would be out more quickly).  No attempt to make things right were offered as far as a discount off a future pizza or knocking the price down on the current one. The second time I was in the area with relatives from out of town, and happened to be in the area, so we stopped by to put our name on the list.  We intentionally went before the dinner rush (about 5:30PM) because I know how crowded it can get.  We were told 45-60 minutes for a table, which was fine.  Fast forward to 7:30PM and we were still waiting for a table and were pretty hangry at that point.  I would have been fine if we showed up and they told us that there was a two hour wait.  We would have simply went somewhere else, but every time we asked about the status of our table, we were told that one was opening up and would be the next to get seated.  We finally had to suggest to the hostess that we be seated around a high-top table (which for 6 people is a tight squeeze), and I never felt that anyone even cared about the poor service that was provided.   I really wanted to like this place, but it seems to me that they feel that they can treat customers however they want because if they lose one or two, they'll have more lining up sooner or later.
Pequod's is super loud and incredibly busy, but it's worth it. Their pizza is my favorite in the city known for stuffed pizza.

100 minutes to get a deep dish pizza after ordering it on a Sunday night when seated inside the restaraunt.  We were quoted 60 minutes by server when ordering.  Had to ask a manager to find our pizza after 90 minutes, our server just ignored our table.  With the very long waits to get in, the poor service while seated, and the ridiculous wait time for pizza, I advise staying away from Pequod's Pizza.

Well you've come to Chicago to try the world famous Chicago Deep Dish PIzza. Are you gonna go to a lame-duck chain restaurant like Uno's? No, I don't think so. You are gonna come to Pequod's to truly experience Deep Dish Pizza. Haven't tried other Deep Dish places in Chicago, but Pequod's lived up to their fame.

I have to say, I am a die-hard New York Pizza Guy , but Pequod's was awesome. The sauce was delicious, the sausage on the pizza tasted fresh comma and it was an all-around good experience. Just a tip, they have a fantastic lunch special pizza and a soda for $5. During my stay I went to 3 different pizza places, and this was the best one. My only regret is that I didn't get a chance to go back.

Overrated. The caramelized crust that everyone raves about was nothing more than an entirely charred ring of mozzarella cheese along the sides of the pizza. Fillings were nothing fancy either, very standard flavors that one can easily replicate at home.

This pizza is so delicious!  I love the sauce so much. The pan pizza is the one to get. Burnt edges are crispy and crackly. The pepperoni is one every slice. Super filling so you always have leftovers. The Pequod salad is perfect too. Go here!!!
I've ordered over 100 pizzas from this place for my classes over the past 17 years, the students love it!

Lovveee their deep dish (pan pizza)! I would seriously rank this place as my second or first choice for deep dish in Chicago! I have a group of friends whom which we go to a different pizza joint every week. We have tried Giordanos, Ginos, Lous, Piece, Dantes, Boiler Room and this place is a great place for deep dish!  Service at the restaurant was great! Our waitress was very friendly and took good care of us... she joked around with us the entire time we were there. Another thing I really appreciated about this place was that we told a staff member who brought the pizza to the table that we were excited to try this pizza and wanted to compare to other we have tried. He instead of bashing or bad mouthing other pizza joints given he works there instead talked about other pizza joints he visits or which other pizza he would recommend we tried! I thought that was pretty awesome! I will def be back in the near future to have more of that yumminess!!!

Went to Chicago for the first time and of course had to try some Chicago deep dish pizza.  My wife and I shared a meat lovers style pizza.  It was very good but the crust only covered about half the pizza on the bottom which was odd.  Flavor was very good though.  We also had fried mozzarella sticks and fried mushrooms and they were great.  We enjoyed the place overall but the pizza didn't quite live up to the hype.  Maybe we came on an off day...

Ate here for the 2nd time a few days ago!! Best deep dish I had so far- beats Giordanos any day. The pizza comes out super hot. The cheese is absolutely amazing, so creamy, melts right off the pizza. I only tried the deep dish pizza pie and it's to die for! The reason for the 4 stars, however, as follows: They get pretty busy so service can be a little slow. First time our waitress was still great, despite how busy it was. The second time we came here we felt a little ignored and forgotten.  Also, if you like a lot of toppings, can come out pretty expensive. They charge about 3 extra dollars PER topping. I love my toppings, so our pizza pie went from $18 to about $46!!!  Nevertheless, totally worth it! Will come here whenever I absolutely need a, to die for, Chicago style deep dish. Worth the 1 hr drive here for me!

The wait to even get the pizza was very ridiculous. It took 2 hours for pick up. I expected a lot more from their pizza since the wait was so long, but unfortunately I was disappointed.  Maybe it's because I'm not a fan of really thick crusted pizza? So maybe I'm a little bias.  But this pizza was just way too doughey for me. The flavor of the pizza was also okay. I've read a lot of reviews saying we should add extra sauce and extra cheese, but that was probably the worst decision to be made. Too much sauce and cheese and not enough meat. The ingredients were definitely fresh though. I give them that.
Awesome deep dish pizza and great service! Definitely coming back here again! This is nos my favorite deep dish pizza now.

This place turned out to be amazing,  I have never been here before but the deep dish pizza was without a doubt one of the best pizzas I tasted in Chicago so far,  the somehow burned crusted made it so special and tasty,  and the serves was very attentive... My new hangout place for pizza

My first Chicago deep dish, and I will never forget it.   It took us a while to walk to Pequods from the train station, so cue happy sounds of satisfaction when sitting down at one of the high round tables near the center of the room.  I was a little surprised by the bar like atmosphere, but it was fun to watch sports as well as a pizza tour group that arrived later.  After debating about the toppings and the size with some advice thrown in by our friendly waitress, we ordered together.  The pizza arrived an hour later. If you know anything about the Chicago pizza scene, you'll know that there are many different camps that pizzas fall in.  Pequods specializes in a burnt crust variety, with a thick crust and much cheesey goodness.  Very delicious!  I also overestimated the size of my stomach and could only finish two slices, so I end up taking quite a bit home for later.

If anyone ever comes to visit Chicago and wants deep dish, this is the only place I take them and it's always a hit. The perfect deep dish pizza consists of: Beef, giardiniera, and spinach. That's all you need... and a party in your mouth. Yum.

This is the best pizza in Chicago. It's also a little off the beaten path, so it is mostly locals, which is nice.  It's still always busy and will generally have at least a 30 minute wait, but it's worth it.   Pro tip: Get the personal pizza, as it's about right for one hungry person and it maximizes the caramelized crust.  Also, their lunch special is the best deal in the city.  It used to be $4.95 for a personal pizza, salad and drink, though it may be a bit more now.
Best pizza in the world. Their deep dish takes close to an hour to bake. Well worth the wait.
Don't tell the tourists about this place! Let them eat at Gino's East and Malnati's! Love it! Especially after a Blackhawks game!

Owned by Burt of Burt's place before he sold it and opened in Morton Grove which is now closed. No clue why people like the odd carmelized (burnt) ring of crust on the outside. Pizza is ok but incredibly greasy with any meat topping.

It's soooo good! The sauce is not as chunky as other places and the crust isn't as thick as some of the others, but the emphasis here is on the toppings!! We got sausage, pepperoni, and black olives and it was sooooo good! The sausage was nice, high quality and there were stacks of pepperoni. Yum! The place is crazy busy, so definitely take advantage of their call ahead table service.
best pizza and hang out place .  best place to invite your out of state visitors to try Chicago style pizza .

Ordered a pizza and asked them to freeze it so I could bring it back to Seattle with me. Something they do all the time. Show up (after paying extra for my uber driver to take me there) and they took down the order wrong. Not frozen. Terrible experience.

Got a small deep dish with onion, mushroom and spinach! So delicious. Very fresh and it was enough to leave us both very full. Also had the cheesy garlic which was great. Service was awesome and super helpful. Pizza takes a while to come out so I would recommend a heavy drink and/or an app.
Just received note from manger. Glad that someone acknowledged the disgusting pizza served. Hoping next time it's better. Thx Sean

Went year a while back for my birthday and absolutely enjoyed it. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was pretty cool.  We started with a party of 6 and ended up with 10 and they were more than accommodating.  The only reason this place is missing a star is because our waitress was acting like she had attitude because it was 10 of us and then when we asked for napkins, she literally brought us 5 napkins.

Pequods seriously changed my mind entirely about Chicago style pizza, and now I call nearly every Saturday at 6:00pm (yes, very long delivery times. Prepare yourselves.) It's always the same: Medium pie with garlic and green pepper eaten while watching Svengoolie at 9pm (with a romantic partner. My life isn't that sad.)

My review might be colored by the fact that the pizza at Pequod's was the very first deep dish I'd had, but I absolutely loved it! I was in Chicago for the holidays, to visit friends, and someone suggested Pequod's for proximity reasons. Although I did get to have deep dish pizza again during my stay, and from a different place, there's no way I can compare that and Pequod's. How do you describe deep dish pizza? Let me just say that I understand why it's called a "pie" now. In fact, that's how I can best describe it - a very tomatoey, very cheesy, very meaty pie, with a hot, crisp crust! We went for a medium sausage pizza to be shared by 4, and underestimated how large and heavy it will be. It took 45-50 minutes to prepare, but two slices, and I was done! Don't get there when you're extremely hungry, because in all likelihood, there's gonna be a line when you get there, and then the wait for the pizza. But MAN the pizza is amazing!
Best pizza in the city, hands down. The burnt cheese crust is unique and delicious. Go for the pepperoni with giardiniera.

My husband and I visited Pequod's last weekend - we had heard so much about Pequod's, we took a long train ride for our evening out. 1) Our waitress was lack-luster, disinterested in helping people - never asked how everything was and we had to get her attention to order another cocktail....it seems as though we were bothering her. 2) The pizza crust was tasteless and the amount of toppings was laughable.     We ordered a large 1/2 meatball & 1/2 sausage - there were 4 small pieces of sausage on the pizza.  3) Charging $7.95 for a small glass of rum & coke is insane - we were not in NYC... And just to be fair - we did not visit Pequod's during a dinner 'rush' - it was 4:30pm...no  reason for bad service and less than adequate pizza.  It's pretty sad when I say our salad might have been the only good thing we ate.
Excellent deep dish as a first timer. Blackened crust is different but I enjoyed it. Packed place on a Sat evening but hey if you make a good pizza people are going to want it!
I love this place. If you are looking for a good Chicago style pizza, this place is worth checking out. I like it better than Lou's, and that is when I really like Lou's as well.

Amazing pizza; terrible service. If they tell you it will be an hour, prepare yourself to wait at least an hour and a half. And also prepare yourself for the employees to be as rude as you could imagine when you get frustrated that you're waiting 30 minutes more than you were told. Not sure even this pizza is worth it.

Wow! Don't go to the popular place everyone goes. Go get pizza at local places like this. I loved it! The Pizza sauce is wonderful. My husband pointed out to me how the pizza is made in Chicago.  Crust, Cheese, and then the sauce is on top of the cheese along with all the toppings.  WHAT A GREAT IDEA!!!  I wish everyone made pizza this way. The crust at this place was crispy and tasty, takes about 40 minutes to make the pizza so don't show up starving, but don't go eat before you come here because there is a lot of pizza to eat and enjoy. I didn't realize there was an upstairs till we were seated up there.  This place is much larger then I expected and perfectly placed in a wonderful community where you can walk around and enjoy the outside shopping areas around as you wait to be seated and enjoy wonderful food.

This is one of the best pizza places in Chicago.  The place is always busy so show up early to get your name in. I would say pass on the appetizers.  the appetizers are bar quality, but the pizza definitely makes up for it!
Since moving out from Chicago, the two things I miss the most are Portillos and Pequods.  Nothing else compares to the crust and sausage you get here.

Decided to go lastnight, called ahead put name on list was told would be 45 minute wait at most. Get there they said 1 hr wait and we would be next party of 5 to be seated, check in because buzzers don't always work. We took our buzzer, came back in an hour checked in, was told a few tables ahead of us ( I questioned this and the guy was a jerk), so we waited, mean while 2 other party of 5 were seated (lil confused how we were next yet 2 other tables went ahead).  Finally after 1 1/2 hrs of waiting a girl came grabbed my arm said party of 5, I said yes she said follow me, we followed her to a table sat down got comfortable decided what to order next thing we know the guy (the jerk) comes back up to us says it wasn't our table and forced us to come down and wait again. No appology, nothing. Was so unorganized, unprofessional and RUDE treatment ever. I will NEVER eat there again. The sign on the was even stated call in advance you get half the wait time, Wait time was 2 hours we called and still waited OVER 1hr and 40 min. We left, never again! Pizza is not that good Lou Malnatis in Oak Park is WAY better. Better service, nicer staff and atmosphere!

Ali and I take family and friends here who've never had deep dish... It's our go-to, just as Johnnie's is our go-to for Italian beef. Pequod's is always always packed! When here with a group of five we waited one hour to get a seat and one hour to get our pizza, and it was the best!! I love the caramelized crust! You better not call it burnt or I will pull all my hair out right in front of you.  Ali and I don't go to deep dish joints EVER, unless it is to entertain guests - and when we do go we always order the small pan with onion, mushroom, pineapple, and anchovy. Even the small is massive. One slice of this stuff is like three regular slices of pizza. This ish is definitely a casserole, and they don't skimp on the toppings.  When here entertaining a friend most recently we only had to wait 20 minutes for a table, and 45 for our pizza. Not bad! They also sat us in the back booth with the comfy seats. Every single seat in the house was full and there was a huge crowd waiting for a spot when we left.  If you can handle the crowd and the wait times you'll have the best deep dish in Chicago.

An embarrassing example of Chicago deep dish pizza. Check out the picture I posted that shows large hunk of bread with a tiny layer of cheese on top. A lot of the pictures look great with that burnt crust and all. But what you are not seeing is that there is almost no cheese on this "pizza". I was sorely disappointed after checking out the pics, seeing their high rating, I was expecting much more. Hopefully you read this in time so you can save your hard earned money for a more substantial pizza.  What they serve here is disgraceful.

The hostess kicked me out because I was watching the top 10 plays after eating my pizza... She was a horrible hostess... I like the pizza but the service was horrible... Never going back again... I wish they would treat people better.

The question I imagine everyone asks is 'How does the deep dish compare to the other establishments?' Really well, I'm not a deep dish connoisseur, but of the ones I've had, this one rates the best. For me it was the crust. It was still crispy and great with all the gooey cheese. Whenever we visit Chicago and are craving deep dish- we'll come here first :)

I give this pizza a meh, the toppings were nice and fresh, the sauce is good, the crust is total crap flavorless, crumbly, and the bottom crust wet, soggy, and just fell apart when I tried to grab my first slice. Overall I wouldn't order it again delivery took an hour and half which is understandable on a Friday night, but not worth it when the pizza is this low quality.

Unlike many places around the city, this place is completely worth the wait (or ordering from home and having it delivered). Skip the touristy places like Uno, Due, Malnati's, and Gino's (unless you like 2" thick gummy dough). Great beer, great staff (sometimes caddy, sometimes straight to the point), and, of course, amazing pizza.

It's frickin' good pizza.  I thought nothing could beat Lou Malnati's but I was wrong.  A co-worker suggested I try this spot and the pizza didn't disappoint.  I ordered one with extra cheese, basil, and sausage.  That frickin' sausage was to die for.  And the burnt crust at the end was really good.  I'm sorry I wasn't able to take a pic of it since my phone died.   We each at a slice and was so full we packed it and decided to give to a homeless person.  Was happy someone could make a meal out of it.

Best deep dish pizza in town! Every person I have ever taken here loves the pizza. I've had people tell me they never liked deep dish till they had Pequod's. Do yourself a favor if you're here from out of town and want some good Chicago style pizza, please, please go to Pequod's. The lines can be quite long for dinner, so if you want to avoid them go for lunch.
I don't understand this place. They serve pizza bread, it's not pizza. With so many amazing choices for incredible pizza in Chicago, I just don't get why people like Pequods.
So good! I love that this place delivers too. I love to get the deep dish with sausage and garlic. The crust is awesome and it's very filling.

Every time I come here, I have to get their pan pizza (they say it's deep dish, but I don't really consider it deep dish?). Anyway, their pizza is amaaaaaaaaaaaazing. Their ingredients are so fresh and I LOVE the crust (and I NEVER eat pizza crust).  Good beer on tap, and the server checks in regularly. :)

So Lou Malnati's was my favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago.... I thought no other deep dish could compete.... I WAS WRONG.  Pequods.... wow.  I really don't know what else to say that hasn't already been said about their amazing pizza.  The sauce... the fresh toppings... that crust!!! I will happily drive from the suburbs to carryout from here.  I suggest you all do the same !

I do not like pan pizza in general. Too much bread. HOWEVER, I LOVE Pequod's pan pizza. The carmelization, the generous toppings, the sauce. This is, to me, the very definition of Chicago pizza. This is a must-go for anyone visiting and looking for good pizza. I just wish I lived closer, but I'll always make the special trip.
Best pizza in town! Anyone visiting, its a must!! Can get a little annoyingly packed. But thats just a sign of a great product.

I have been hearing people talk about this place forever, so I finally gave it a try at midnight one night. LOL. I placed an order for deliver (thin crust, sausage, mushrooms, garlic, and tomato). Starting with the positive....toppings are AMAZING!!! So fresh and delicious. Why 3 stars? Probably the worst crust I have ever tasted. It totally had no flavor and tasted like regular bread versus pizza dough. Also the delivery took almost 2 hours.  I was told when ordering from Pequod's though you need to go deep dish, so maybe i'll try that next time.
I am not a lover of deep dish pizza. But this is off the chart delicious!   The place is crowded all the time, but well worth the wait. The best deep dish pizza in the world!
Best deep dish in Chicago in my opinion. Definitely better than Giordano's, Lou's or Pizano's.

I've been going to/ordering from Pequod's for years....dating back to when Blackhawks home games weren't televised.  This was the only place in town that had NHL Center Ice and a chance to watch a home game.  Definitely top 3 best pizzas in Chicago too.

My fiancée and I were staying in Chicago and got hungry around 11:00 pm. We looked up delivery places in the area and this place showed up. We figured we would give it a try and get it delivered to our hotel. Horrible idea! We placed the order at 11:25 pm. We ordered a meatball sandwich, half order of wings, mozzarella sticks, fries, and a slice of cake The food didn't arrive until almost 1:00 am. Here is the worst part, they completely forgot the meatball sandwich! No sandwich at all. We called back and we were offered a "partial refund" not even sure for how much yet as the refund hasn't went through on my credit card just yet. We were then told the meatball sub would be right out. It didn't arrive until 2:00 am and we had to get up at 7:00 am the next morning. In the meantime waiting we tried the rest of the food. The mozzarella sticks obviously sat for quite awhile. The fries were extremely soggy and just barely cooked. The cake had a very odd refrigerator smell to it. The only thing decent enough were the wings, but you don't get much of them.  When the meatball sub arrived the delivery guy offered us a free pineapple and jalapeño pizza because "he couldn't deliver it". We didn't want it but just said okay with no real intentions of eating it. We opened it up just to see and as I predicted the pizza was burnt! Basically their apology was a burnt pizza someone else didn't want. $38 for some of the worst food I have ever eaten. Absolutely horrible! I would never eat from them again even if the food was free. Just disgusting. They should of refunded the entire order. The free burnt pizza was really offensive and only annoyed me further. The worst service ever!!! Edit: I got my refund today. Only $9.16 which I guess was for the meatball sub. The way the woman over the phone made it sound was that I would be at least getting half the order refunded for their mistake. Oh well. Cheap company that I would never order from again. If you want burnt pizza and bad customer service eat here!

Very disappointing.  Service was lousy.  Downstairs was half empty, but they marched us upstairs to be seated.  Then they realized that upstairs was full, so we went back down. Seated us at the bar, but then another worker said my son couldn't sit at the bar.  After we finally got to a table, it took them over an hour to bring us a small, thin crust cheese pizza.  Other tables that were seated twenty minutes after us got pizzas faster.  No apologies, no explanation other than that the waiter should have told us it could take 45 minutes for a pizza.  When we finally got it, the pizza was fine but nothing special.  For thin crust, the crust was too chewy.  We live in the neighborhood and have eaten here before, but doubt we will bother again.

I'm sorry, I do not understand the hype around this place. I was excited to try it. We ordered delivery and I have to say I don't thinking would again. It not only took over 2 hours, it just didn't knock my socks off. People have told me dining in makes a huge difference, but my question is, should it?
Fantastic pizza. Incredible crust. Definitely one of my favorite places

Definitely an upgrade from Giordanos which I've been told no self-respecting Chicagoan would find himself or herself eating at (whoops for me).  It was still the 45 minute wait for food, but the pizza quality was definitely noticeably better. The staff and service were great and the happy hour seems like an awesome nice touch. I can't really comment on the pizza other than it was tasty and better than the last Chicago pizza joint I was at. Space can be tight so coming at off hours can definitely help get you a table faster. You might also have to get creative with where you park (farther from the restaurant) iif you're an outta towner like me.

Incredible deep-dish. My friend was visiting and had never been to Chicago, so this was a great introduction into Chicago style pizza. We loved the sausage and the consistency, I would definitely order the pizza again--but only for take-out. We had been warned about the wait which was crazy, but the sheer noise from inside the bar when we went in to pick up the pizza was overwhelming. There is no way that you could eat or have a conversation comfortably--take out all the way!
The best deep dish in the city! Be prepared to wait for a table but it's worth it.

Some friends were raving about how awesome the pizza here is so I got some to go. IT'S NOT DEEP DISH PIZZA! It's basically pizza bread with too much sauce that's just meh, and a beautifully caramelized crust with minimal cheese.  Super disappointing.

Pequod's and a movie - could there BE a better date night? Nope! Located right across the street from Regal Webster Place 11, Pequod's has THE best deep dish pizza. I'm not generally a deep dish fan but the caramelized crust can't be beat. Also, their deep dish tends to be on the saucy side which is key for me. The place itself is authentic, narrow and too damn crowded. I prefer the second floor where there's slightly more elbow room. We always call in advance to make a reservation, thereby cutting the wait time in half.

Went here with friends this past weekend.  Even though we did a call ahead we had to wait two hours to get a table.  They were telling walk-ins that it would be over three hours, and I had no idea why someone would wait so long for pizza.  Now I completely understand.  This was easily the best Chicago-style pizza I have ever had, and I've been to a number of places that are "the best".  Pequod's blew it out of the water.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago, but I'll probably do carry out.
This pizza is unique, delicious and worth the wait.  They've got a decent selection of beers to enjoy while waiting for the pizza.  The little crispy burnt parts are the BEST.

I got a pizza for pick up last weekend. They open at 11am on Saturdays, but I called at 10:45 to see if I could place the order and they were ready to start taking orders. Pizza was ready at 11:30am sharp. Thanks!

One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago! I always try to take my guests here when they come visit Chicago. The atmosphere has a sports bar feel but is very family friendly. It's usually fairly busy so be sure to get there before the rush in order to get a table in a decent amount of time. Great pizza, good drink selection, clean and fun environment. Don't pass up this gem!
