Pequod's is not the place you should go to for Pizza if your in Chicago. I do applaud that they are open on New Years Eve but it's to many choices to go to in Chicago with better tasting pizza.

Pretty darn good deep dish if you ask me! I've been to Gino's as well but I think this place takes the cake. The burned cheese is everything that a cheese lover such as myself could ask for, and the staff is friendly and very well versed in the pizza cutting world.

This is the hidden gem of Chicago Style pizza! I love it here - The pizza is delivered in the pan that was bake, and the cheese that crisp on the ledge of the pan is just exactly what your mouth needs to start this adventure of flavor. Pequod's pie would not disappoint even a New Yorked - who think their pizzas are better.

Love this place! The pizza is delicious and they have a great selection of beer. The ambiance is laid back and casual. This is a great spot to go when you have a taste for pizza, but don't want it from your usual spot.

The quintessential Chicago deep dish.  Why is this place not the poster child for Chicago pizza?  Everything on the menu is amazing.  Ambience is energetic, yet intimate.  I used to live within walking distance of this place, and miss living closer.

I'm not sure why this pizza is so talked about in Chicago! I had to see what the fuss was about, so I ordered a personal pepperoni deep dish and a thin slice of cheese (yes, I like food). The thin slice was just like any cheap greasy slice, nothing really to it. I was excited about the deep dish however, since I've heard great things. I have to say... this is NOT real Chicago style deep dish. It is a VERY thick slice of bread with minimal sauce and minimal cheese. Chicago style pizza should be minimal crust, and a whole lot of cheese. I was extremely disappointed.
Great tasting pan or deep dish pizza, while we didn't have the thin crust, I'm sure it would be just as good.  Would certainly be back.
Forget Lou, forget Giordano, go to Pequod.It is definitely the best deep dish pizza of Chicago.
Awesome pizza. Super fresh ingredients, flavorful, not too heavy/greasy.

It gets no better than this!  The best deep dish pizza in Chicago, hands down.  It is unassuming on the outside but you will typically see a line to get in.  They also have great lunch specials.  Highly recommend!!

The perfect local deep dish! Better than all the chain/touristy spots. I am a big fan of deep dish pizza, but I usually and left with the chain restaurants or a store that makes deep dish taste like a block of cheese or tomato puree.   Not the case here. Pequod's is perfect! It has full flavor and lots of toppings options and is reasonably priced. The venue is also really comfortable and neighborly. I am always going to get my deep dish pizza here.
Too much dough for me and not enough sauce/cheese. However, the burnt cheese that is on the crust is phenomenal. Service is good. Parking is scarce. Go to Lou Mals instead and get your deep dish on.

We made the fatal error of going to Lou's when ee got off the plane instead of going straight to Pequod's... but now we know the difference between sub par and excellent... Ordered: Thin Crust w/ sausage, mushroom and green peppers Not ever going to order a thin crust pizza outside of NYC again! The dough tasted like the pillsbury instant dough.... Deep dish w/ pepperoni, meatball, green peppers and mushrooms.  Mucho bettero! Fresh ingredients, cheesy and the crust had a nice crunch. All worth the calories! Wash it down with some of "Not your fathers root beer"

Decided to give Pequod's another try and it was the same as I remembered. A long wait for bland (thin crust) pie.   Most everyone orders the deep dish which I am not a fan of.  Admittedly, I am a long time Chicagoan who no longer enjoys deep dish.   There are many wonderful other local options for both elsewhere:  Pat's, Art of Pizza and Lou's.  Please note this review is strictly based on the food however.  Giving 2 stars because our server was great and the staff seemed to run a well coordinated effort, given the size of the crowd.  Atmosphere is cozy upstairs.  One other item to note:  Be weary of going on a weekend.  Besides the very long wait, our table unfortunately was seated next to a loud group of over-served young adults who continued to get louder with each pitcher they drank.   They dominated the entire room to the point that our party was yelling at each other in order to be heard.  The management did speak with the group however that only fueled them more. Sigh.  Trust, better options elsewhere.

Best deep dish pizza CRUST, by far. I'm a huge fan of the extra crispy crust with some burnt bits of cheese - I practically finish it before I've even worked on the pizza itself. So freaking delicious. Long, long lines, but definitely worth it. I've waited 2 hours on a Sunday night, and even in my hangry state, could not be unhappy with Pequods. You can call in to theoretically "shorten" your wait time, but when I called and later arrived, they just put my name down underneath everyone else... after confirming with me "Ah you called, we'll let you know." I'm doubtful of this system. NOTABLE: -Their lunch special is pretty ridiculous - I think it's like $5! - so hop on that if you can. -This one may be obvious but do not order the Pequod's Salad. One, who goes to a deep dish pizza place to order a salad? Two... It's lettuce with pizza toppings.

Amazing deep dish. Compared to Lou Malnati's, the bread is definitely thicker, but the crust is so much more flavorful and enjoyable. Instead of basically a giant plate of sausage, you get your normal balls of sausage at Pequod's. Got two personal pizzas with sausage and extra marinara, which was the perfect amount for 2-3 people. We asked for less dough because we were afraid that the pizza would be too bready for us, and it ended up being the right choice. The marinara is phenomenal, the sausages delectable, and the crust is a glorious crown of crisp cheesiness. Definitely a place to stop by if you're visiting Chicago.
Enjoy their take on pizza. I prefer the Morton grove location because of parking easiness but both sites provide quality tasting pizza. Great time and great food.

Pequod's is in just the right location. It's near the Regal Cinema and other great businesses in the Chicago area. The pans they cook the pizza in caramelize the cheese and you'll find yourself abandoning your table manners and picking and pulling the ingredients off and nibbling ferociously. The items are cooked to order so it'll be at least 30 minutes for some hot and delicious memories. The staff are very nice and will try to seat you upstairs or downstairs based on your preference. Be forewarned, during peak times there can be a wait since many patrons will wait for a movie to start or watch sports as they dine. Parking is located in a nearby garage as street parking is a rarity.

I'm not a deep dish person. I've found that at most places the crust is dry and flavorless, and the cheese/sauce ration is totally insane and impossible to enjoy. Pequod's is the exception. The crust is flavorful, seasoned, and crispy; there is a modest amount of quality cheese and really tasty sauce. I've had it in house and delivery, and it held up super well even though the drive to my place must have been 15-20 min. Really nice servers, though the host stand was kind of a mess when I got there, but it was worth the wait.
best pan pizza in chicago. if you have not tried the crust on this pan pizza you havent had pan pizza

I was so excited to try this pizza after hearing some great things, but after this experience I will take my business elsewhere. I put in an order for delivery understanding that it would take a while on a Friday night, but after waiting an extra hour after the scheduled delivery I called to inquire. Apparently my order was taking too long so it was cancelled, but I was never contacted. There were no apologies, offers to place the order again, or attempts to help in general. I'm an extremely understanding person, but making mistakes and taking no steps to try to resolve the situation is unacceptable.
I wouldn't suggest this place to watch a hockey game but the pizza and good is amazing and the staff is great!
I love pequods pizza... It's like Portillo's but in the pizza world! Just the best.  Love this place and had a birthday party here before upstairs.  Yeah.. it's awesome!

So many pizza choices in Chicago, and I'm sure there are a dozen good ones.  Pequods is unique for two reasons.  First off this location is more of a local hangout than a tourist spot, and there are $5.75 lunch deals to be had via Yelp for a pizza and a drink.  Secondly, their deep dish pizza is baked with some cheese on outside edge of crust so that it caramelizes into a semi-burnt dreamy nirvana of crisp cheese heaven.  A personal size is almost too much, especially when you add on a $2.50 salad.  Overall the best value for our dollar on our trip, and a casual, local hangout type atmosphere.  Would definitely recommend anybody visiting Chicago make the short Uber/Lyft trip up to north side to eat here.
What a special & different kind of deep-dish - caramelized with a slight burnt taste, nothing like it. VERY delish!

When in Chicago, you gotta go get yourself a deep dish pizza. You can go for one of the chain restaurants, or you can try a local joint. The bf and i came here in the afternoon. No wait around 5/6 o'clock. What sets this place apart from the other pizza joints? The caramelize crust. God that crust was good. I would have to say, if you like a thick, hardy, toasty crust, tart tomato base, and lots of gooey cheese, then this is the place to go. THe bf and I ordered the small and it was SO MUCH FOOD. We ended up getting just mushroom, which was a good choice since it didn't end up too oily or overwhelming. i complete recommend this place and if you can, come for their lunch special. It's like $5 for a personal pizza! Score!
Not sure what all the buzz is about. A long wait for average pizza.
There is something so wonderful about the taste of that browned cheese crust!  It is very addicting.  I love it.

Very good pizza, always on my short list.  It is a little different from the other popular places but I love that caramelized cheesy deliciousness.  Plus I can buy it by the slice which helps when everyone likes something different.  I first enjoyed this pizza and a cocktail over 15 years ago and it is still delicious every time.
The best pizza in Chicago. I take everyone that visits  here and no one has ever been disappointed. I get take out often and the staff is rude but the pizza is so good I don't care.

Great deep dish! Our waitress was super unfriendly which is the reason no 5 stars. Also, we had a reservation but we still has to wait 20 minutes. Be careful of you have a show to get to because the pizzas take an hour to be made. Delicious though if you like deep dish.
Delicious pizza! I was in Chicago on business. My BFF from college brought me here with high hopes... And the pizza exceeded my expectations! Delicious! I will go back Everytime I visit.
BEST DEEP DISH IN CHICAGO. Seriously, don't go anywhere else, only to Pequod's.

I love Pequod's pizza. I always take out-of-towners here if they ask to experience some Chicago deep dish. The wait can be long but it is worth it. I usually don't like sausage pizza but their sausage is delicious. Salads also good.
Never mind my original reivew. This pizza rules and I would wait 3 hours to eat it.

Of all the deep dish pizzas I've had while in Chicago, Pequod's comes out on top.  This is the only place that had a crispy crust!  The other places had a much more doughy consistency to them so Pequod's def stands out.  Since the waitress warned that the pizza takes a long time to cook (took about ~40 min)  My friends and I ordered the cheesy bread and chicken strips to help tie us over until the sausage/pepperoni pizza came.  The apps were nothing to write home about but my review is specifically for their deep dish pizza.  The toppings of the pizza was heavenly as well as all the cheese!  I managed to tackle 3.5 slices of that behemoth.  Hands down the best deep dish pizza I've ever had (and probably the longest food coma I've had as well).
Hands down, the best pizza in the city. In fact, this is the first meal I requested post-baby in the hospital. ;)

Come during the weekday for their lunch special!!! Such a deal!!! 7" Pan Cheese Pizza and a fountain soda for $4.95 and each toppings for 80 cents more! It was so good!!! I'm not a big fan of pizza in general and I had deep dish before in California... but this was surprisingly good and you can't beat their lunch deal! Thanks for the great experience! They do not take reservations, but you can call ahead of time for them to put your name down and when you arrive, you will be moved up to the top of the waiting list! Seating is not guaranteed however!
I wish I lived closer to Pequod's because it's awesome. The food is great, the staff is friendly, and they've got a great selection of beers. Give it a shot!

Pizza is fantastic and always rated very highly in any post you'll see about the best Chicago pizza. ALWAYS call ahead/make a reservation - This will move you up on the list when you arrive, but you will still probably have about an hour wait. IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. You'll even have to wait for the pizza (deep dish), but trust me, it's worth it.

Ive been going here for years and grew up near the original one in Morton Grove.  Pizza is great and one of my favorites.  There is too much bread so I order extra cheese and that helps (why my rating is only 4 stars).  Twice the pizza has come out burnt, so they need to work on their consistancy (both times it was very busy).  Def "Barry RECOMMENDED."

Started with cheesy garlic which was really good - and mozzarella - just ok. Our pizza is pepperoni and sausage.  In my opinion it is good and different for those not familiar with deep dish pizza. Otherwise it is just ok. Good place to visit for out of town-ers.

Now, I must admit I was rather drunk upon arriving here....at 4pm, however the pizza was great and helped soak up a lot of alcohol. The service was quick and the staff were nice. The pizza was damn right deep and tasted great. I'd recommend if you are in the neighbourhood, if not, get some bikes (sober) or a cab (which are cheap in Chicago) for a thick slice.

I really love the atmosphere of Pequod's. It's the perfect amount of "Dirty bar you go to in the suburbs that your Uncle RAVES about all the damn time" that you really want in an authentic pizza place. I'm from the Detroit area (I know, we suck, it sucks and I suck, get over it man) and have lived in Chicago for about 5 years and this reminds me a lot of some of the local places/styles there. While I think the pizza is good (PAN always PAN) and really like the burnt/well done crust, since it reminds me of home, they don't give you enough sauce and what they do give you really isn't anything special. Crust and sauce are all that really matter to me in regards to judging whether or not a pizza place is "good" (no one makes their own cheese and you can't tell the difference between melted mozzarella...if you think you can...you are wrong)...so since the crust is good and the sauce is okay, you get 3 stars.
This is a must stop when I visit Chicago. The pizza is absolutely amazing. Love the thick crust. Crispy, flavorful.  Sauce is awesome. Always packed with pizza lovers. Try the meatball sandwich.
Best Chicago deep dish. Need I say more?

Wow!  The pizza is awesome!  I have turned on many friends and family to this place.  The pizza is well done and buttery/carmelized which I like.  A must try for anyone visiting Chicago.  I have been to both Clybourn and The Loop location, both are fun!

Before moving to Chicago I never liked pizza. In fact, I was that weirdo that ate the toppings, pulled off the cheese (and threw it away), and then ate the bread and sauce.  After a LOT of hounding from my friends to try this place, I finally caved, and I'm so glad that I gave in.  The crust is phenomenal and I am now a true fan of all things Pequod's.  Sure, there will be long lines and a wait if you go during prime dinner time on Friday and Saturday night, but it is definitely worth it.

Please don't eat here - simply put, I would like to keep this place all to myself, making it my very own deep dish Mecca.  Pequod serves, beyond a shadow of a doubt, the best deep dish pizza you'll ever eat. Their vegetarian pizza sets the standard for all veggie pizzas. Go early. Go often. Just don't ruin it for me...

Not a huge deep dish fan but when visiting Chicago, I figure you have to at least have it once.  I've done Uno and Lou Malnatis but wanted to give Pequods a shot- it did not disappoint. Really enjoyed the crust versus the overly buttery kind you typical get. Also found it to be a little less doughy overall.  Would definitely recommend adding this to your Chicago pizza tour.

For my money, THE BEST pan pizza in Chicago! Fresh ingredients, real cheese beautifully caramelized at the edges by the seasoned pan, a crust that is the right combo of chewy and crispy, and holds up cold or warm the next day. Plan for leftovers. Locations are a bit off the beaten path, but well worth the trip.

I wanted to try this place for a while, and finally did one freeeeeezing night last winter. It was good for sure, but I would not rank it among my top pizza choices. It's also priced pretty steeply for pizza I would not rank among my top pizza choices.  The crust is indeed great.
Simply the best. Sausage, Pepperoni and Garlic pan pizza. Dang I love visiting Chicago. Do not forget the cheese sticks.

This is my absolute favorite pizza. If you don't like deep dish pizza, you'll probably hate this. Because, it is everything that deep dish pizza claims to be. I would take a job cleaning homeless people's feet, if I got paid in Pequod's pizza.... I guess I could just work for money, and spend it on Pequod's. But, that would create one more step in converting my currency to what really matters in life... The best f...ing pizza in the world! I even love hearing people complain that their pizza was burnt. Hahaha. No. It's caramelized goodness that an angel brought back from her last trip to heaven. The sauce is a little sweet, and the cheese is made from the milk of the "holy cow" that Harry Carry was always talking about. This is Chicago. And, this is its pizza.

I have eaten at about 5 Chicago pizza places now and I must say that this is the best pizza in the city. Came here mainly because I have heard so much about it and I just had to give it a try. When you first walk in, it looks like a bar and grill with an upstairs, not to mention the small size menu. For starters, I went the buffalo wings, which were really really good. As for the pizza, I went with a sausage, pepperoni, and garlic. The pizza is simply greatness. The sausage is on point, they give you a lot of pepperoni and the garlic blends in greatly. The slices are big (got a medium with six slices for two but should of just got a small) and the addition of the legendary caramelized crust takes the pizza into a unseen stratosphere. Their beer (at $6 a glass) is even at a decent price. Overall the only pizza place I haven't ate at in Chicago is Lou malnati, but if it's anything like Pequod then lord help us all.

The lines to get into this place in the evenings are insaaaaane. That's probably the one reason why I felt like I had to get in here b/c I was too afraid I'd be missing out on the Chicago deep dish experience (having already been disappointed by Giordano's and Lou Malnati's). When I finally got my pan pizza (Sausage, Spinach, and Mushroom) admittedly it looked awesome and when my slice was served, the stretch on the cheese could've gone across the room, but wow the pizza was...bland! The sauce wasn't intensely flavored and they were pretty stingy on the sausage. Not only that the pizza pie dough itself wasn't very flavorful; didn't have that yeasty quality you'd expect. They advertise the caramelization on the side of the pizza, which they delivered on, but ultimately that flavor didn't penetrate into the rest of the dough, which left for a less than amazing experience. For better deep dish pizza...Art of Pizza.

I am visiting Chicago and many of my friends suggested either Pequods or Lou Malnatis and Pequods is definitely better . The pizza overall is saucier, crispier and has more flavor compared to Lous which taste just like bread with cheese . Pequods is also very friendly with the toppings. It had a little more bread than expected but overall great deep dish experience .

So everyone always says if you are ever in Chicago try a Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. On recommendations from a few friends people suggested to try out Pequod's Pizzeria. We hopped into a cab and came straight from our hotel which wasn't that far actually.  While arriving here for dinner they told us it would take about 45 minutes and our name was on the list. So while waiting we just hanged outside since the place inside is literally super packed with all sorts of people.  I was thinking of just getting a personal to share with me and my friend but on recommendations from the server she said we should get the 10 inch small size. The personal is a 7 inch pizza. Guess what we didn't even finish our pizza which always happens because one we don't eat a gang load and it was a total waste.  I think personally when you tell a waitress that you aren't really hungry and want to just try something a personal would be fine. Especially since the crust is so thick and huge. It is like your eating a big piece of wet tomato bread. Hey I might be getting hated on for this but seriously I wasn't at all impressed, maybe it's because I like things on a smaller scale and that I feel a lot better if I do finish things!

The best pizza in Chicago. I love their deep dish as well as their regular (thinnish) pizza. It has a loud, casual bar atmosphere which I happen to like.  However, the restaurant should invest in a better take out operation. Anytime I order pizza for pick up the restaurant is so packed it is a hassle just to get to the pick up area. Then I have to ask the other 20 people crowded around the area if they have already paid/checked in with the staff because there is absolutely no organization. While I'm waiting for the pizza to come out I'm constantly bumped into by people who are trying to get to the bar, leaving with their carryout pizza, checking in with the host, ect.

I've had Chicago Deep Dish Pizza before.  My friend, a Chicago transplant for 10 years, stated this was a secret favorite of the neighborhood.  It is a bit crowded and loud, but that's a good thing, that means the food is good. We were told that it would be a 40-50 minute wait.  We ended up waiting less than 20 minutes.  The pizza takes a while, 40-50 minutes and it actually did take that long.  Bring conversation with you. We ended up getting the Large deep dish with: wait for it... Sausage + Spinach + Garlic!!! It was delicious.  OVERALL IMPRESSION: I'd say the pizza is about par compared to other deep dishes I've had. But, it's surely better than the average pizza. I would go back.

Largely considered the best deep dish in Chicago and they deliver on that thought. If you are ordering delivery give yourself plenty of time. Delivery times are around 90 minutes no matter when you order.

Amazing food!! We got the garlic bread and two small pan pizzas - one meat and one veggie. The sausage was to die for!! Rebecca served us and was really funny and helpful. She gave us great recommendations for our stay. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town :)

Great pizza! Great lunch special! Sadly, there was a pretty loud argument happening between a manager and a bartender that went on for 15 minutes. It was awkward and very unprofessional. I love this pizza, but if this is what happens there, I will reconsider my pizza choice next time.
They now deliver all the way out to me in Logan Square!  Took awhile to get here, but it was worth it.

I'm not a fan of deep dish or red sauce but this place is fantastic. Crust is totally unique - crispy and flavorful outside but perfect soft dough inside. Delicious home made pizza sauce seasoned to perfection with excellent consistency. Peppers were full strips of vegtable and we had half Italian beef and half meatball- flavorful! Can't wait to come back - friendly/welcoming staff and clean establishment.
Very delicious! Call ahead to be placed on the top of the waitlist when you arrive. Takes a while for the food to come out but won't be disappointed! Very good!

My favorite deep dish in Chicago - largely due to the crust.  There are other places closer, but when I have a craving for deep dish this beats all others.  The restaurant itself can be a little crowded, but the service is good and it's a good place to watch a game or eat before a movie.   One note is that delivery takes a while (I believe because the pies take longer than most places), but the food comes hot.

you can't go to chicago and not get DEEP DISH PIZZA! so on my short 3 day trip, my friends helped me decide that Pequod's would be the SOLE deep dish i tried in chicago THE CRUST, lighter and more crumbly than i've ever had & with a blackened cheese layer on the top of the side, it was a good balance --sausage deep dish: the sausage had a lot of anise but I loved how saucy this pizza was --mushroom with fresh basil & tomatoes: not a fan of the sliced tomatoes but mushrooms never fail LOVE that you can get personal pan sizes! i was pretty much full after 3/4th's of this pie it's in a divey sports bar type atmosphere but don't underestimate

Called in advance for a priority seating on a friday night and literally waited 15 min tops. That said, our server Emily was extremely attentive and friendly. As for the pizza...hands down the BEST DEEP DISH pizza when compared to all the chains and hole in the walls I have been to in and around the Chicago area. Take my word for it,  if you're into cheesy, saucy, meaty or veggie goodness please take the time and visit this authentic Chicago gem. =)

Good deep dish but inconsistent. Came here once and it was incredible and balanced. Came again and it was mostly bread. Have had the same happen in the 4-5 times I've been or gotten delivery. If they were more consistent, might be one of the best in Chicago.
Burnt Butter Crust Pizza. the GOOD kind. all you need to know.

let's talk about the most over-hyped pizza place, shall we? They get props for the bruschetta, which was quite simple but tasty. They got props that we were immediately. Props stop here. Ambiance is typical for a Chicago neighborhood establishment..no big deal.  What's the big deal about their "caramelized crust?" The pizza is a mediocre interpretation of what Chicago style pan pizza should be.  The service was lackluster at best..nobody seemed to care..if I can describe the service as food, it tasted like peqoud's pizza..see what I did there? Overall the best way to describe this place is hype..it has nothing else.
So delicious! Their lunch special is every college student's dream.

If you are looking for that old school "pizza hut" pan pizza experience, look no further!  I kept it pretty simple and ordered the personal pepperoni pan pizza and it was pretty damn good! When it comes to pizza I am all about the crust and Pequod's crust was delicious!  It was crunchy and golden/slightly burnt which is exactly how I like it!  We also ordered fries, which were just fries, but the pizza will have me coming back. Only downside...the first time we tried to go, we made the mistake of hitting this spot up on a Friday night and the wait was 2 PLUS hours! No way, not happening, so we left.  On my second attempt we went mid-week at around 5:00 and that was much better, no wait.

I've always liked Pequod's. Great pan pizza that isn't super greasy, which is hard to find in the city. Ive been a customer for the last 8 years or so and had minimal issues. Lately it has gotten worse. The delivery has been late quite a bit lately and today I got a mess of a pizza. It was smashed to one side with a lot of sauce on half the pizza and very little on the other side. I really hope these have just been a couple off nights and not a sign of the way things are.
This is great deep dish.  Pasta meat balls were average.  But for Chicago pizza this place is on the short list.  Our medium had a burnt bottom and they gladly replaced it.  We will be back!

This is the only place I get deep dish pizza from! However, the staff is not very attentive with very slow service even when placing a take out order. Aside from that, the food is great and there's always a line out the door!

I think this might have been the most overrated place I visited in Chicago I waited and hour and a half for a pizza that was burnt on the bottom and under-cooked in the middle. Also to make matters worse our server was petty much ignored us. She didn't refill our water or our drinks.  If you are going to have sub-par food and least have good services.

I originally had given my veggie-style pizza a two out of five stars. The breading was dry. Slightly bland. Had to put a lot of cheese and pepper. Couldn't finish it because my taste buds were so bored. The service and environment were great though; hence, three stars.

This place is famous for its pan pizza.  The caramelized layer of cheese for crust is what makes the pizza here special.  That being said, we had to check this place out!   Upon walking in, I noticed that this place looked more like a bar, rather than a restaurant.  We were seated in a small booth meant for two.  The atmosphere was loud, but that was expected given the bar environment.  The appetizers and the pasta all looked so good.  But we knew we would not be able to finish them all, and still have room to try the amazing pizza!  So, the GF and I just decided we would just order the small pepperoni and mushroom pan pizza.  After waiting about fifteen minutes our pizza made its way to our table.  I was surprised with the short wait after because we had dined at Lou Malnati's the prior day.  Our server there  told us the pizza would take 45 minutes to cook.  I thought he was joking at first, but he was not kidding.  The pizza was downright delicious.  It was hands down the best deep dish I have ever had in my life.  There was nothing negative that could be said about the pizza.  It was not overly saucy, and they did not cheap out on the toppings.  I loved that the bottom of the pizza was crispy, and not soggy.  I had to use a knife and cut the bottom because it was just that crisp.  The crust was the best part.  It was still so hot, despite eating the crust last.  The cheese was heavenly, for lack of a better word.     I love that this place opens until 2am.  The service was good, and the pizza was amazing.  I would recommend, and will definitely be back.

I tried Lou Malnati's and was so disappointed. So I wanted to give deep dish another try. After talking to a bunch of locals while in Chicago, I decided to go to pequod's. I made a reservation in advance, but I don't think you need to as there was a lot of seats of available. It took 1.5 hours for them to prepare a small cheese deep dish. With each minute, the anticipation to try chicago's best deep dish only grew more and more. Unfortunately, I was not satisfied. I didn't not like the crust nor did I like all the sauce.
hands down- the best deep dish in town!

The only thing that makes this pizza good is the carmelized edge.  Other than that it's like eating a big doughy cake disguised with cheese and red sauce.   They did put up with us tourists changing our reservation multiple times, so extra points for their patience.

I love my thin crust pizza, but when in Chicago... I had a personal deep dish pizza and it arrived in front of me, piping hot, fresh out of the oven. First bite... "Damn... that's good." This was the first time I've ever REALLY enjoyed a deep dish pizza. I loved the burnt cheese on the edges, too! We sat at the bar and the bartender was really pleasant and quick with our drinks, so I appreciated that. Will be back!

Pequod's may have the best pizza that I have ever had! I was a visitor to Chicago and liked the reviews that I had read about this restaurant. My wife and I arrived and we're seated fairly soon because we called ahead for priority seating. We ordered a medium deep dish pepperoni pizza and I thought it was phenomenal.

I wish I could give this place a 3.5, but I'd rather give it a 4 than a 3. There are many pros and cons. Pros: This place was HUGE. I was surprised to see that they're able to seat so many people. There is an entire section upstairs. It actually two separate sections. The service was good after we got seated. The pizza was decent but did not blow my mind. They tell you how long it will take to cook appetizers and the pizza which is excellent and much appreciated. Good french fries. Great prices on pizza! The crust was nice and fluffy! Even when I ate it cold the next day after I had it in my purse for 5 hours (don't judge me), it tasted great. Cons: There are kind of a lot.  They told us 30 minutes to get seated (long), BUT the time was accurate and they actually sat us in 30 minutes. We ordered drinks and they came out quickly, but the drinks were pricey. I paid $5.95 for a pint, and those were the prices for almost all of their beers. We ordered half an order of fries and bruschetta. The fries were really tasty but I wish I had a bottle of ketchup rather than packets. The bruschetta was not good. It was bland and the bread had this weird orange color to it. I ordered a pan sized personal pizza and the size was perfect for me and I had half the pizza leftover. I ordered pepperoni with basil. My pizza was burned AND I really hate it when the basil is cooked with the pizza. Fresh basil should not be cooked in my opinion. The delicious taste of it goes away. It didn't taste fresh by any means :( Overall, someone said we had to try it so we did. I'm not upset about it, I don't regret it, I may go back, but it didn't blow my mind.
Good, fast service, except the pizza was not as good. Extra greasy. The crust and cheese were tasteless, but the pepperoni was alright. Two slices of good pizza are worth $10, but not this pizza

This is deep dish, not stuffed, so keep in mind you'll be getting more bread and less cheese. I went ahead and ordered mine with extra cheese and sauce. While I have a go-to for deep dish, it's not something I typically seek out. Pequods just changed that. They really nailed it. While it's not quite as good reheated, I found myself eating some before bed -and I never do that. The restaurant itself is small and seems more like a bar. The service is a bit slow and forced me to swig off my flask, which no one noticed, for ten minutes before someone got around to us. They have Three Floyds on draft, on rotation, which I immediately ordered hoping for that zombie dust. No such luck but the Scottish ale was decent and complemented my rum very well, which I continued to drink at the table. I was pretty hammered by the time the pizza arrived, but I can assure you it's the  best in its class. Their signature carmelized crust lives up to the hype. I could've eaten a plate of that and been happy, and next time, I just might. Good job Pequod.

Delicious Chicago pizza, tied for my favorite Deep Dish. The caramelized crust is heavenly. Sometimes there's a horrendous wait on weekends so come early. The buffalo wings are yummy too. And Pequod's delivers!

Pequod's was some of the best deep dish pizza i've ever had - they load on toppings. We got mozzarella sticks and cheesy bread as an app (both average) and then a few deep dish pizzas. We got a veggie pizza and a pepperoni pizza - both were so good I could have killed myself by eating too much. Thankfully I finally stopped but I definitely want to go again!

Pizza is fantastic and can't be beat. But...when a regular customer calls and orders for pickup, don't tell them it'll be 40 minutes if it's really going to be an hour and a half. And when you screw up, at least offer your "valued customer" a beer while they wait or % off their order...that's just good business. Very disappointing

This place is so over rated.  Went there with my husband one night since hearing all the hype about how great their pizza is.  We went on a weekend so it was busy.  The place is much bigger than it looks.  We were seated upstairs.  Very dirty and grimey restaurant.  Bathrooms were even more disgusting.  We got their "famous" deep dish and although the carmelized cheese is delicious, the dough was thick and soggy and not that great.  Personally, I prefer Lou Malnati's deep dish or even JET'S crispy corner pizza over Pequods.

Let's start with the good stuff, and most important part of the review. The pizza - always delicious, so tasty, and the crust is unbeatable. For the occasional craving for deep dish, this is a definitely a favorite. Be warned you'll be salivating and impatiently waiting while your pizza is cooked to perfection. Minus one star for service - Placing your order for pizza doesn't necessarily ensure they actually place the order. We ended up waiting for about an hour for a pie, half an hour of which could have been avoided if they had started baking when we placed the order. Also, our server never asked if we wanted appetizers, drinks, etc, or came by our table during our wait. Very disorganized in that sense. I understand it's a busy place but not checking on a table for almost an hour is no bueno. That being said, the staff was friendly.

Was visiting Chicago for the first time and of course needed to try some deep dish pizza. We got a recommendation from a local friend to check out Pequod's and it was definitely a great choice! We came in for lunch and the staff was really friendly and the service was quick. The pizza was, well, life changing. I'll be returning next time I come to Chicago!

Love the pan pizza! They sprinkle cheese in the crust before they bake it so it caramelizes into crunchy goodness. The lines are long but worth the wait. Be forewarned...this is deep dish pizza so it takes 45 minutes to bake but you can't rush perfection!

If you're ever craving some pizza-topped bread, this is the place to go! I mean that in the best way possible though, because man on man, that crust! Like other reviewers have said, this deep dish is a THICK layer of crust topped with some sauce, gooey cheese, and your choice of toppings. The texture is really great, though I think either the crust or sauce could have done with a bit more flavor.  This is my second favorite deep dish in Chicago so far, and next time I'm down for some carb overload, I'll return!

Had a 9 hour layover in Chicago on my way to LA. Figured it would be inappropriate for me to spend a few hours in Chicago without having a deep dish pizza. After asking the locals, it seemed like this establishment had the best deep dish pizza in town... And it seems like they were right - it's hard to believe there's a better deep dish pizza. The crust was caramelized and incredibly delicious. The cheese... it was orgasmic... no better way to describe it. Each toppings (we got pepperoni, sausage and basil) were so flavourful, you can taste each one with every bite! The servers were very hospitable and friendly. Highly recommend this place!

Came here for Chicago style pizza after searching on Yelp. The restaurant had great atmosphere with locals supporting the Cubs in a playoff game. We ordered bbq buffalo wings, French fries, and deep dish pizza (tomato, garlic, sausage, extra cheese). While the first two items were very good, the pizza was not. The crust was flaky, devoid of taste, and just too much of it. Nothing else on the pizza stood out. The service was excellent, which is why three stars instead of two. Happily (for the crowd) the Cubs won that night...

The best Chicago style pizza, period! We were in Chicago for 4 days and came here 3 times. Pizza's are big, delicious and made to order. (it could take up to 50 minutes!) The service is really great and waiters are nice and attending. They are open till late (2 am) and they welcomed us on our arrival night at around 1:45 am  You should definitely give them a try and you won't regret.
The caramelized cheese crust is awesome but has high variance in delivery quality.  Sometimes crust can be soggy other times it is great.

OMG.... Go late so you don't have to deal with as crazy of a wait. We stopped in around 11PM; and still had to wait. When the place was pretty empty. *scratches head* that didn't make sense... and the hostess had all sorts of weird excuses about why we had to wait. Anyway... we got the bbq chicken wings with ranch and an order of their to die for pizza. Absolutely. Amazeballs. Usually with deep dish pizza, the first slice has the perfect balance of crunchy outside crust, with fluffy insides, balanced with tomato sauce and toppings and gooey cheese. Second slice is usually soggy and not so fantastic. Pequods still kept its texture and crunch when I tackled the second slice! That is something that's never happened before....  This whole in the wall looking restaurant that's not located in downtown Chicago had the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Definite must for any trip to Chicago!

kind of bummed about this review. I've heard awesome things about this place and so when I had a party at my house, we ordered Pequods. The delivery took 2.5 hours. We called the place an hour in and asked for an update. They couldn't find the order. They told us they were making it now and it would be the next order out. an hour and a half later, the pizza came and as you can probably imagine, it was cold. We ended up throwing the pizza away and ordering Jets. This place has awesome reviews, but for us it was not great.
Love this place and keep coming back. Consistant everytime, only issue is everyone knows how good the pizza is here. Sometimes the wait time is long, but we'll worth it.

Hipster atmosphere. Crowded most times we go. Decent crafts beers. Great deep dish pizza with primo ingredients. Could argue that this is the best pizza joint in Chicago.  Expect about a 45-60 minute wait once you order your pizza. I usually get a deep dish [pan pizza] w/ extra cheese, sausage and pepperoni. The ingredients are huge too. Not those little sausage balls at Pizza Hut. I don't order extra cheese at any other pizza spot but here i think it's necessary. Just don't think it's enough cheese on their pan pizzas. Pizzas come out great every time. The only downside is that once you wait an hour for your pizza by the time it gets there is still too hot to eat so you end up waiting longer to eat it.  Fml. But with great conversation and a few drinks you'll be eating in no time.  Really enjoy this spot. Would recommend a few more beer selections but that's just being picky. Definitely  a must go to  spot in Chicago. Almost forgot to mention the cheese melted to edge of the cast iron cooking pan. Cheese gradually goes from cheesy to burnt. Sounds weird but it give the crust a nice carmelized taste. Loves it!!!

I was only in Chicago for a day and wanted the best pizza in the whole city and I got what I wanted.  They caramelize their crust and I read that they're the only people to do so. The pizza looks like it would be super heavy but surprisingly it was not. The sauce has really good flavor and the personal was definitely a good size to share if you want to continue eating at multiple places for the rest of the day. The cost of the pizza was really cheap too. The sausage was bigger than what I'm used to, they appear to be more like meatballs instead.  Atmosphere was solid, they played good music but that's just my opinion.

I thought Pequod's was OKAY, it wasn't as good as it was hyped up to be in my opinion! The pizza was more burnt than expected on the edges and the sausage just wasn't all that special! There was way too much crust compared to how many "pieces" of sausage that was actually on the pizza. I liked Lou M's much more!

Pequod's is a great place and you're guaranteed a different experience depending on what day/time you go. I love when they seat us upstairs because it is a little more quiet especially on a busy night or during a sports game.  We love going there before/after seeing a movie at the theater across the street. We've had times that we've gone when the wait was an hour and there's also been times where we walk right in. If it's about a 25-30 minute wait it's no problem to sit at the bar and grab a drink, Their pizza is AMAZING. It's the perfect mix of sauce and cheese and the crust is delicious. The thin crust is amazing but if you have time the deep dish is worth the wait.  Their appetizers such as the garlic bread are pretty basic but still delicious.

I'm not a deep dish connoisseur. Living on the West Coast my entire life probably precludes me from making a judgment on deep dish pizza. But this establishment is a lot of fun. And the pizza is very tasty.

Not a fan.  The crust is weird and it's not quite Chicago, not quite thin crust, just not quite anything to me.  My husband enjoyed it, but he's a simple man.  Appreciate their love for the Blackhawks but this pizza is for a specific customer... not for the masses.

I have an open stomach that does not discriminate... but my first Chicago deep dish greatly disappoints. It was 1.5inch breading and a thin layer of cheese. The sausage one wasn't too bad since it did taste like an italian sausage pizza but the amount of carb to meat ratio was so very off. I have to agree with the other reviewers: the crusty crust that is slightly burnt makes the pizza. It was the most enjoyable part of the deep dish... which isn't saying much. I'm sure this restaurant makes other delicious items but on the deep dish alone I will not be enjoying that again until a later time. The restaurant itself looks hipster on the outside, backwater country bar on the inside. Dim lighting, tvs around. It is a bit of wait to get the pizza as well, ours was 30minutes. TLDR: NY style pizza is still the best pizza.
Best Pizza spot in Chicago hands down! Crispy crust, melty cheese, robust sauce, premium toppings. Been coming here for years and will continue to do so!

Did Pequods recently change their recipe because my pizza was not good recently. Ordered three pizzas last night in which we waited almost 2 hours to get deliverered. Then when it came it looked so sloppily put together. Almost ALL bread, very very little cheese, tons of not so good sauce, and burnt crust. Sad sad disappointment Pequods. You used to be one of my favorites.

Of all the well known deep dish pizza spots in Chicago, Pequod's was recommended the most by my friends, and definitely looked the best on all the social media pictures I salivated through.  The ambiance was super chill. More like a bar with pizza than simply a pizzeria. Service was quick and efficient despite the fact that it was quite busy. We were four total, and ordered two deep dishes, one with pepperoni and one with peppers, onion, mushroom, and sausage. They looked AMAZING!!! Caramelized crust, generous portions of toppings, and tons of cheese. I was so friggin' excited! Especially since it was my first authentic Chicago deep dish experience. I had been waiting for that moment for 24 years, no joke. When I picked up the spatula to serve myself a "slice" the cheese was oh so gooey and perfectly stringy. I felt like I was in a commercial. Finally, the moment of truth arrives. I took a bite of the picture perfect pizza, annnnnnnd I was incredibly underwhelmed. It had absolutely no flavor. The cheese lacked salt, the sauce lacked tang (not robust at all), and the crust was crunchy but there was no flavor to the dough. UGH! I was so incredibly disappointed. Everything else was perfect EXCEPT the flavor. Adding salt salvaged the pizza, but the painful memory of the first bite will always remain.  I loved everything else about this place and the pizza but the actual flavor of it. Or as far as I'm concerned, lack there of.

For my money, this is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. The sauce and caramelized crust set it apart from the stiff competition in town. Also, definitely get the sausage! As good as the pizza is, it is a bit bready compared to other options around town. I'm totally fine with that, but if that's not your thing, take note. Also, their salads and appetizers are not at the same level as Lou Malnati's and Giordanos. But I like the pizza better - it just barely beats Lou's in my book - which is why you come here anyways. Pro tip - THE LUNCH SPECIAL.

This was my first taste of Chicago deep dish and is so far my favorite one. Can't beat that caramelized crust! Pizza is great and super filling (go small- two of us ate one small pie and we each had leftovers).

His place has the best pizza in Chicago hands down. What makes this place different is the way they make pizza. The sauce is amazing and full of favor. They caramelize cheese on the crust which captures the flavors amazingly. I have ate pizza from several locations and I have yet to find something as good as this location.  Some advice: 1. If you are coming on Friday or Saturday night, you will have to wait up to an hour to get in. This may seem like a long time, but there is a reason people wait. You can call ahead and have priority seating, which can shorten your wait.  2. My personal opinion, the more ingredients you place on the pizza the soggier it will get. Less in this case is more.  3. If there are any major Chicago sporting events, it will be packed.  4. Parking is rough at times. Drive on the street behind, there are more chances of finding parking there.

As far as deep dish pizza goes, this place was pretty good. There were a lot of options to choose from on the menu and the ingredients they used tasted very fresh. What really stood out was the crust. I'm not sure how they do it, but it tasted caramelized (i think that's the word for it). It was a nice change from the Lou Malnati's and Giardonos of the world.  The wait does get a bit long, but you have to expect that from a place that takes 50 minutes to cook a single pizza. And the service was alright as well.  Overall this place was just okay. I'd probably go back, but I am by no means rushing to get there.

Pequod's is hands down my favorite pizza place in Chicago. The thin and pan pizzas are both excellent but the pan caramelized crust is the shining gem amongst all deep dish out there. My NY boyfriend is very picky with his pizza (and not usually a fan of deep dish) but we equally love it and always bring our visitors here.  The wait (both to sit and for your pizza) can add up during peak hours so it's better to come before 6. Regardless it is worth the wait. If you haven't tried it yet, do yourself the favor!

Not many places in my opinion should get 5-stars but this place is a staple of mine. Now that I do not live in Chicago ALL deep dish pizza I try are automatically compared to my Pequad's Pizzeria.  My go to Pizza toppings include ground beef and spinach or simply a cheese!  Top that off with your favorite drink and get ready to dive in. Be prepared to wait if you are trying to go on a Friday or Saturday night as this place has set a reputation for some of the best pizza in all Chicago.  More good can be said but "if you don't know, now you know" - B.I.G
Awesome nom noms. The pies were delicious. Recommend calling them ahead of time if you want to pick up. Otherwise it's a 45 minute wait in perfection.

I was in town for the weekend and wanted to take my family and girlfriend here for their 1st time. We arrived early in the evening and were told that there would be a 45 min-1 hour wait. We were staying downtown and it was a bit of a trek to get out there, so we were willing to wait. We went next door for a drinks.  After waiting our hour we decided to check in, expecting to be told we would be seated shortly, and were told that it would be another hour b/c people were watching the Blackhawks. I'm a Blackhawks fan, but this was still the preseason! If they are truly one of the top pizza destinations in the city, do they really want their clientele to treat the place like a sports bar for a pre-season hockey game?

Top three pizzas in Chicago!  Period.  Always crowded whenever I go so expect waiting time but well worth the wait!  They're known for their crust.  Thin, slightly burnt, crispy!  Yum.  And I'm not a crust person at all.

I first saw Pequods on Chicago's Best and the pizza look absolutely delicious both deep dish  and  thin crust that had to be for the cameras,  I decided to order a thin crust with sausage.  I was totally disappointed .I didn't mind the delivery guy being a little late due to traffic  that's Chicago and I didn't mind the price because I pay for what I want the pizza itself was absolutely TERRIBLE,  bland tasting,  one piece of  sausage on every other slice and I purchased a large pizza,  sorry to say I will not be purchasing any more pizzas from Pequods.they lost a customer in me.

Nice little spot to drop by after a drink filled night in Wicker Park. Stopped by to grub on some deep dish when we found out they close at 2 AM. I was pleasantly surprised that it resembled more of a dive bar than a pizzeria. Being on vacation in Chicago and being that it was my last night, I had to have me some Deep Dish Deliciousness. Unknown to me, they served pizza by the slices, which was to come out a lot faster if you didn't want to wait for a deep dish. Did my inebriated self want to wait an hour for a deep dish? Sadly, my impatience got the better of me. I went with a simple slice of pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza while my girlfriend wanted a white pesto pizza. The server told us my order wouldn't be a problem to make for a slice but we'll have to order a a full pizza for my gf's order. Not a problem...if my slice didn't take as long as her mini white pesto deep dish to come out. What was probably 35 minutes, my slice finally came out.  Perfect size for my hungry drunk ass and loaded with toppings. It was better than I expected. My only gripe? The sauge, or shall we call them meat balls, were a little too big and over powering, making the pepperoni and mushroom irrelevant. Luckily, them balls were packed with flavor. Just wish they were smaller in size so I can taste the other toppings. Not before I was 1/4 through my pizza, my gf's pizza came out. If I knew my slice would take almost as long as my gf's order I would've just went with a classic deep dish.  We rarely got checked on and had to wave down the servers a couple times to get water refills. Besides that, the servers were very friendly. If we ever stop by Chicago again, I'd definitely like to try what people are saying is the best deep dish in Chicago.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!   I ordered a pizza for my family at 6:30PM. I was told it would take an hour and 20 minutes.  After an hour and 30 minutes, I called to ask the status of our order. At that point, I was informed that it'd be another 30-45 minutes because my order wasn't placed until 6:50PM.  I questioned the delay (I called at 6:30PM and certainly did not have a 20 minute call). At that point the manager got on the line to tell me they had a computer glitch, my order wasn't entered until 6:50PM, and I would have to wait an additional 30-45 minutes.  I asked to have my order cancelled (my family was hungry and I would order elsewhere).  At that point, the manager complained that I was in the wrong and hung up on me!!!! We WERE regulars at this place. NEVER AGAIN!!!
Literally the best deep dish on earth. Make sure you make reservation! Or else you'll be in line for 2 hours!!!

Amazing Deep dish!! Worth the cab ride from the loop. We went for the lunch special so the pizzas were under $6 with a topping. You really can't beat it. Plus we got the fried appetizer sampler, which was on point. I've also been to Due. Different styles both good.

Pizza was good but we waited over an hour and :45 to eat. Not worth that kind of wait. Service was ok at best. Kitchen was SLOW and the management non-existent. Place was filthy dirty too. Maybe I'd consider take-out but will never again dine in. Gross restaurant with a filthy trash can in the open and near the kitchen/ restroom. Management needs a new team.
Best deep dish in Chicago! The ingredients are super fresh! The waiters are hottttt. The cheesy crust is bomb. Go there.

Food: 3 out of 5 Price: $$ out of $$$$ Service: -5 out of 5 I don't generally leave reviews unless I had exceptional or terrible experience. In this case, it was probably one of the worse service I have encountered at a restaurant... ever. We (7 of us) arrived at the restaurant on time for 6pm reservation. We were promptly seated 15 minutes later. We knew this was a very popular restaurant during dinner time so we expected reasonable wait (45min~) for our pizza to be ready. Knowing this, we ordered some wings, meatball sandwich (no cheese), large pizza pie and pitcher of beer. Beer and wings arrived shortly. Wings and beer were fine until my friend discovered a fly in his beer halfway thru his drink. We didn't make a big deal out of it thinking it's an innocent mistake. We told our waitress about it and she brought my friend a new glass of beer. So far so good... kinda. 1.5 hours later, we are still waiting. Still no pizza, no meatball sandwich, no explanation by our waitress for the delay. We asked our waitress how much longer, and she says 5 more minutes. 25 minutes later, nothing (almost 2 hours of wait so far). We asked our waitress again, and she says 5 more minutes. Pizza finally arrives and we remind our waitress we are still waiting for meatball sandwich without cheese (one of our friend can't eat dairy). She said sandwich should be coming soon. We finish our pizza 20 minutes later and still no meatball sandwich. We ask our waitress about it, she said 5 more minutes (it's been almost 2.5 hours for meatball sandwich so far). 15 minutes more pass and finally meatball sandwich arrives but WITH cheese (it's been 2 hours and 45 minutes for a wrong sandwich). At this point we are fairly irritated because we waited 2 hours for a pizza and 2.75 hours for a meatball sandwich that my friend can't eat. At this point we decide to complain to the manager, Shawn. We explained our situation and he acted like "oh well". At no point did he apologize (for either wait or wrong order) or offer to fix the situation. He kept on saying "wish there was something we can do" without real resolution suggested. At this point, most restaurants with good customer service would have offered something for the terrible experience but nope, not Shawn. He just waited for us to leave. We did get a small discount for the meal (which wasn't what we were after) in the end but we left feeling petty and like shit. All we wanted was an apology and if we had received it, I wouldn't have written this review. I guess with plenty of customers other than us, they don't need to make things right even when they mess up.

Really great. My first Chicago pizza, and it did not disappoint. Service is a bit slow, but I hear that's typical of the Midwest, and totally understandable for a deep dish. I'd go back again and recommend it to anyone who visits.
THE CRUST. Tourists should avoid Giordano's and have the best deep dish pizza at Pequod's.

So on my road trip to Notre Dame I had to sample Chicago Deep Dish pizza. I have tried several and if I rate those a four I have to rate this place a 5!!!!  Secret to going to these top pizza places is to go on off times and early. This place luckily takes reservations but it is small inside and a tavern feel vs other places that are true restaurants. We sampled the thin crust (which in my mind is still thicker than most pizza) and the traditional Deep Dish. If I were to come back again and I will it is deep dish hands down. The crust and sauce are melting with flavors all around. This place is truly amazing. Again small place, tavern feel but of course kids are allowed.  Also if you are stopping by before a Cubs game and score parking Uber or Lyft to game.

Both the wait to be seated and the wait for the pizza are long, yet their deep dish pizza was exceptionally good.  Our order seemed to have been skipped in the kitchen so our waiter spoke to the manager and she gave us half off our pizzas. Great alternative to the popular chain deep dish restaurants you see in Chicago.

There are a lot of great pizza places but I believe Pequod's Pizza stands above all others. Although the bottom of the pizza seemed little undercooked, its golden-brown crust was incredibly delicious. I can definitely eat Pequod's crust as a meal. It is true that if you want to have quote few number of toppings, it can get quite expensive. However, it is worth it. Go ahead and order a large pizza for you and your date, enjoy the best-pizza-in-Chicago, and take the leftovers home! Even the leftovers taste great (make sure to use an convection oven).

You go to pequods for the caramelized crust edges which are Chicago pizza magic. You want them hot and crispy. This means eating in is better than delivery. And personal size pizzas maximize the crust to center ratio.

New Yorkers tend to be snobby about pizza in Chicago. We think we have the best pizza, they think they have the best pizza, it's a rivalry through the ages. As a New Yorker used to thinner style pizza, the "deep dish" here was perfect. I've had deep dish elsewhere and it was too crispy (Looking at you Pizanos!) The pizza here is soft and made with amazing ingredients. It's easy to cut and a pleasure to eat. As everyone else said, the caramelized mozzarella on the crust makes the whole slide good to the last bit!  I've been raving about this place for a year and was so happy to be back. This is a MUST when in Chicago! I would come back here tomorrow if I could =/

Had my brother in from out of town and wanted the deep dish experience so we went to Pequod's on a recommendation. We ordered sodas, a light appetizer and a deep dish pizza. We were told the pizza would take 40-50 minutes. 1 hour 15 minutes goes by and the waitress comes to our table to inform us that the kitchen never received our ticket (even though we received the appetizer an hour earlier) and said the kitchen will rush it but it would be at least another 20 minutes, and is that ok? No we said we could not wait and cancel the order. She said she would get the manager, who never did come to our table, and she returned with the check that had the pizza taken off but still charged us for the sodas and appetizer. Ridiculous. We will not be returning.

Hands down- my favorite Chicago style pizza. The sauce, burnt cheese, it is everything. Takes a while to make but it's so worth it. Great atmosphere.  Nice area of the city.  I take all my friends here.

Let's put it out there, I LOVE PIZZA!!! OK, now that I got that taken care of, here's my humble review. I've always thought that food reviews are kind of a waste, since food is so subjective. Kinda like choosing a favorite color. If you like green, who am I to argue??? I really wanted to like Peaquod's pizza, but it wasn't in the cards. I placed a phone order for delivery, and almost 2 hours later, I get a phone call from the driver. He had the wrong address. Luckily it was only one digit off, so he was across the street. I brought the pizza (thin crust pepperoni) inside and opened the box. The pizza was barely warm, but the amount of pepperoni was very generous (the only reason I didn't rate a single star). Since it was in the drivers car so long, the crust was soggy. Maybe they're better (crispy crust?) if you order and eat in the restaurant....  After several bites, my disappointment began to ferment. It was extremely bland, totally lacking flavor. (No, my taste buds weren't on vacation). I'm used to pizzas with some seasoning, this was just crust, cheese, sauce and crust. No flavoring at all. I'm still going to to try their deep dish, the caramelized cheese looks enticing. But the combination of a long wait time and no payoff has me deeply disappointed.   I'll update after my next pizza, hopefully it will redeem Peaquod's. If not, Chicago is full of quality pizza joints, my money will be spent elsewhere.   Peace....

100% The best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Be prepared for a 2 hour + wait on a Friday or Saturday night though. I bring all of my guests here who want a Chicago Pizza experience. You can drink at the Drinkingbird next door while you wait.

Definitely one of my favorite deep dish places in Chicago. Is it the best? I don't know, I wouldn't say that. But the crust is probably one of my favorites of all time. A delicate airy caramelized crust. Ughhhhhh so good, need it in my life now. If only the wait wasn't two hours every time I've gone. I myself would like it if they had some more toppings but hey, I get it. They focus on the crust and keep it simple. You do you gurl. Just do something about that wait time. It kills me everytime.

An hour and half wait then 40 min wait for pizza? Normally, I would say hell to the no.  But in this rare, rare occasion, the wait was worth it!! And I never, ever say that!  This pizza is beyond amazing.  The crust is airy and not too dense and cheese, oh lord the cheese is incredible.  Again, totally worth it!!
Best Deep Dish Pizza I've ever had. The Crust is just out of this world. This is the Pizza I came to Chicago for.

The beef sandwich combo with sausage, cheese, peppers and garlic toast was awesome.  Deep dish was better than Giordanos and Lou Malnatis. Lou's butter crust is better but overall this place was top notch.

I went on a Saturday during a Cubs game so it wasn't packed at all and we were seated immediately. We ordered the garlic cheesy bread as an appetizer which has now become a requirement prior to the pizza. You have to order the pan pizza unless you'll be missing out. From the crispy crust to the caramelized halo of cheesy goodness!! Hands down the best pizza I've had in a while. I'm glad it's far away from my residence because if not, I'd seriously be in trouble.
We were told by my friend and tried their deep dish pizza. It was better than our expectation. Its price is reasonable. Would come back and try different thing

I'm always reluctant to leave five star reviews for my favorite restaurants because I'd still like to be able to get a table when I visit - but Pequod's is already a madhouse on most nights so I doubt one more glowing review is going to change much.  I love eating here - the atmosphere is old-school pizzeria and the food is amazing. I was on the Gino's East bandwagon for the first few years I lived in the city, but I always direct people to Pequod's now when they are looking for what I consider Chicago's best deep dish.  I wish I liked sports so I had more of a reason to stay in here longer than my meal warrants (and possibly order another meal eventually) but all the screens with hockey, football or whatever really doesn't distract from the meal.  They can accommodate very large groups - but make sure to give them a heads up.  Also we love the giardiniera as a pizza topping. Burnt cheese on the crust?! So good!!

Oh my Quod, buckle up for what may be the most ridiculous food experience I'll ever have. 7p - Called in a delivery order for a small deep dish and bruschetta. Told it'll take about 90 minutes. 8:45p - Called back to inquire and sat on hold for five minutes. Never a good sign. They say the pizza will be out the door in ten minutes and we're promised some kind of discount on the check (card was already charged). Aka the order was lost and they just put it in. We didn't expect it to actually be out the door in ten minutes, but nonetheless proceeded with that thought. 9:30p - Call #3. My apartment is about 3 miles/15 minute drive from Pequod's, so it should have been here about 9:10 if their previous timeline is to be believed. Turns out the driver had the wrong number and couldn't get ahold of us so they drove back. Gave them the number once again and waited, wondering if death was nigh. 10p - If the driver was headed right back out with our order, they should have been here by now. We get the same answer as before, which we're quick to shoot down since 10 minutes ago was 20 minutes ago. The entire charge has been voided, thankfully. 10:45p - Call #5 (!!!!!!!) At this point we kind of just want to go to bed, but know we need to eat. We're finally given the manager again. This is only the second time we've spoken to him, the first being a brief apology during call #2. He apologizes profusely but you can tell he's basically at a loss for words at this point (can't blame him). No idea what happened to our order but he's going to put another pizza in. He also takes down our information and we can get a free order in the future (don't think that'll get used). 11:30p - The driver finally arrives. For those keeping score at home, it took 4.5 hours to get our order. Of course, this happened when I had less than zero food in the house so we had to commit to waiting this out. Here's the worst part after all of this - it wasn't good at all. The pizza was predictably terrible since it probably went through the oven at a billion degrees to get it out. It's probably decent in normal form, but not better than the other deep dish places. Disappointing given all the rave reviews I've heard. Never, EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEVER (shout out to Chris Jericho) order the bruschetta. It was actually kind of hilarious. Uncooked bread slices that had been oiled and a salsa cup of what was basically pico de gallo. Chopped tomato and onion with no seasoning. Sad panda. Clearly Pequod's has earned many fans over the years, but maybe your best course would be to tread lightly.

Loved it! I think it's a tie between Pequod's and Giordano's for me. It's everything you'd expect if you're craving the usual deep dish pizza. Giordano's is more of a "fancy" deep dish in my opinion. While Pequod's focuses more on the crust, Giordano's is more about the toppings and cheese (which can be overwhelming and super rich). Both are great.  I liked the atmosphere on the 2nd floor. Seemed like a dive bar.  I'm surprised they don't have more locations in the downtown area!

Dear Pequod's,  You are the sand to my beach, the peanut butter to my jelly, the wind beneath my wings. No but for real. Today was a great experience of many at this wondrous pizzeria.  Although we waited almost thirty unbearable minutes to get seated, it was all worth it. Emily, our server, made us laugh! And not like, AT her. WITH HER. She was timely, well informed, and helpful. Our nervous, yet very cool busboy, James, was fantastic! It was his first day on the job, but he even remembered my boyfriend's request for blue cheese when I had forgotten.  The appetizers came at just the right time and temperature. Our beers were brought cold and filled to the brim. The pizza was perfect! Caramelized crust, melty cheesy goodness, filled with the right amount of pepperoni and spinach. Just the way I like it!  Pequod's is hands down the best place to bring a newbie for some Chicago style pizza. The atmosphere is great for every kind of person. Not too sporty, not too hipster, and not too yuppie. I recommend to all!

By far my favorite Pizzeria in Chicago. The ratio of all ingredients is just perfect and the crunch of the cheese and softness of the dough is amazing. I spent a week eating pizza on vacation here and this by far tops the list. They also played some Drake and Hey who doesn't love some Drake and pizza.

I'm still thinking about the pizza from here even though I'm back in LA! I'm really glad my cousin took me here to show me what some REAL Chicago deep dish is all about. And man was I not ready for this. Deep is an understatement. Knife and fork caliber pizza because that's the only way to handle it. And don't forget pitchers of beer to go along with it. This place had a great locals atmosphere and vibe and it's no mistake that they are a total Blackhawks establishment all the way. Loud and wild bar like feel but still good for the family. Be prepared to wait for a table at peak hours. But no worries you can put your name down and have a drink while you kill some time;)

Damn, do I love pizza! Pequods is so amazing! Get their pan, otherwise you're wasting your time. Everything is delish, I drool thinking about their pizza. There is usually a wait for delivery, but rest assured it's worth it! If you're dining in get some cheesy bread and wings (also great when delivered!). You don't come here for atmosphere, you come for 'za. But damn, is it good! Worth the wait!!

I've given up. Been going to Pequods for a bit over a decade. When they're at their best, they are the best. Unfortunately, that rarely happens anymore. Even when they are on top of their game, expect to devote about half of your night waiting for it.  Their service started to decline about 3-4 years ago. When I talk about Pequods with people now, a certain waitress always pops up. We call her "waitress no response". Here's one of my experiences with her (of many): Pizza arrives not correct, not the right toppings and hard as a brick from overcooking. She comes back to check on us and I explain how the pizza is inedible. She looks blankly at us, does a 180, and walks away. We had to track down the manager ourselves, who says the server is just too busy to deal with it (seriously!). Doesn't offer any sympathy, let alone comping, and gets annoyed when we ask for a new pizza. This was about 2 years ago and the quality of service has not improved. I gave them a chance (have still gone probably once a month on average since), but I have to move on. I have way more positive things to say about this place and their sporadically good pizza. Unfortunately, none of them are from he last 3-4 years. That brings me to quality of food. It used to be that we knew exactly what we would get when we ordered and it would be delicious. Lately, we've been lucky if it's edible. I had the manager tell me that being able to pick apart individual strands of non melted cheese was their style... When I told them I've been eating there for years and the pizza was obviously not cooked enough, I got an eye roll. I didn't even ask for a new pizza, just to finish cooking it! I'd much rather eat a decent enough deep dish, that doesn't take forever with terrible service, somewhere else. Open more chains or something, hire better staff and managers! I love you Pequods! Until you change though, I won't even go to use up a gift card..

I am not sure what happened to this place. We used to always order from here Bc it was amazing. Being on a strict diet lately, I haven't ordered pizza in awhile. I decided to splurge and ordered a deep dish pepperoni.  I can not even describe how awful it was. I have lived in this city 15 years and never had deep dish this bad. The dough tasted stale. It was so soggy that it was following apart. The pepperoni did not taste the same. The sauce tasted like a can of unseasoned tomato sauce. I could not even eat it. Had a half of piece.  And of course the best part, as every reviewer complains about, was that I waited 1.5 hours for this dog food. I will absolutely never order from here again. Lou Malnatis is the best and pequods is not even near the same level as their deep dish.  Save yourself the headache and order from Lous
Pequods has terrible service, extremely long wait times and below average pizza. If I never have to go near this place again it will be too soon. Not worth the hype.

Pequods!  Say that to anyone and you'll put a smile on their face. The pizza is not the best deep dish in Chicago, but it is up there. And when you consider the atmosphere and the location, it is a winner.  I love the drinking bird which is right next door. They have amazing cocktails.  So back to pequods.. the lunch special can't be beat. I think it is $6 for a personal deep dish and a beer. Ask yourself why you don't go there every day for lunch. Oh yeah. It takes 45 min for the pizza and you have things to do.  Anyways. It is a fun place to go, especially with a group or folks from out of town.

OMG that caramelized cheese! This pizza has all the makings of the familiar Chicago speciality deep dish, yet manages to be unique in a sea of ordinary. I recommend sausage and giardiniera. Expect to wait, but it is totally worth it.
Best pizza in Chicago. If you don't like it at first, keep coming back.  Their delivery area is SO LARGE and it takes 90 mins usually, but no pizza is better.

Been here several times but this is my first review.  My wife and I love the pizza here.  Best in the city in my opinion.  Their sausage and pepperoni are the best I've ever had.  It was the downfall of my waist line when I found out they delivered to my old neighborhood.  We now live in central Pennsylvania where good pizza does not exist, so any time we are in town this is a place we must stop.

I've heard a lot of hype about this place and finally got around to checking it out since I was in the area. Can't say I was pleased. I ordered a medium deep dish with jalapeños and onions and easy cheese. First thing I notice was the bread/dough was really really dry. It was fluffy but had lost literally all of its moisture. Plus they kinda started to burn the bottom. As I pushed through the second slice I noticed the sauce wasn't that sweet and was heavy in some spice/seasoning that that began to make it overwhelming and I barely finished. I started to feel sick because of this and all of the water I had to drink to counter the dry bread. Best thing I could say was the jalapeños were spicy. Service was okay but since we didn't order much we rarely saw the waitress. But it was also busy so that could be why. Can't say I'll recommend this place. Lou Malnati's in my opinion still has the best deep dish pizza in the city. Hell the frozen Roundry's pizza I got from Mariano's was better. But that's just my two cents and I'm sure others will totally disagree with me. I just can't say I'd understand their point of view.

Pequod's has very good deep dish pizza and the crust is what distinguishes it from other pizzerias in the city (though keep in mind that the crust is harder and maybe a little more blackened than other crusts).  The wait can be especially long but you can always order the pizza to go and browse the shelves at Barnes and Noble or another location while you wait.  The atmosphere is nice as well - it is a smaller restaurant than a Gino's East or Lou Malnati's but it also makes the experience a different one than going to a regular chain.

Pizza is hands down the best deep dish in Chicago (as long as extra sauce is added), HOWEVER the service is consistently severely lacking.  Tonight, the to go staff was disorganized beyond belief.  With friends visiting from out of town, we didn't mind waiting the 1 hr 45 minute quote time to pick up our pizza.  It was the 32 minutes from arriving at Peaquods until walking out the door with our pizza while my visiting friend and his child sat in the car that was unacceptable.    Our experience was not unique - the person next to me was waiting for over 45 minutes.  The deep dish is delicious, but the service will leave a  bitter taste in your mouth.
